[John Beaver]175-john beaver lived with [[his]175-john beaver mother]377-his mother at [the house in [Sussex Gardens]1-sussex gardens]378-the house in sussex gardens where [they]379-they had moved after [[his]175-john beaver father]380-his father 's death . [It]378-the house in sussex gardens was crowded with the unsaleable furniture of [two larger houses]382-two larger houses , without pretension to any period , least of all to the present . [Beaver]170-beaver had [a dark little sitting - room]385-a dark little sitting - room ( on the ground floor , behind [the dining - room]386-the dining - room ) and [his]175-john beaver own telephone . [The elderly parlourmaid]387-the elderly parlourmaid looked after [his]175-john beaver clothes . There were [four servants]390-four servants , [all female and all]391-all female and all , save [one , elderly]392-one , elderly .

When [anyone]2344-anyone asked [Beaver]170-beaver why [he]175-john beaver stayed [there]394-there instead of setting up on [his]175-john beaver own , [he]175-john beaver sometimes said that [he]175-john beaver thought [[his]175-john beaver mother]377-his mother liked having [him]175-john beaver [there]394-there ( in spite of [her]377-his mother business [she]377-his mother was lonely ) ; sometimes that it saved [him]175-john beaver at least five pounds a week .

[His]175-john beaver total income varied around six pounds a week , so this was an important saving .

[He]175-john beaver was twenty - five years old . From leaving [Oxford]2-oxford until the beginning of the slump [he]175-john beaver had worked in [an advertising agency]397-an advertising agency . Since then [no one]2345-no one had been able to find anything for [him]175-john beaver to do . So [he]175-john beaver got up late and sat near [his]175-john beaver telephone most of the day , hoping to be rung up .

Whenever it was possible , [Mrs Beaver]170-beaver took an hour off in the middle of the morning . [She]170-beaver was always at [[her]170-beaver shop]399-her shop punctually at nine , and by half - past eleven [she]170-beaver needed a break . At one o'clock [Beaver]170-beaver despaired . The air of antiquity pervading [Bratt 's]179-bratt , derived from [[its]179-bratt elegant Georgian fa?ade , and [finely panelled rooms]425-finely panelled rooms]424-its elegant georgian fa?ade , and finely panelled rooms , was entirely spurious , for it was [a club of recent origin , founded in [the burst of bonhomie]427-the burst of bonhomie]426-a club of recent origin , founded in the burst of bonhomie immediately after the war . " No , [I]187-jock 'm no good at lunch parties . Besides , [I]187-jock decided when [I]187-jock got up that [I]187-jock 'd have oysters here . "[187-jock]

[The barman]439-the barman came with the drinks .

[Beaver]191-beaver went [downstairs]441-downstairs but before going into [the dining - room]386-the dining - room [he]191-beaver told [the porter]443-the porter to ring up [[his]191-beaver home]444-his home and see if there was any message for [him]191-beaver .

It was just after half - past one when [he]191-beaver left [Bratt]179-bratt 's and walked at a good pace towards [Hill Street]8-hill street .

CHAPTER II ENGLISH GOTHIC

[ I ]

_ Between [the villages of Hetton]445-the villages of hetton and [Compton]9-compton Last lies [the extensive park of [Hetton Abbey]10-hetton abbey]446-the extensive park of hetton abbey . [This]447-this , formerly [one of [the notable houses of [the county]450-the county]449-the notable houses of the county]448-one of the notable houses of the county , was entirely rebuilt in 1864 in the Gothic style and is now devoid of interest . [The grounds]451-the grounds are open to [the public]452-the public daily until sunset and [the house]2368-the house may be viewed on application by writing . [It]2368-the house contains some good portraits and furniture . [The terrace]454-the terrace commands a fine view . _

This passage from the county Guide Book did not cause [Tony]184-tony Last any serious annoyance . Unkinder things had been said . [[His]184-tony Aunt]455-his aunt [Frances]195-frances , embittered by an upbringing of unremitting severity , remarked that the plans of [the house]2368-the house must have been adapted by [Mr Pecksniff]196-mr pecksniff from one of [[his]184-tony pupils]457-his pupils " designs for [an orphanage]2401-an orphanage . But there was not a glazed brick or encaustic tile that was not dear to [Tony]184-tony 's heart . In some ways , [he]184-tony knew , it was not convenient to run ; but what [big house]2402-big house was ? [It]2402-big house was not altogether amenable to modern ideas of comfort ; [he]184-tony had many small improvements in mind , which would be put into effect as soon as the death duties were paid off . But the general aspect and atmosphere of [the place]2391-the place ; the line of [its]2391-the place battlements against the sky ; [the central clock tower where quarterly chimes disturbed all but the heaviest sleepers]2404-the central clock tower where quarterly chimes disturbed all but the heaviest sleepers ; the ecclesiastical gloom of [the great hall]2405-the great hall , [its]2405-the great hall ceiling groined and painted in diapers of red and gold , supported on shafts of polished granite with vine - wreathed capitals , half - lit by day through lancet windows of armorial stained glass , at night by a vast gasolier of brass and wrought iron , wired now and fitted with twenty electric bulbs ; the blasts of hot air that rose suddenly at one 's feet , through grills of cast - iron trefoils from the antiquated heating apparatus below ; the cavernous chill of [the more remote corridors]2406-the more remote corridors where , economizing in coke , [he]184-tony had had the pipes shut off ; [the dining - hall]2407-the dining - hall with [its]2405-the great hall hammer - beam roof and pitch - pine minstrels "[196-mr pecksniff] gallery ; [the bedrooms]2348-the bedrooms with [their]2348-the bedrooms brass bedsteads , each with a frieze of Gothic text , each named from [Malory]11-malory , Yseult , [Elaine]197-elaine , [Mordred]198-mordred and [Merlin]199-merlin , [Gawaine]200-gawaine and [Bedivere]201-bedivere , [Lancelot]202-lancelot , [Perceval]203-perceval , [Tristram]204-tristram , Galahad , [[his]459-he own dressing - room]460-his own dressing - room , [Morgan le Fay]205-morgan le fay , and [[Brenda]233-brenda 's Guinevere]12-brenda 's guinevere , where the bed stood on a dais , the walls were hung with tapestry , the fireplace was like a tomb of the thirteenth century , from whose bay window [one]2349-one could count , on days of exceptional clearness , the spires of [six churches]462-six churches -- all these things with which [he]459-he had grown up were a source of constant delight and exultation to [Tony]184-tony ; things of tender memory and proud possession .

They were not in the fashion , [he]459-he fully realized . Twenty years ago [people]2364-people had liked half timber and old pewter ; now it was urns and colonnades ; but the time would come , perhaps in [John Andrew]174-john 's day , when opinion would reinstate [Hetton]7-hetton in [its]7-hetton proper place . Already it was referred to as " amusing "[464-a very civil young man] , and [a very civil young man]464-a very civil young man had asked permission to photograph it for an architectural review .

* * * * *

The ceiling of [Morgan le Fay]205-morgan le fay was not in perfect repair . In order to make an appearance of coffered wood , moulded slats had been nailed in a chequer across the plaster . They were painted in chevrons of blue and gold . The squares between were decorated alternately with Tudor roses and fleurs - de - lis . But damp had penetrated into one corner , leaving a large patch where the gilt had tarnished and the colour flaked away ; in another place the wooden laths had become warped and separated from the plaster . Lying in bed , in the grave ten minutes between waking and ringing , [Tony]184-tony studied these defects and resolved anew to have them put right . [He]184-tony wondered whether it would be easy , nowadays , to find [craftsmen capable of such delicate work]465-craftsmen capable of such delicate work .

[Morgan le Fay]205-morgan le fay had been [[his]184-tony room]466-his room since [he]184-tony left [the night - nursery]467-the night - nursery . [He]184-tony had been put [there]394-there so that [he]184-tony would be within calling distance of [[his]184-tony parents]469-his parents ( inseparable in [Guinevere]206-guinevere ) , for until quite late in [his]184-tony life [he]184-tony was subject to nightmares . [He]184-tony had taken nothing from [the room]470-the room since [he]184-tony had slept [there]394-there , but every year added to [its]470-the room contents , so that [it]470-the room now formed a gallery representative of every phase of [his]184-tony adolescence -- the framed picture of a dreadnought ( a coloured supplement from _ Chums _ ) , all its guns spouting flame and smoke ; a photographic group of [[his]184-tony private school]472-his private school ; a cabinet called " [the Museum]2408-the museum "[469-his parents] , filled with the fruits of a dozen desultory hobbies , eggs , butterflies , fossils , coins ; [[his]184-tony parents]469-his parents , in the leather diptych which had stood by [his]184-tony bed at [school]474-school ; [Brenda]233-brenda , eight years ago when [he]184-tony had been trying to get engaged to [her]233-brenda ; [Brenda]233-brenda with [John]174-john , taken just after the christening ; an aquatint of [Hetton]7-hetton , as [it]7-hetton had stood until [[his]184-tony great - grandfather]475-his great - grandfather demolished [it]7-hetton ; some shelves of books , _ Bevis _ , _ Woodwork at [Home]402-home _ , _ Conjuring for All _ , _ [The Young Visiters]477-the young visiters _ , _ The Law of [Landlord and Tenant]478-landlord and tenant _ , _ Farewell to Arms _ .

* * * * *

All over [England]13-england [people]2364-people were waking up , queasy and despondent . [Tony]184-tony lay for ten minutes very happily planning the renovation of [his]184-tony ceiling . Then [he]184-tony rang the bell .

" Has [[her]233-brenda ladyship]2409-her ladyship been called yet ? "[184-tony]

" About a quarter of an hour ago , [sir]2372-sir . "[184-tony]

[He]184-tony put on [his]184-tony dressing - gown and slippers and went through into [Guinevere]206-guinevere .

[Brenda]233-brenda lay on the dais .

[She]233-brenda had insisted on a modern bed . [Her]233-brenda tray was beside [her]233-brenda and the quilt was littered with envelopes , letters and the daily papers . [Her]233-brenda head was propped against a very small blue pillow ; clean of make - up , [her]233-brenda face was almost colourless , rose - pearl , scarcely deeper in tone than [her]233-brenda arms and neck .

" Well ? "[184-tony] said [Tony]184-tony .

" [Kiss]207-kiss . "[233-brenda]

[He]184-tony sat by the tray at the head of the bed ; [she]233-brenda leant forward to [him]184-tony ( a nereid emerging from fathomless depths of clear water ) . [She]233-brenda turned [her]233-brenda lips away and rubbed against [his]184-tony cheek like a cat . It was a way [she]233-brenda had .

" Anything interesting ? "[233-brenda]

[He]184-tony picked up some of the letters .

" [I]233-brenda think [you]184-tony 'd better , [we]2414-we have n't done anything for [him]174-john for a long time . "[233-brenda]

Then [[Brenda]233-brenda 's maid]480-brenda 's maid brought in the other tray . [He]481-he had it put by the window seat , and began opening [his]481-he letters . " Sorry . "[184-tony]

( These scenes of domestic playfulness had been more or less continuous in [Tony]184-tony and [Brenda]233-brenda 's life for seven years . )

Outside , it was soft English weather ; mist in [the hollows]484-the hollows and pale sunshine on [the hills]485-the hills ; [the coverts]486-the coverts had ceased dripping , for there were no leaves to hold the recent rain , but the undergrowth was wet , dark in the shadows , iridescent where the sun caught it ; [the lanes]487-the lanes were soggy and there was water running in the ditches .

[John Andrew]174-john sat [his]174-john pony , solemn and stiff as [a Lifeguard]488-a lifeguard , while [Ben]212-ben fixed the jump . [Thunderclap]213-thunderclap had been a present on [his]212-ben sixth birthday from [Uncle Reggie]182-uncle reggie . It was [John]174-john who had named [her]213-thunderclap , after lengthy consultation . Originally [she]213-thunderclap had been called [Christabelle]214-christabelle which , as [Ben]212-ben said , was more the name for a hound than a horse . [Ben]212-ben had known a strawberry roan called Thunderclap who killed [two riders]489-two riders and won the local point - to - point four years running . [He]490-he had been a lovely little horse , said [Ben]212-ben , till [he]212-ben staked [himself]212-ben in the guts , hunting , and had to be shot . [Ben]212-ben knew stories about a great many different horses . There was one called Zero on whom [he]212-ben had won five Jimmy - o - goblins at ten to three at [Chester]17-chester one year . And there was [a mule [he]212-ben had known during the war , called [Peppermint]215-peppermint , who had died of drinking [the company]492-the company 's rum ration]491-a mule he had known during the war , called peppermint , who had died of drinking the company 's rum ration . But [John]174-john was not going to name [his]174-john pony after [a drunken mule]493-a drunken mule . So in the end [they]494-they had decided on [Thunderclap]213-thunderclap , in spite of [her]213-thunderclap imperturbable disposition .

[She]213-thunderclap was a dark bay , with long tail and mane . [Ben]212-ben had left [her]213-thunderclap legs shaggy . [She]213-thunderclap cropped the grass , resisting [John]174-john 's attempts to keep [her]213-thunderclap head up .

Before [her]213-thunderclap arrival riding had been a very different thing . [He]212-ben had jogged round [the paddock]495-the paddock on a little Shetland pony called [Bunny]216-bunny , with [[his]212-ben nurse]496-his nurse panting at the bridle . Now it was [a man]414-a man 's business . [Nanny]217-nanny sat at a distance , crocheting , on [her]217-nanny camp stool ; out of earshot . There had been a corresponding promotion in [Ben]212-ben 's position . From being the hand who looked after the farm horses , [he]212-ben was now , perceptibly , assuming the air of [a stud groom]498-a stud groom . The handkerchief round [his]212-ben neck gave place to a stock with a fox - head pin . [He]212-ben was [a man of varied experience in [other parts of [the country]501-the country]500-other parts of the country]499-a man of varied experience in other parts of the country .

Neither [Tony]184-tony nor [Brenda]233-brenda hunted but [they]502-they were anxious that [John]174-john should like it . [Ben]212-ben foresaw the time when [the stables]503-the stables would be full and [himself]212-ben in authority ; it would not be like [Mr Last]504-mr last to get [anyone]2344-anyone in from outside .

[Ben]212-ben had got two posts bored for iron pegs , and a white - washed rail . With these [he]212-ben erected a two - foot jump in the middle of [the field]506-the field .

" Now take it quite easy . Canter up slow and when [she]213-thunderclap takes off lean forward in the saddle and [you]212-ben 'll be over like a bird . Keep [her]213-thunderclap head straight at it . "[212-ben]

[Thunderclap]213-thunderclap trotted forwards , cantered two paces , thought better of it and , just before the jump , fell into a trot again and swerved round the obstacle . [John]174-john recovered [his]174-john balance by dropping the reins and gripping the mane with both hands ; [he]174-john looked guiltily at [Ben]212-ben , who said , " What d'you suppose [your]212-ben bloody legs are for ? Here , take this and just give [her]213-thunderclap a tap when [you]212-ben get up to it ! "[174-john] [He]212-ben handed [John]174-john a switch .

[Nanny]217-nanny sat by the gate re - reading a letter from [[her]217-nanny sister]507-her sister .

[John]174-john took [Thunderclap]213-thunderclap back and tried the jump again . This time [they]508-they made straight for the rail .

[Ben]212-ben shouted " Legs ! "[212-ben] and [John]174-john kicked sturdily , losing [his]174-john stirrups . [Ben]212-ben raised [his]212-ben arms as if scaring crows . [Thunderclap]213-thunderclap jumped ; [John]174-john rose from the saddle and landed on [his]174-john back in the grass .

[Nanny]217-nanny rose in alarm . " Oh , what 's happened , [Mr Hacket]218-mr hacket , is [he]174-john hurt ? "[217-nanny]

" [He]174-john 's all right , "[212-ben] said [Ben]212-ben .

" [I]174-john 'm all right , "[174-john] said [John]174-john , " [I]174-john think [she]217-nanny put in a short step . "[174-john]

" Short step [[my]217-nanny grandmother]2440-my grandmother . [You]174-john just opened [your]174-john bloody legs and took an arser . Keep hold on to the reins next time . [You]174-john can lose a hunt that way . "[217-nanny]

At the third attempt [John]174-john got over and found [himself]174-john breathless and insecure , one stirrup swinging loose and one hand grabbing its old support in the mane , but still in the saddle .

" There , how did that feel ? [You]174-john just skimmed over like a swallow . Try it again ? "[217-nanny]

Twice more [John]174-john and [Thunderclap]213-thunderclap went over the little rail , then [nanny]2412-nanny called that it was time to go indoors for [his]174-john milk . [They]510-they walked the pony back to [the stable]511-the stable . [Nanny]217-nanny said , " Oh dear , look at all the mud on [your]174-john coat . "[217-nanny]

[Ben]212-ben said , " [We]510-they 'll have [you]174-john riding [the winner]2441-the winner at [Aintree]18-aintree soon . "[212-ben]

" Good morning , [Mr Hacket]218-mr hacket . "[217-nanny]

" Good morning , [miss]2442-miss . "[212-ben]

" Good - bye , [Ben]212-ben , may [I]217-nanny come and see [you]212-ben doing the farm horses this evening ? "[217-nanny]

" That 's not for [me]212-ben to say . [You]212-ben must ask [nanny]2443-nanny . Tell [you]212-ben what though , the grey carthorse has got worms . Would [you]212-ben like to see [me]212-ben give [him]2441-the winner a pill ? "[212-ben]

" Oh yes ; please , [nanny]2412-nanny , may [I]217-nanny ? "[217-nanny]

Although [they]519-i were both in good health and of unexceptional figure , [Tony]219-tony and [Brenda]233-brenda were on a diet . Farther down [the passage]555-the passage [Beaver]191-beaver examined [[his]191-beaver room]466-his room , with the care of [an experienced guest]557-an experienced guest . There was no reading lamp . The inkpot was dry . The fire had been lit but had gone out . [The bathroom]558-the bathroom , [he]191-beaver had already discovered , was a great distance away , up a flight of turret steps . [He]191-beaver did not at all like the look or feel of the bed ; the springs were broken in the centre and it creaked ominously when [he]191-beaver lay down to try it . The return ticket , third - class , had been eighteen shillings . Then there would be tips .

Owing to [Tony]219-tony 's feeling of guilt [they]559-they had champagne for dinner , which neither [he]219-tony nor [Brenda]233-brenda particularly liked . " D'you like to be called in the morning ? "[191-beaver]

" May [I]191-beaver ring ? "[191-beaver]

" Certainly . Got everything [you]191-beaver want ? "[191-beaver]

" Yes , thanks . Good night . "[191-beaver]

" Good night . "[191-beaver]

But when [he]191-beaver got back [he]191-beaver said , " [You]233-brenda know , [I]191-beaver feel awful about [Beaver]191-beaver . "[191-beaver]

" Oh , [Beaver]191-beaver 's all right , "[233-brenda] said [Brenda]233-brenda .

But [he]191-beaver was far from being comfortable and as [he]191-beaver rolled patiently about the bed in quest of a position in which it was possible to go to sleep , [he]191-beaver reflected that , since [he]191-beaver had no intention of coming to [the house]2368-the house again , [he]191-beaver would give [the butler]564-the butler nothing and only five shillings to [the footman who was looking after [him]191-beaver]565-the footman who was looking after him . Presently [he]191-beaver adapted [himself]191-beaver to the rugged topography of the mattress and dozed , fitfully , until morning . But the new day began dismally with the information that all the Sunday papers had already gone to [[[her]566-her ladyship]2409-her ladyship 's room]568-her ladyship 's room .

* * * * *

[Tony]219-tony invariably wore a dark suit on Sundays and a stiff white collar . [He]219-tony went to [church]569-church , where [he]219-tony sat in a large pitch - pine pew , put in by [[his]219-tony great - grandfather]475-his great - grandfather at the time of rebuilding [the house]2368-the house , furnished with very high crimson hassocks and a fireplace , complete with iron grate and a little poker which [[his]219-tony father]380-his father used to rattle when any point in the sermon excited [his]380-his father disapproval . Since [[his]219-tony father]380-his father 's day a fire had not been laid [there]394-there ; [Tony]219-tony had it in mind to revive the practice next winter . On Christmas Day and Harvest Thanksgiving [Tony]219-tony read the lessons from the back of the brass eagle .

When service was over [he]219-tony stood for a few minutes at [the porch]515-the porch chatting affably with [[the vicar]576-the vicar 's sister]577-the vicar 's sister and [the people from [the village]579-the village]578-the people from the village . Then [he]219-tony returned [home]402-home by [a path]581-a path across [the fields]582-the fields which led to a side door in [the walled garden]583-the walled garden ; [he]219-tony visited [the hothouses]584-the hothouses and picked [himself]219-tony a buttonhole , stopped by [[the gardeners]585-the gardeners ' cottages]586-the gardeners ' cottages for a few words ( the smell of Sunday dinners rising warm and overpowering from the little doorways ) and then , rather solemnly , drank a glass of sherry in [the library]587-the library . That was the simple , mildly ceremonious order of [his]219-tony Sunday morning , which had evolved , more or less spontaneously , from the more severe practices of [[his]219-tony parents]469-his parents ; [he]219-tony adhered to it with great satisfaction . [Brenda]233-brenda teased [him]219-tony whenever [she]233-brenda caught [him]219-tony posing as [an upright , God - fearing gentleman of the old school]589-an upright , god - fearing gentleman of the old school and [Tony]219-tony saw the joke , but this did not at all diminish the pleasure [he]219-tony derived from [his]219-tony weekly routine , or [his]219-tony annoyance when the presence of [guests]590-guests suspended it .

For this reason [his]219-tony heart sank when , emerging from [[his]219-tony study]549-his study into [the great hall]2405-the great hall at a quarter to eleven , [he]219-tony met [Beaver]191-beaver already dressed and prepared to be entertained ; it was only a momentary vexation , however , for while [he]219-tony wished [him]191-beaver good morning [he]219-tony noticed that [[his]219-tony guest]547-his guest had an _ A.B.C. _ in [his]191-beaver hands and was clearly looking out [a train]594-a train .

" [I]219-tony hope [you]547-his guest slept all right ? "[219-tony]

" Beautifully , "[191-beaver] said [Beaver]191-beaver , though [his]191-beaver wan expression did not confirm the word .

" [I]219-tony 'm so glad . [I]219-tony always sleep well [here]2433-here [myself]219-tony . [I]219-tony say , [I]219-tony do n't like the look of that train guide . [I]219-tony hope [you]547-his guest were n't thinking of leaving [us]2520-us yet ? "[219-tony]

" Alas , [I]219-tony 've got to get up to - night , [I]219-tony 'm afraid . "[219-tony]

" That 'll do fine . "[219-tony]

" Quite sure . "[219-tony]

The church bells were ringing across [the park]595-the park .

[Beaver]191-beaver always did what was expected of [him]191-beaver when [he]191-beaver was staying away , even on a visit as unsatisfactory as the present one . " Oh yes , [I]219-tony should like to very much . "[219-tony]

" No , really , [I]219-tony should n't if [I]219-tony were [you]547-his guest . [You]547-his guest would n't enjoy it . [I]219-tony only go because [I]219-tony more or less have to . The bells were clear and clamorous in [the drive]2461-the drive and [Tony]219-tony walked briskly towards [them]598-them . Presently [they]598-them ceased and gave place to a single note , warning [the village]579-the village that there was only five minutes to go before [the organist started the first hymn]600-the organist started the first hymn .

[He]219-tony caught up [nanny]601-nanny and [John]174-john , also on [their]602-their way to [church]569-church . [John]174-john was in one of [his]174-john rare , confidential moods ; [he]174-john put [his]174-john small gloved hand into [Tony]219-tony 's and , without introduction , embarked upon a story which lasted [them]602-their all the way to the [church]569-church door ; it dealt with the mule Peppermint who had drunk [the company]492-the company 's rum ration , near Wipers in 1917 ; it was told breathlessly , as [John]174-john trotted to keep pace with [[his]174-john father]380-his father . At the end , [Tony]219-tony said , " How very sad . "[219-tony]

" Well , _ [I]219-tony _ thought it was sad too , but it is n't . [Ben]212-ben said it made [him]219-tony laugh fit to bust [his]219-tony pants . "[219-tony]

The bell had stopped and [the organist]607-the organist was watching from behind [his]607-the organist curtain for [Tony]219-tony 's arrival . [He]219-tony walked ahead up [the aisle]608-the aisle , [nanny]2412-nanny and [John]174-john following . In the pew [he]219-tony occupied one of the armchairs ; [they]602-their sat on the bench at [his]219-tony back . "[607-the organist] The service followed its course . As [Tony]219-tony inhaled the agreeable , slightly musty atmosphere and performed the familiar motions of sitting , standing and leaning forward , [his]219-tony thoughts drifted from subject to subject , among the events of the past week and [his]219-tony plans for the future . Occasionally some arresting phrase in the liturgy would recall [him]219-tony to [his]219-tony surroundings , but for the most part that morning [he]219-tony occupied [himself]219-tony with the question of [bathrooms]2388-bathrooms and [lavatories]612-lavatories , and of how more of them could best be introduced without disturbing the character of [[his]219-tony house]613-his house .

[The village postmaster]614-the village postmaster took round the collecting bag . [Tony]219-tony put in [his]219-tony half - crown ; [John]174-john and [nanny]2412-nanny [their]616-their pennies .

[The vicar]576-the vicar climbed , with some effort , into the pulpit . [He]219-tony was [an elderly man who had served in [India]27-india most of [his]219-tony life]618-an elderly man who had served in india most of his life . [[Tony]219-tony 's father]619-tony 's father had given [him]219-tony the living at the instance of [[his]219-tony dentist]620-his dentist . [He]219-tony had a noble and sonorous voice and was reckoned [the best preacher for many miles around]621-the best preacher for many miles around .

[His]219-tony sermons had been composed in [his]219-tony more active days for delivery at [the garrison chapel]622-the garrison chapel ; [he]219-tony had done nothing to adapt them to the changed conditions of [his]219-tony ministry and they mostly concluded with some reference to [homes]623-homes and dear ones far away . [The villagers]624-the villagers did not find this in any way surprising . Few of the things said in [church]569-church seemed to have any particular reference to [themselves]624-the villagers . [They]624-the villagers enjoyed [[their]624-the villagers [vicar]627-vicar]626-their vicar 's sermons very much and [they]624-the villagers knew that when [he]219-tony began about [[their]624-the villagers distant homes]628-their distant homes , it was time to be dusting [their]624-the villagers knees and feeling for [their]624-the villagers umbrellas .

" ... As the gathering between [porch]644-porch and [lychgate]645-lychgate began to disperse , [Tony]219-tony set off towards [the gardens]646-the gardens . Shafts of November sunshine streamed down from lancet and oriel , tinctured in green and gold , gules and azure by the emblazoned coats , broken by the leaded devices into countless points and patches of coloured light . [Brenda]233-brenda descended the great staircase step by step through alternations of dusk and rainbow . [Beaver]191-beaver was well practised in the art of being shown over [houses]653-houses ; [he]191-beaver had been brought up to it in fact , ever since [he]191-beaver had begun to accompany [[his]191-beaver mother]377-his mother , whose hobby it had always been , and later , with changing circumstances , profession . [He]191-beaver made apt and appreciative comments and greatly enhanced the pleasure [Tony]219-tony always took in exposing [his]219-tony treasures .

[They]652-they saw it all : [the shuttered drawing - room]655-the shuttered drawing - room , like [a school speech hall]656-a school speech hall , the cloistral passages , [the dark inner courtyard]657-the dark inner courtyard , [the chapel]658-the chapel where , until [Tony]219-tony 's succession , family prayers had been daily read to [the assembled household]659-the assembled household , [the plate - room and [estate office]661-estate office]660-the plate - room and estate office , [the bedrooms]2348-the bedrooms and [attics]663-attics , the water - tank concealed among the battlements . [ II ]

If [Brenda]233-brenda had to go to [London]23-london for a day 's shopping , hair - cutting , or bone - setting ( a recreation [she]233-brenda particularly enjoyed ) , [she]233-brenda went on Wednesday , because the tickets on that day were half the usual price . [She]233-brenda left at eight in the morning and got [home]402-home soon after ten at night . [She]233-brenda travelled third - class and [the carriages]680-the carriages were often full , because [other wives on the line]681-other wives on the line took advantage of the cheap fare . [She]233-brenda usually spent the day with [[her]233-brenda younger sister]682-her younger sister , [Marjorie]228-marjorie , who was married to [the prospective Conservative candidate for [a South London constituency of strong Labour]684-a south london constituency of strong labour sympathies]683-the prospective conservative candidate for a south london constituency of strong labour sympathies . [Polly]223-polly 's party was exactly what [she]233-brenda wished it to be , an accurate replica of all the best parties [she]233-brenda had been to in the last year ; [the same band]789-the same band , the same supper and , above all , [the same guests]790-the same guests . [Hers]233-brenda was not the ambition to create a sensation , to have the party talked about in months to come for any unusual feature , to hunt out [shy celebrities]791-shy celebrities or introduce [exotic strangers]792-exotic strangers . [She]233-brenda wanted a perfectly straight , smart party and [she]233-brenda had got it . [Practically everyone [she]233-brenda asked]793-practically everyone she asked had come . For [them]869-people with whom she had the barest acquaintance [her]233-brenda circumstances shed peculiar glamour ; for five years [she]233-brenda had been a legendary , almost ghostly name , [the imprisoned princess of fairy story]873-the imprisoned princess of fairy story , and now that [she]233-brenda had emerged there was more enchantment in the occurrence than in the mere change of habit of [any other circumspect wife]874-any other circumspect wife . [Beaver]170-beaver and [[his]890-you mother]377-his mother were going to [Ireland]47-ireland for Christmas , to stay with [cousins]892-cousins . [Tony]219-tony and [Brenda]233-brenda had a family party at [Hetton]7-hetton : [Marjorie]228-marjorie and [Allan]239-allan , [[Brenda]233-brenda 's mother]893-brenda 's mother , [Tony]219-tony 's Aunt [Frances]195-frances and [two families of impoverished Lasts]894-two families of impoverished lasts , [humble and uncomplaining victims of primogeniture]895-humble and uncomplaining victims of primogeniture , to whom [Hetton]7-hetton meant as much as it did to [Tony]219-tony . There was a little Christmas - tree in [the nursery]2452-the nursery for [John Andrew]174-john and a big one downstairs in [the central hall]897-the central hall which was decorated by [the impoverished Lasts]898-the impoverished lasts and lit up for half an hour after tea ( [two footmen standing by with wet sponges on the end of poles]899-two footmen standing by with wet sponges on the end of poles , to extinguish the candles which turned turtle and threatened to start a fire ) . There were presents for [all the servants]900-all the servants , of value strictly graded according to [their]900-all the servants rank , and for [all the guests]901-all the guests ( cheques for [the impoverished Lasts]250-the impoverished lasts ) . [Allan]239-allan always brought a large cro?te of foie gras , a delicacy of which [he]239-allan was particularly fond . [Everyone]2366-everyone ate a great deal and became slightly torpid towards Boxing - day evening ; silver ladles of burning brandy went round the table , crackers were pulled and opened ; paper hats , indoor fireworks , mottoes . This year , everything happened in its accustomed way ; nothing seemed to menace the peace and stability of [the house]2368-the house . [The choir]632-the choir came up and sang carols in [the pitch - pine gallery]905-the pitch - pine gallery , and later devoured hot punch and sweet biscuits . [The vicar]576-the vicar preached [his]576-the vicar usual Christmas sermon . It was one to which [[his]576-the vicar parishioners]907-his parishioners were greatly attached .

" How difficult it is for [us]908-his congregation , "[576-the vicar] [he]576-the vicar began , blandly surveying [[his]576-the vicar congregation]908-his congregation , who coughed into [their]908-his congregation mufflers and chafed [their]908-his congregation chilblains under [their]908-his congregation woollen gloves , " to realize that this is indeed Christmas . Instead of the glowing log fire and windows tight shuttered against the drifting snow , [we]908-his congregation have only the harsh glare of an alien sun ; instead of the happy circle of loved faces , of [home]402-home and [family]2746-family , [we]908-his congregation have the uncomprehending stares of [the subjugated , though no doubt grateful , heathen]2747-the subjugated , though no doubt grateful , heathen . Instead of the placid ox and ass of [Bethlehem]251-bethlehem , "[576-the vicar] said [the vicar]576-the vicar , slightly losing the thread of [his]576-the vicar comparisons , " [we]908-his congregation have for [companions the ravening tiger and the exotic camel]2748-companions the ravening tiger and the exotic camel , [the furtive jackal]2749-the furtive jackal and the ponderous elephant ... "[576-the vicar] And so on , through the pages of faded manuscript . The words had temporarily touched the heart of [many an obdurate trooper]910-many an obdurate trooper , and hearing them again , as [he]576-the vicar had heard them year after year since [Mr Tendril]252-mr tendril had come to [the parish]911-the parish , [Tony]219-tony and [most of [[Tony]219-tony 's guests]913-tony 's guests]912-most of tony 's guests felt that it was an integral part of [their]914-their Christmas festivities ; one with which [they]914-their would find it very hard to dispense . " The ravening tiger and exotic camel "[915-the family] had long been bywords in [the family]915-the family , of frequent recurrence in all [their]915-the family games .

These games were the hardest part for [Brenda]233-brenda . They did not amuse [her]233-brenda and [she]233-brenda still could not see [Tony]219-tony dressed up for charades without a feeling of shyness . Moreover , [she]233-brenda was tortured by the fear that any lack of gusto on [her]233-brenda part might be construed by [the poor Lasts]250-the impoverished lasts as superiority . These scruples , had [she]233-brenda known it , were quite superfluous , for it never occurred to [[[her]233-brenda husband]916-her husband 's relatives]917-her husband 's relatives to look on [her]233-brenda with anything but cousinly cordiality and a certain tolerance , for , as Lasts , [they]917-her husband 's relatives considered [they]917-her husband 's relatives had far more right in [Hetton]7-hetton than [herself]233-brenda . [Aunt Frances]195-frances , with acid mind , quickly discerned the trouble and attempted to reassure [her]233-brenda , saying , " [Dear child]2750-dear child , all these feelings of delicacy are valueless ; only [the rich]2751-the rich realize the gulf that separates [them]2751-the rich from [the poor]2752-the poor , "[195-frances] but the uneasiness persisted , and night after night [she]233-brenda found [herself]233-brenda being sent out of [the room]470-the room , asking or answering questions , performing actions in uncouth manners , paying forfeits , drawing pictures , writing verses , dressing [herself]233-brenda up and even being chased about [the house]2368-the house , and secluded in cupboards , at the will of [[her]233-brenda relatives]920-her relatives . Christmas was on a Friday that year , so the party was a long one , from Thursday until Monday .

[She]233-brenda had forbidden [Beaver]170-beaver to send [her]233-brenda a present or to write to [her]233-brenda ; in self - protection , for [she]233-brenda knew that whatever [he]921-he said would hurt [her]233-brenda by its poverty , but in spite of this [she]233-brenda awaited the posts nervously , hoping that [he]921-he might have disobeyed [her]233-brenda . [She]233-brenda had sent [him]921-he to [Ireland]47-ireland a ring of three interlocked hoops of gold and platinum . An hour after ordering it [she]233-brenda regretted [her]233-brenda choice . On Tuesday a letter came from [him]921-he thanking [her]233-brenda . _ Darling [Brenda]233-brenda _ , [he]921-he wrote . _ Thank [you]233-brenda so very much for the charming Christmas present . [You]233-brenda can imagine [my]0-winchester delight when [I]0-winchester saw the pink leather case and [my]0-winchester surprise at opening it . [I]0-winchester hope [your]233-brenda party is being a success . It is rather dull here . [The others]922-the others went hunting yesterday . [I]0-winchester went to the meet . [They]922-the others did not have a good day . [Mother]253-mother is here too and sends [her]253-mother love . [We]923-we shall be leaving to - morrow or the day after . [Mother]253-mother has got rather a cold . _

It ended there at the bottom of a page . [Beaver]170-beaver had been writing it before dinner and later had put it in the envelope without remembering to finish it .

[He]921-he wrote a large , school - girlish hand with wide spaces between the lines .

[Brenda]233-brenda felt a little sick when [she]233-brenda read this letter but [she]233-brenda showed it to [Marjorie]228-marjorie , saying , " [I]233-brenda ca n't complain , [he]219-tony 's never pretended to like [me]233-brenda much . And anyway it was a damned silly present . "[233-brenda]

[Tony]219-tony had become fretful about [his]219-tony visit to [Angela]209-angela 's . [He]219-tony always hated staying away .

" Do n't come , [darling]2359-darling . [I]233-brenda 'll make it all right with [them]924-they . "[233-brenda]

" No , [I]219-tony 'll come . [I]219-tony have n't seen so much of [you]2359-darling in the last three weeks . "[219-tony]

[They]924-they had the whole of Wednesday alone together . [Brenda]233-brenda exerted [herself]233-brenda and [Tony]219-tony 's fretfulness subsided . [She]233-brenda was particularly tender to [him]219-tony at this time and scarcely teased [him]219-tony at all .

"[233-brenda]

" It 's one better than [the bone - setters]2765-the bone - setters , "[219-tony] [Tony]219-tony admitted .

That was how the New Year began .

CHAPTER III HARD CHEESE ON [TONY]219-tony

[ [I]0-winchester ]

It is not uncommon at [[Bratt]179-bratt 's Club]2377-bratt 's club , between nine and ten in the evening , to find [men in white ties and tail coats]938-men in white ties and tail coats sitting by [themselves]938-men in white ties and tail coats and eating , in evident low spirits , large and extravagant dinners . [They]938-men in white ties and tail coats are [those who have been abandoned at the last minute by [[their]939-those who have been abandoned at the last minute by their women women]940-their women]939-those who have been abandoned at the last minute by their women . For twenty minutes or so [they]938-men in white ties and tail coats have sat in [the foyer of [some restaurant]942-some restaurant]941-the foyer of some restaurant , gazing expectantly towards the revolving doors and alternatively taking out [their]938-men in white ties and tail coats watches and ordering cocktails , until at length a telephone message has been brought [them]938-men in white ties and tail coats that [[their]938-men in white ties and tail coats guests]943-their guests are unable to come . Then [they]938-men in white ties and tail coats go to [Bratt 's]179-bratt , half hoping to find [friends]802-friends but , more often than not , taking a melancholy satisfaction in finding [the club]438-the club deserted or peopled by [strangers]946-strangers . So [they]938-men in white ties and tail coats sit there , round the walls , morosely regarding the mahogany tables before [them]938-men in white ties and tail coats , and eating and drinking heavily .

It was in this mood and for this reason that , one evening towards the middle of [February]49-february , [Jock Grant - Menzies]187-jock arrived at [the club]438-the club .

" [Anyone]2344-anyone [here]2433-here ? "[187-jock]

" Very quiet to - night , [sir]2372-sir . [Mr Last]254-mr last is in [the dining - room]386-the dining - room . "[187-jock]

[Jock]187-jock found [him]187-jock seated in a corner ; [he]187-jock was in day clothes ; the table and the chair at [his]187-jock side were littered with papers and magazines ; one was propped up in front of [him]187-jock . "[187-jock]

" Out somewhere . [The Old Hundredth]966-the old hundredth has never been shut . For a generation , while [other night clubs]967-other night clubs have sprung into being , with various names and [managers]968-managers , and various pretensions to respectability , have enjoyed a precarious and brief existence , and come to grief at the hands either of [police]969-police or [creditors]970-creditors , [the Old Hundredth]966-the old hundredth has maintained a solid front against all adversity . [It]966-the old hundredth has not been immune from persecution ; far from it . " [I]233-brenda see . [You]219-tony could n't possibly chuck lunch or one of the lectures ? "[233-brenda]

" Not possibly , [darling]2359-darling . "[233-brenda]

" [I]233-brenda see . [You]219-tony are [an angel to be so sweet about last night]2876-an angel to be so sweet about last night . "[233-brenda]

" Nothing could have been more fortunate , "[233-brenda] [Brenda]233-brenda said . " If [I]233-brenda know [Tony]219-tony , [he]219-tony 'll be tortured with guilt for weeks to come . It was maddening last night but it was worth it . [He]219-tony 's put [himself]219-tony so much in the wrong now that [he]219-tony wo n't dare to _ feel _ resentful , let alone say anything , whatever [I]233-brenda do . And [he]219-tony has n't really enjoyed [himself]219-tony at all , [the poor sweet , so _ that]2877-the poor sweet , so _ that 's _ a good thing too . " [You]219-tony are one for making [people]2364-people learn things , "[175-john beaver] said [Beaver]175-john beaver .

[Tony]219-tony emerged from [the 3.18]1009-the 3.18 feeling cold , tired , and heavy with guilt . [John Andrew]174-john had come in [the car]860-the car to meet [him]219-tony . " [Hullo]193-hullo , [daddy]2692-daddy , had a good time in [London]23-london ? [You]2692-daddy did n't mind [me]174-john coming to [the station]738-the station , did [you]2692-daddy ? " Very pleased to see [you]2692-daddy , [John]174-john . "[219-tony]

" How was [mummy]2412-nanny ? "[174-john]

" [She]2412-nanny sounded very well . [I]219-tony did n't see [her]2412-nanny . "[219-tony]

" But [you]219-tony _ said _ [you]219-tony were going to see [her]2412-nanny . "[174-john]

" Yes , [I]219-tony thought [I]219-tony was , but [I]219-tony turned out to be wrong . [I]219-tony talked to [her]2412-nanny several times on the telephone . "[219-tony]

" But [you]219-tony can telephone [her]2412-nanny from here , ca n't [you]219-tony , [daddy]2692-daddy ? Why did [you]219-tony go all the way to [London]23-london to telephone [her]2412-nanny ? ... _ Why _ , [daddy]2692-daddy ? "[174-john]

" It would take too long to explain . "[219-tony]

" Well tell [me]174-john some of it ... _ Why _ , [daddy]2692-daddy ? "[174-john]

" Look here , [I]219-tony 'm tired . If [you]219-tony do n't stop asking questions [I]219-tony sha n't let [you]219-tony ever come and meet [the train]2498-the train again . "[219-tony]

[John Andrew]174-john 's face began to pucker . " [I]174-john thought [you]174-john 'd _ like _ [me]174-john to come and meet [you]174-john . "[174-john]

" If [you]219-tony cry [I]859-the chauffeur shall put [you]219-tony in front with [Dawson]262-dawson . It 's absurd to cry at [your]219-tony age . "[859-the chauffeur]

" [I]174-john 'd _ sooner _ go in front with [Dawson]262-dawson , "[174-john] said [John Andrew]174-john between [his]174-john tears .

[Tony]219-tony picked up the speaking - tube to tell [the chauffeur]859-the chauffeur to stop , but [he]219-tony could not make [him]859-the chauffeur hear . So [he]219-tony hitched the mouthpiece back on its hook and [they]1012-they drove on in silence , [John Andrew]174-john leaning against the window and snivelling slightly . When [they]1012-they got to [the house]2368-the house [he]219-tony said , " [Nanny]217-nanny , [I]219-tony do n't want [John]174-john to come to [the station]738-the station in future unless [[her]217-nanny ladyship]2409-her ladyship or [I]219-tony specially say [he]174-john can . "[219-tony]

" No , [sir]2372-sir , [I]219-tony would n't have let [him]174-john go to - day , only [he]174-john went on so . Come along now , [John]174-john , and take off [your]174-john coat . Goodness , [child]2889-child , where 's [your]174-john handkerchief ? "[219-tony]

[Tony]219-tony went and sat alone in front of the library fire . " [Two men of thirty]2890-two men of thirty , "[219-tony] [he]219-tony said to [himself]219-tony , " behaving as if [they]2890-two men of thirty were up for the night from [Sandhurst]56-sandhurst -- getting drunk and ringing [people]2364-people up and dancing with tarts at [the Old Hundredth ...]2892-the old hundredth ... And it makes it all the worse that [Brenda]233-brenda was so nice about it . "[219-tony] [He]219-tony dozed a little ; then [he]219-tony went up to change . "[219-tony] Afterwards [he]219-tony sat with a book in front of the fire but [he]219-tony was unable to read . At ten o'clock [he]219-tony scattered the logs in the fireplace before going [upstairs]384-upstairs . [He]219-tony fastened the library windows and turned out the lights . That night [he]219-tony went into [[Brenda]233-brenda 's empty room]1015-brenda 's empty room to sleep .

[ II ]

That was Wednesday ; on Thursday [Tony]219-tony felt well again . [He]219-tony had a meeting of [the county council]1016-the county council in the morning . In the afternoon [he]219-tony went down to [the home farm]1017-the home farm and discussed a new kind of tractor with [[his]219-tony agent]1018-his agent . From then onwards [he]219-tony was able to say to [himself]219-tony , " This time to - morrow [Brenda]233-brenda and [Jock]187-jock will be [here]2433-here . "[219-tony] [He]219-tony dined in front of the fire in [the library]587-the library . [He]219-tony had given up the diet some weeks ago . ( " [Ambrose]263-ambrose , when [I]219-tony 'm alone [I]219-tony do n't really need a long dinner . In future [I]219-tony 'll just have two courses . "[219-tony] ) [He]219-tony looked over some accounts [[his]219-tony agent]1018-his agent had left for [him]219-tony and then went to bed , saying to [himself]219-tony , " When [I]219-tony wake up it will be the week - end . "[219-tony]

But there was a telegram for [him]219-tony next morning from [Jock]187-jock , saying , _ Week end impossible have to go to constituency how about one after next _ . [He]219-tony wired back , _ Delighted any time always here _ . " [I]219-tony suppose [he]219-tony 's made it up with [that girl]2839-that girl , "[219-tony] [Tony]219-tony reflected .

There was also a note from [Brenda]233-brenda , written in pencil :

Coming Sat . with [Polly]223-polly and [a friend of [Polly]223-polly 's called [Veronica]264-veronica in [[P.]265-p. 's car]1022-p. 's car]1021-a friend of polly 's called veronica in p. 's car . x x x x x x

B.

[Tony]219-tony found very little to occupy [his]219-tony time on Friday . [His]219-tony letters were all finished by ten o'clock . [He]219-tony went down to [the farm]2514-the farm but [they]1031-they had no business for [him]219-tony [there]394-there . The duties which before had seemed so multifarious , now took up a very small part of [his]219-tony day ; [he]219-tony had not realized how many hours [he]219-tony used to waste with [Brenda]233-brenda . [He]219-tony watched [John]174-john riding in [the paddock]495-the paddock . [The boy]2670-the boy clearly bore [him]219-tony ill will for [their]1035-their quarrel on Wednesday ; when [he]219-tony applauded a jump , [John]174-john said , " [She]233-brenda usually does better than this . "[174-john] Later , " When 's mummy coming down ? "[174-john]

" Not till to - morrow . "[219-tony]

" Oh . "[174-john]

" [I]219-tony 've got to go over to [Little Bayton]57-little bayton this afternoon . Would [you]219-tony like to come too and perhaps [we]1035-their could see [the kennels]2896-the kennels ? "[219-tony]

[John]174-john had for weeks past been praying for this expedition . " No , thank [you]219-tony , "[174-john] [he]174-john said . " [I]174-john want to finish a picture [I]174-john 'm painting . "[174-john]

" [You]219-tony can do that any time . "[219-tony]

" [I]174-john want to do it this afternoon . "[174-john]

When [Tony]219-tony had left [them]1035-their , [Ben]212-ben said , " Whatever made [you]219-tony speak to [[your]219-tony dad]2897-your dad like that for ? [You]219-tony 've been going on about seeing [the kennels]2896-the kennels since Christmas . "[212-ben]

" Not with _ [him]2897-your dad _ , "[174-john] said [John]174-john .

" And [you]219-tony ought not to say bastard or lousy in front of [me]212-ben , [nanny]2412-nanny says not . "[212-ben]

So [Tony]219-tony went over alone to [Little Bayton]57-little bayton , where [he]219-tony had some business to discuss with [Colonel Brink]268-colonel brink . [He]219-tony hoped [they]1036-they would ask [him]219-tony to stay on , but [the Colonel]1037-the colonel and [[his]1037-the colonel wife]648-his wife were [themselves]1036-they going out to tea , so [he]219-tony drove back in the dusk to [Hetton]7-hetton .

A thin mist lay breast - high over [the park]595-the park ; [the turrets and battlements of [the abbey]1041-the abbey]1040-the turrets and battlements of the abbey stood grey and flat ; [the boiler man]1042-the boiler man was hauling down the flag on [the main tower]1043-the main tower .

That evening [Polly]1049-polly and [Mrs Beaver]170-beaver played backgammon . " Why , [Tony]219-tony , "[233-brenda] [she]233-brenda said .

" [Lady Brenda]233-brenda not ill , [I]233-brenda hope ? "[233-brenda]

" [You]219-tony know , "[233-brenda] [Brenda]233-brenda confided next day , " [I]233-brenda 'm not _ absolutely _ happy about [Tony]219-tony . "[233-brenda]

[ III ]

[Brenda]233-brenda wrote :

[Darling Tony]219-tony ,

Sorry not to have written or rung up but [I]0-winchester 've had such a busy time with bimetallism . V. complicated .

Coming down Saturday with [Polly]223-polly again . Good [her]233-brenda coming twice -- Lyonesse ca n't be as beastly as [most of [the rooms]1067-the rooms]1066-most of the rooms , can it .

[ V ]

[[Jock]187-jock 's blonde]1124-jock 's blonde was called [Mrs Rattery]286-mrs rattery . [Tony]219-tony had conceived an idea of [her]286-mrs rattery from what [he]219-tony overheard of [Polly]223-polly 's gossip and from various fragments of information let fall by [Jock]187-jock . [She]286-mrs rattery was a little over thirty . Somewhere in [the Cottesmore country]1125-the cottesmore country there lived [a long - legged , slightly discredited Major Rattery , to whom [she]286-mrs rattery had once been married]1126-a long - legged , slightly discredited major rattery , to whom she had once been married . [She]286-mrs rattery was [an American by origin , now totally denationalized , rich , without property or possessions , except those that would pack in five vast trunks]1127-an american by origin , now totally denationalized , rich , without property or possessions , except those that would pack in five vast trunks . [Jock]187-jock had had [his]187-jock eye on [her]286-mrs rattery last summer at [Biarritz]71-biarritz and had fallen in with [her]286-mrs rattery again in [London]23-london where [she]286-mrs rattery played big bridge , very ably , for six or seven hours a day and changed [[her]286-mrs rattery hotel]1128-her hotel , on an average , once every three weeks . Periodically [she]286-mrs rattery was liable to bouts of morphine ; then [she]286-mrs rattery gave up [her]286-mrs rattery bridge and remained for several days at a time alone in [[her]286-mrs rattery hotel suite]1129-her hotel suite , refreshed at intervals with glasses of cold milk .

[She]286-mrs rattery arrived by air on Monday afternoon . It was the first time that [a guest]1130-a guest had come in this fashion and [the household]1131-the household was appreciably excited . Under [Jock]187-jock 's direction [the boiler man]1042-the boiler man and [one of [the gardeners]585-the gardeners]1133-one of the gardeners pegged out a dust sheet in [the park]595-the park to mark a landing for [her]286-mrs rattery and lit a bonfire of damp leaves to show the direction of the wind . [The five trunks]1136-the five trunks arrived in the ordinary way by [train]2396-train , with [an elderly , irreproachable maid]1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid . [She]1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid brought [her]1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid own sheets with [her]1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid in one of the trunks ; they were neither silk nor coloured , without lace or ornament of any kind , except small , plain monograms .

[Tony]219-tony , [Jock]187-jock and [John]174-john went out to watch [her]1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid land . [She]1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid climbed out of the cockpit , stretched , unbuttoned the flaps of [her]1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid leather helmet , and came to meet [them]1139-they . " Forty - two minutes , "[1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid] [she]1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid said , " not at all bad with the wind against [me]1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid . "[1138-an elderly , irreproachable maid]

" [The boy]2670-the boy 's down . "[1241-he]

[Everyone]2366-everyone agreed that it was [nobody]1249-nobody 's fault .

* * * * *

It was nearly an hour before the news reached [Jock]187-jock and [Mrs Rattery]286-mrs rattery where [they]1250-they were waiting beside [another blank covert]1251-another blank covert . [Colonel Inch]287-colonel inch stopped hunting for the day and sent the hounds back to [the kennels]2896-the kennels . The voices were hushed which , five minutes before , had been proclaiming that [they]1250-they knew it for a fact , [Last]1253-last had given orders to shoot every fox on [the place]2391-the place . [The library]587-the library windows were open and the clock , striking the hour , high over head among its crockets and finials , was clearly audible in [the quiet room]1287-the quiet room . ( [Mrs Rattery]286-mrs rattery sat intent over [her]286-mrs rattery game , moving little groups of cards adroitly backwards and forwards about the table like shuttles across a loom ; under [her]286-mrs rattery fingers order grew out of chaos ; [she]286-mrs rattery established sequence and precedence ; the symbols before [her]286-mrs rattery became coherent , interrelated . )

[Tony]219-tony explained .

" [I]286-mrs rattery 'd say it was one of those games that [you]219-tony have to feel pretty good first , before [you]219-tony can enjoy them , "[286-mrs rattery] said [Mrs Rattery]286-mrs rattery . " But [I]286-mrs rattery 'll try anything . "[286-mrs rattery]

[Jock]187-jock had not seen [[Brenda]293-brenda 's flat]1295-brenda 's flat . [[The Princess]1082-the princess 's single room]1311-the princess 's single room was furnished promiscuously and with truly Eastern disregard of the right properties of things ; swords meant to adorn the state robes of a Moorish caid were swung from the picture rail ; mats made for prayer were strewn on the divan ; the carpet on the floor had been made in Bokhara as a wall covering ; while over the dressing table was draped a shawl made in Yokohama for sale to [cruise - passengers]1312-cruise - passengers ; an octagonal table from [Port Said]78-port said held a Tibetan Buddha of pale soapstone ; six ivory elephants from [Bombay]79-bombay stood along the top of the radiator . Other cultures , too , were represented by a set of Lalique bottles and powder boxes , a phallic fetish from [Senegal]80-senegal , a Dutch copper bowl , a waste - paper basket made of varnished aquatint , a golliwog presented at the gala dinner of [a seaside hotel]1313-a seaside hotel , a dozen or so framed photographs of [the Princess]1082-the princess , a garden scene ingeniously constructed in pieces of coloured wood , and a radio set in fumed oak , Tudor style . In [so small a room]1315-so small a room the effect was distracting . [The Princess]1082-the princess sat at the looking - glass , [Jock]1317-jock behind [her]1082-the princess on the divan .

" Well , [we]3253-we 'd better go to [the station]738-the station . "[1344-she]

" All right . It 's early . But it does n't matter . "[187-jock]

[Jock]187-jock took [her]1344-she to [the train]2498-the train . As it was Wednesday [the carriages]680-the carriages were full of women returning after [their]680-the carriages day 's shopping .

" Why not go first - class ? "[1344-she]

" No , no . [I]1344-she always go third . "[1344-she]

[She]1344-she sat in the middle of a row . [The women on either side]1351-the women on either side looked at [her]1344-she curiously , wondering if [she]1344-she were ill .

" Do n't [you]1344-she want anything to read ? "[1351-the women on either side]

" Nothing to read . "[1351-the women on either side]

" Or eat ? "[1351-the women on either side]

" Or eat . "[1351-the women on either side]

" Then [I]1351-the women on either side 'll say good - bye . "[1351-the women on either side]

" Good - bye . "[1351-the women on either side]

[Another woman]1352-another woman pushed past [Jock]187-jock into [the carriage]742-the carriage , laden with light parcels .

* * * * *

When the news became known , [Marjorie]228-marjorie said to [Allan]239-allan , " Well , anyway , this will mean the end of [Mr Beaver]191-beaver . "[228-marjorie]

But [Polly Cockpurse]223-polly said to [Veronica]264-veronica , " That 's the end of [Tony]219-tony so far as [Brenda]293-brenda is concerned . "[223-polly]

[The impoverished Lasts]898-the impoverished lasts were stunned by the telegram . [They]898-the impoverished lasts lived on [an extensive but unprofitable chicken farm]1355-an extensive but unprofitable chicken farm near [Princes Risborough]83-princes risborough . [Jock]187-jock drove from [Paddington]84-paddington to [Bratt 's]179-bratt . [One of [the men by [the bar]811-the bar]1359-the men by the bar]1358-one of the men by the bar said , " Ghastly thing about [[Tony Last]184-tony 's boy]3255-tony last 's boy . "[1358-one of the men by the bar]

[ VIII ]

The inquest was held at eleven o'clock next morning ; it was soon over . [The doctor]1267-the doctor , [the bus - driver]1362-the bus - driver , [Ben]212-ben and [Miss Ripon]289-miss ripon gave evidence . [Miss Ripon]289-miss ripon was allowed to remain seated . [She]289-miss ripon was very white and spoke in a trembling voice ; [[her]289-miss ripon father]3161-her father glared at [her]289-miss ripon from a nearby seat ; under [her]289-miss ripon hat was a small bare patch , where [they]1364-their had shaved off [her]289-miss ripon hair to clean [her]289-miss ripon cut . In [his]3161-her father summary [the coroner]1365-the coroner remarked that it was clear from the evidence that [nobody]1249-nobody was in any way to blame for the misadventure ; it only remained to express the deep sympathy of [the court]1367-the court to [Mr Last]254-mr last and [Lady Brenda]233-brenda in [their]1364-their terrible loss . [The people]2351-the people fell back to allow [Tony]184-tony and [Brenda]233-brenda to leave [the room]470-the room . [Colonel Inch]287-colonel inch and [the hunt secretary]1370-the hunt secretary were both present . Everything was done with delicacy and to show respect for [their]1364-their sorrow .

[Brenda]233-brenda said , " Wait a minute . [I]233-brenda must just speak to [that poor Ripon girl]3258-that poor ripon girl . "[233-brenda]

[She]233-brenda did it charmingly . When [everyone]2366-everyone had gone . [Tony]184-tony said , " [I]184-tony wish [you]233-brenda had been [here]2433-here yesterday . There were [so many people]3260-so many people about and [I]184-tony did n't know what to say to [them]3260-so many people . "[184-tony]

" What did [you]184-tony do all day ? "[233-brenda]

" There was [the Shameless Blonde]1148-the shameless blonde ... [we]1372-they played animal snap some of the time . "[184-tony]

" Animal snap ? Was that any good ? "[233-brenda]

" Not much ... It 's odd to think that yesterday this time it had n't happened . "[184-tony]

" [Poor little boy]3251-poor little boy , "[233-brenda] said [Brenda]233-brenda .

[They]1372-they had scarcely spoken to [each other]672-each other since [Brenda]233-brenda 's arrival . [Tony]184-tony had driven to [the station]738-the station to meet [her]233-brenda ; by the time [they]1372-they reached [the house]2368-the house [Mrs Rattery]286-mrs rattery had gone to bed ; that morning [she]286-mrs rattery left in [[her]286-mrs rattery aeroplane]1376-her aeroplane without seeing either of [them]1372-they . [They]1372-they heard the machine pass over [the house]2368-the house , [Brenda]233-brenda in [[her]233-brenda bath]1378-her bath , [Tony]184-tony downstairs in [[his]184-tony study]549-his study attending to the correspondence that had become necessary .

A day of fitful sunshine and blustering wind ; white and grey clouds were scarcely moving , high overhead , but the bare trees round [the house]2368-the house swayed and shook and there were swift whirlpools of straw in [the stable yard]1381-the stable yard . [Ben]212-ben changed from the Sunday suit [he]212-ben had worn at the inquest and went about [his]212-ben duties . [Thunderclap]213-thunderclap , too , had been kicked yesterday and was very slightly lame in the off fore .

[Brenda]233-brenda took off [her]233-brenda hat and threw it down on a chair in [the hall]1382-the hall . " Nothing to say , is there ? "[233-brenda]

" There 's no need to talk . "[233-brenda]

" No . [I]233-brenda suppose there 'll have to be a funeral . "[233-brenda]

" Well , of course . "[233-brenda]

" Yes : to - morrow ? "[233-brenda]

[She]233-brenda looked into [the morning - room]2912-the morning - room . " [They]3263-they 've done quite a lot , have n't [they]3263-they ? "[233-brenda]

All [Brenda]233-brenda 's movements were slower than usual and [her]233-brenda voice was flat and expressionless . [She]233-brenda sank down into one of the armchairs in the centre of [the hall]1382-the hall , which [nobody]1249-nobody ever used . [She]233-brenda sat there doing nothing . [Tony]184-tony put [his]184-tony hand on [her]233-brenda shoulder but [she]233-brenda said " Do n't "[233-brenda] , not impatiently or nervously but without any expression . [Tony]184-tony said , " [I]184-tony 'll go and finish those letters . "[184-tony]

" Yes . "[233-brenda]

" See [you]233-brenda at luncheon . "[184-tony]

" Yes . "[233-brenda]

[She]233-brenda rose , looked round listlessly for [her]233-brenda hat , found it and went very slowly [upstairs]384-upstairs , the sunlight through the stained - glass windows glowing and sparkling all about [her]233-brenda .

In [[her]233-brenda room]2411-her room [she]233-brenda sat on the window seat , looking out across [the meadows]1388-the meadows and [dun ploughland]1389-dun ploughland , the naked tossing trees , [the church towers]1390-the church towers , the maelstroms of dust and leaf which eddied about [the terrace below]1391-the terrace below ; [she]233-brenda still held [her]233-brenda hat and fidgeted with [her]233-brenda fingers on the brooch which was clipped to one side of it .

[Nanny]217-nanny knocked at the door and came in , red eyed . " If [you]233-brenda please , [[my]217-nanny lady]2456-my lady , [I]217-nanny 've been going through [John]293-brenda 's things . There 's this handkerchief does n't belong to [him]3265-him . "[217-nanny]

The heavy scent and crowned cipher at the corner proclaimed its origin .

" [I]217-nanny know whose it is . [I]217-nanny 'll send it back to [her]2456-my lady . "[217-nanny]

* * * * *

[Tony]219-tony said to [Jock]187-jock , as [they]1403-they sat alone after dinner , " [I]219-tony 've been trying to understand , and [I]219-tony think [I]219-tony do now . * * * * *

[Beaver]191-beaver was staying at [[Veronica]264-veronica 's]1404-veronica 's . [Brenda]293-brenda said to [him]191-beaver , " Until Wednesday , when [I]293-brenda thought something had happened to [you]191-beaver , [I]293-brenda had no idea that [I]293-brenda loved [you]191-beaver . "[293-brenda]

* * * * *

On Monday morning [Tony]219-tony found this letter on [his]219-tony breakfast tray .

[Darling Tony]219-tony ,

[I]0-winchester am not coming back to [Hetton]7-hetton . [Grimshawe]267-grimshawe can pack everything and bring it to [the flat]863-the flat . Then [I]0-winchester sha n't want [her]267-grimshawe any more .

[You]219-tony must have realized for some time that things were going wrong .

[I]0-winchester am in love with [John Beaver]175-john beaver and [I]0-winchester want to have a divorce and marry [him]175-john beaver . If [John Andrew]174-john had not died things might not have happened like this . [I]0-winchester ca n't tell . As it is , [I]0-winchester simply ca n't begin over again . Please do not mind too much . [I]0-winchester suppose [we]1406-we sha n't be allowed to meet while the case is on but [I]0-winchester hope afterwards [we]1406-we shall be [great friends]2965-great friends . Anyway , [I]0-winchester shall always look on [you]219-tony as one whatever [you]219-tony think of [me]0-winchester .

Best love from [Brenda]293-brenda .

When [Tony]219-tony read this [his]219-tony first thought was that [Brenda]293-brenda had lost [her]293-brenda reason . " [She]293-brenda 's only seen [Beaver]175-john beaver twice to [my]219-tony knowledge , "[219-tony] [he]219-tony said .

But later [he]219-tony showed the letter to [Jock]187-jock , who said , " [I]219-tony 'm sorry it should have happened like this . "[219-tony]

" But it 's not true , is it ? "[293-brenda]

" Yes , [I]219-tony 'm afraid it is . [Everyone]2366-everyone has known for some time . "[219-tony]

But it was several days before [Tony]219-tony fully realized what it meant . [He]219-tony had got into a habit of loving and trusting [Brenda]293-brenda .

CHAPTER IV ENGLISH GOTHIC -- II

[ [I]0-winchester ]

" How 's [the old boy]951-the old boy taking it ? "[293-brenda]

" Not so well . It makes [me]293-brenda feel rather a beast , "[293-brenda] said [Brenda]293-brenda . " [I]293-brenda 'm afraid [he]951-the old boy minds a lot . "[293-brenda]

" Well , [you]293-brenda would n't like it if [he]951-the old boy did n't , "[1408-polly] said [Polly]1408-polly to console [her]293-brenda .

" No , [I]293-brenda suppose not . "[293-brenda]

" [I]271-jenny shall stick by [you]293-brenda whatever happens , "[271-jenny] said [Jenny Abdul Akbar]271-jenny .

" Oh , everything is going quite smoothly now , "[293-brenda] said [Brenda]293-brenda . " There was a certain amount of _ g?ne _ with [relatives]3286-relatives . "[293-brenda]

* * * * *

[Tony]219-tony had been living with [Jock]187-jock for the last three weeks . [Mrs Rattery]286-mrs rattery had gone to [California]86-california and [he]219-tony was grateful for company . [They]1409-they dined together most evenings . [They]1409-they had given up going to [[Bratt]179-bratt 's]1410-bratt 's ; so had [Beaver]175-john beaver ; [they]1409-they were afraid of meeting [each other]672-each other . Instead , [Tony]219-tony and [Jock]187-jock went to [Brown 's]314-brown , where [Beaver]175-john beaver was not [a member]1412-a member . [Beaver]175-john beaver was continually with [Brenda]293-brenda nowadays , at [one of [half a dozen houses]1414-half a dozen houses]1413-one of half a dozen houses .

[Mrs Beaver]170-beaver did not like the turn things had taken ; [[her]170-beaver workmen]1415-her workmen had been sent back from [Hetton]7-hetton with [their]1415-her workmen job unfinished .

* * * * *

In the first week [Tony]219-tony had had several distasteful interviews . [Allan]239-allan had attempted to act as [peacemaker]1416-peacemaker .

" [You]3287-you just wait a few weeks , "[239-allan] [he]239-allan had said . " [Brenda]293-brenda will come back . [She]293-brenda 'll soon get sick of [Beaver]170-beaver . "[239-allan]

" But [I]1416-peacemaker do n't want [her]293-brenda back . "[1416-peacemaker]

" [I]239-allan know just how [you]3287-you feel , but it does n't do to be medieval about it . If [Brenda]293-brenda had n't been upset at [John]293-brenda 's death this need never have come to a crisis . Why , last year [Marjorie]228-marjorie was going everywhere with that ass [Robin Beaseley]249-robin beaseley . [She]228-marjorie was mad about [him]249-robin beaseley at the time , but [I]239-allan pretended not to notice and it all blew over . If [I]239-allan were [you]3287-you [I]239-allan should refuse to recognize that anything has happened . "[239-allan]

[Marjorie]228-marjorie had said , " Of _ course _ [Brenda]293-brenda does n't love [Beaver]170-beaver . How could [she]293-brenda ? ... And if [she]293-brenda thinks [she]293-brenda does at the moment , it 's [your]3287-you duty to prevent [her]293-brenda making a fool of [herself]293-brenda . [You]3287-you must refuse to be divorced -- anyway , until [she]293-brenda has found [someone more reasonable]3288-someone more reasonable . "[228-marjorie]

[Lady St Cloud]303-lady st cloud had said , " [Brenda]293-brenda has been very , very foolish . [She]293-brenda always was [an excitable girl]3289-an excitable girl , but [I]303-lady st cloud am sure there was never anything _ wrong _ , quite sure . _ That _ would n't be like [Brenda]293-brenda at all . [I]303-lady st cloud have n't met [Mr Beaver]191-beaver and [I]303-lady st cloud do not wish to . [I]303-lady st cloud understand [he]191-beaver is unsuitable in every way . [Brenda]293-brenda would never want to marry [anyone like that]3290-anyone like that . [I]303-lady st cloud will tell [you]3287-you exactly how it happened , [Tony]219-tony . [Brenda]293-brenda must have felt a tiny bit neglected -- [people]2364-people often do at that stage of marriage . [I]303-lady st cloud have known countless cases -- and it was naturally flattering to find [a young man]2490-a young man to beg and carry for [her]293-brenda . That 's all it was , nothing _ wrong _ . And then the terrible shock of [little John]293-brenda 's accident unsettled [her]293-brenda and [she]293-brenda did n't know what [she]293-brenda was saying or writing . [You]3287-you 'll both laugh over this little fracas in years to come . "[303-lady st cloud]

[Tony]219-tony had not set eyes on [Brenda]293-brenda since the afternoon of the funeral . Once [he]219-tony spoke to [her]293-brenda over the telephone .

It was during the second week when [he]219-tony was feeling most lonely and bewildered by [various counsels]1417-various counsels . [Allan]239-allan had been with [him]219-tony urging a reconciliation . " [I]219-tony 've been talking to [Brenda]293-brenda , "[219-tony] [he]219-tony had said . " [She]293-brenda 's sick of [Beaver]170-beaver already . The one thing [she]293-brenda wants is to go back to [Hetton]7-hetton and settle down with [you]219-tony again . "[219-tony]

While [Allan]239-allan was there , [Tony]219-tony resolutely refused to listen , but later the words , and the picture they evoked , would not leave [his]219-tony mind . So [he]219-tony rang [her]293-brenda up and [she]293-brenda answered [him]219-tony calmly and gravely .

" [Brenda]293-brenda , this is [Tony]219-tony . "[293-brenda]

" [Hullo]193-hullo , [Tony]219-tony , what is it ? "[293-brenda]

" [I]293-brenda 've been talking to [Allan]239-allan . [He]239-allan 's just told [me]293-brenda about [your]219-tony change of mind . "[293-brenda]

" [I]293-brenda 'm not sure [I]293-brenda know what [you]219-tony mean . "[293-brenda]

" That [you]219-tony want to leave [Beaver]170-beaver and come back to [Hetton]7-hetton . "[293-brenda]

" Did [Allan]239-allan say that ? "[293-brenda]

" Yes ; is n't it true ? "[293-brenda]

" [I]293-brenda 'm afraid it 's not . [Allan]239-allan is [an interfering ass]3293-an interfering ass . [I]293-brenda had [him]239-allan [here]2433-here this afternoon . [ II ]

[ III ]

[Lady St Cloud]303-lady st cloud preserved an atavistic faith in the authority and preternatural good judgment of [the Head of the Family]1580-the head of the family ; accordingly , [her]303-lady st cloud first act , on learning from [Marjorie]228-marjorie of [Brenda]233-brenda 's wayward behaviour , was to cable for [Reggie]182-uncle reggie 's return from [Tunisia]94-tunisia where [he]182-uncle reggie was occupied in desecrating some tombs . [His]182-uncle reggie departure , like all [his]182-uncle reggie movements , was leisurely . [He]182-uncle reggie did not take [the first available boat]1581-the first available boat or the second , but eventually [he]182-uncle reggie arrived in [London]23-london on the Monday after [Tony]219-tony 's visit to [Brighton]90-brighton . [He]182-uncle reggie held a family conclave in [[his]182-uncle reggie library]1582-his library , consisting of [[his]182-uncle reggie mother]377-his mother , [Brenda]233-brenda , [Marjorie]228-marjorie , [Allan]239-allan and [the solicitor]1425-the solicitor ; later [he]182-uncle reggie discussed the question fully with each of [them]1585-them severally ; [he]182-uncle reggie took [Beaver]191-beaver out to luncheon ; [he]182-uncle reggie dined with [Jock]187-jock ; [he]182-uncle reggie even called on [Tony]219-tony 's Aunt [Frances]195-frances . Finally , on Thursday evening [he]182-uncle reggie arranged to meet [Tony]219-tony for dinner at [Brown]314-brown 's .

[He]182-uncle reggie was eight years older than [Brenda]233-brenda ; very occasionally a fugitive , indefinable likeness was detectable between [him]182-uncle reggie and [Marjorie]228-marjorie , but both in character and appearance [he]182-uncle reggie was as different from [Brenda]233-brenda as it was possible to imagine . [He]182-uncle reggie was prematurely , unnaturally stout , and [he]182-uncle reggie carried [his]182-uncle reggie burden of flesh as though [he]182-uncle reggie were not yet used to it ; as though it had been buckled on to [him]182-uncle reggie that morning for the first time and [he]182-uncle reggie were still experimenting for its better adjustment ; there was an instability in [his]182-uncle reggie gait and in [his]182-uncle reggie eyes a furtive look as though [he]182-uncle reggie were at any moment liable to ambush and realized that [he]182-uncle reggie was unfairly handicapped for flight . This impression , however , was due solely to [his]182-uncle reggie physical appearance ; it was the deep bed of fat in which [his]182-uncle reggie eyes lay that gave [them]1586-them this look of suspicion ; the caution of [his]182-uncle reggie movements resulted from the exertion of keeping [his]182-uncle reggie balance and not from any embarrassment at [his]182-uncle reggie own clumsiness , for it had never occurred to [him]182-uncle reggie that [he]182-uncle reggie looked at all unusual .

Rather more than half [Reggie St Cloud]315-reggie 's time and income was spent abroad in modest archaeological expeditions . [[His]315-reggie house in [London]23-london]1587-his house in london was full of [their]1586-them fruit -- fragmentary amphoras , corroded bronze axe heads , little splinters of bone and charred stick , a Graeco - Roman head in marble , its features obliterated and ground smooth with time . [He]315-reggie had written two little monographs about [his]315-reggie work , privately printed and both dedicated to [members of [the royal family]1589-the royal family]1588-members of the royal family . When [he]315-reggie came to [London]23-london [he]315-reggie was regular in attendance at [the House of [Lords]1591-lords]1590-the house of lords ; all [[his]315-reggie friends]948-his friends were well over forty and for some years now [he]315-reggie had established [himself]315-reggie as [a member of [[their]948-his friends generation]1594-their generation]1593-a member of their generation ; [few mothers]1595-few mothers still regarded [him]315-reggie as [a possible son - in - law]1596-a possible son - in - law .
