[He]1608-the genial passenger paced off up [the deck]3520-the deck , straddling slightly in order to keep [his]1608-the genial passenger balance and occasionally putting out a hand to the rail for support .

Regularly every three minutes for the last hour or so , [this man]1610-this man had come by . At first [Tony]219-tony had looked up at [his]1608-the genial passenger approach and then turned away again , out to [sea]3521-sea . Presently [the man]1007-the man had taken to nodding , then to saying " Hullo "[1007-the man] or " Bit choppy "[1007-the man] or " Here [we]3528-we are again "[1007-the man] ; finally [he]1007-the man had stopped and began a conversation .

[Tony]219-tony went aft to break this rather embarrassing sequence . [He]219-tony descended the companion way which led to [the lower deck]1613-the lower deck . Here , in crates lashed to the side , was a variety of livestock -- some stud bulls , a heavily blanketed racehorse , a couple of beagles , being exported to [various West Indian islands]1614-various west indian islands . [Tony]219-tony threaded a way between [them]1615-them and the hatches to the stern , where [he]219-tony sat against a winch watching the horizon mount above the funnels , then fall until they stood out black against the darkening sky . The pitch was more sensible here than it had been amidships ; the animals shifted restlessly in [[their]1615-them cramped quarters]1616-their cramped quarters ; the beagles whined intermittently . [A lascar]1617-a lascar took down from a line some washing which had been flapping there all day .

The wash of [the ship]1618-the ship was quickly lost in the high waves . [They]1615-them were steaming westward down [the Channel]1619-the channel . As it grew to be night , [lighthouses]1620-lighthouses appeared flashing from [the French coast]1621-the french coast . Presently [a steward]1622-a steward walked round [the bright , upper deck]1623-the bright , upper deck striking chimes on a gong of brass cylinders , and [the genial passenger]1608-the genial passenger went below to prepare [himself]1608-the genial passenger for dinner in hot sea water which splashed from side to side of the bath and dissolved the soap in a thin , sticky scum . [He]1608-the genial passenger was [the only man to dress that evening]1625-the only man to dress that evening : [Tony]219-tony sat in the mustering darkness until the second bell . Then [he]219-tony left [his]219-tony greatcoat in [the cabin]1626-the cabin and went down to dinner .

It was the first evening at [sea]3521-sea .

[Tony]219-tony sat at [the captain]1628-the captain 's table , but [the captain]1628-the captain was on [the bridge]1630-the bridge . There were empty chairs on either side of [him]219-tony . It was not rough enough for the fiddles to be out , but [the stewards]1631-the stewards had removed the flower vases and damped the tablecloth to make it adhesive . [A coloured archdeacon]1632-a coloured archdeacon sat facing [him]219-tony . [He]219-tony ate with great refinement but [his]219-tony black hands looked immense on the wet , whitish cloth . [He]219-tony was returning from [a Congress]1633-a congress , [he]219-tony told [Tony]219-tony .

" Yes , come to think of it , [I]219-tony suppose [I]219-tony am , "[219-tony] said [Tony]219-tony .

It did not come easily to [him]219-tony to realize that [he]219-tony was [an explorer]1645-an explorer . It was barely a fortnight ago that [he]219-tony had become [one]2349-one . Even the presence in the hold of two vast crates , bearing [his]219-tony name and labelled _ NOT WANTED ON THE VOYAGE_--crates containing such new and unfamiliar possessions as a medicine chest , an automatic shot - gun , camping equipment , pack saddles , a cinema camera , dynamite , disinfectants , [a collapsible canoe]1647-a collapsible canoe , filters , tinned butter and , strangest of all , an assortment of what [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger called " trade goods"--failed[316-dr messinger] to convince [him]219-tony fully of the serious nature of [his]219-tony expedition . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger had arranged everything . And [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger [himself]316-dr messinger was [a new acquaintance who , prostrate now in [his]316-dr messinger bunk]1648-a new acquaintance who , prostrate now in his bunk with what [the Negro clergyman]1649-the negro clergyman would have called " suffering "[1649-the negro clergyman] , that day , for the first time since [Tony]219-tony had met [him]316-dr messinger , seemed entirely human .

[Tony]219-tony had spent very little of [his]219-tony life abroad . ( ... [a grey stone house surrounded by vines]1652-a grey stone house surrounded by vines . There was a stuffed spaniel in [the bathroom]558-the bathroom . ( [... That was all . After [[his]219-tony father]380-his father died [he]219-tony had not left [England]13-england . [They]1666-they could not easily afford it ; it was one of the things [they]1666-they postponed until death duties were paid off ; besides that , [he]219-tony was never happy away from [Hetton]7-hetton , and [Brenda]233-brenda did not like leaving [John Andrew]174-john .

Thus [Tony]219-tony had no very ambitious ideas about travel , and when [he]219-tony decided to go abroad [his]219-tony first act was to call at [a tourist agency]1682-a tourist agency and come away laden with a sheaf of brightly coloured prospectuses , which advertised commodious cruises among palm trees , Negresses and [ruined arches]1683-ruined arches . [He]219-tony was going away because it seemed to be the conduct expected of [a husband]1684-a husband in [his]219-tony circumstances , because the associations of [Hetton]7-hetton were for the time poisoned for [him]219-tony , because [he]219-tony wanted to live for a few months away from people who would know [him]219-tony or [Brenda]233-brenda , in places where there was no expectation of meeting [her]233-brenda or [Beaver]175-john beaver or [Reggie St Cloud]315-reggie at [every corner [he]219-tony frequented]1685-every corner he frequented , and , with this feeling of evasion dominant in [his]219-tony mind , [he]219-tony took the prospectuses to read at [the Greville Club]1686-the greville club . [He]219-tony had been [a member [there]394-there]1687-a member there for some years , but rarely used it ; [his]219-tony resignation was postponed only by [his]219-tony recurrent omission to cancel [the banker]1689-the banker 's order for [his]219-tony subscription . Now that [Bratt]179-bratt 's and [Brown]314-brown 's were distasteful to [him]219-tony [he]219-tony felt thankful that [he]219-tony had kept on with [the Greville]110-the greville . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger , though quite young , was bearded , and [Tony]219-tony knew [few young men with beards]1697-few young men with beards . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger lunched off apples and a rice pudding . ( " [I]219-tony have to be very careful what [I]219-tony eat , "[219-tony] [he]219-tony said . ) [Tony]219-tony ate cold steak and kidney pie . [They]1703-their sat at a window in [the big dining - room [upstairs]384-upstairs]1704-the big dining - room upstairs . [The places round [them]1703-their]1706-the places round them were soon filled with [members]1707-members , who even carried the tradition of general conversation so far as to lean back in [their]1703-their chairs and chat over [their]1703-their shoulders from table to table -- a practice which greatly hindered the already imperfect service . But [Tony]219-tony remained oblivious to all that was said , absorbed in what [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger was telling [him]219-tony .

" ... [You]3552-you see , there has been a continuous tradition about [the City]3553-the city since [the first explorers of the sixteenth century]3554-the first explorers of the sixteenth century . [It]3553-the city has been variously allocated , sometimes down in [Matto Grosso]111-matto grosso , sometimes on [the upper [Orinoco]112-orinoco in what is now [Venezuela]113-venezuela]3555-the upper orinoco in what is now venezuela . [I]316-dr messinger [myself]316-dr messinger used to think it lay somewhere on [the Uraricuera]114-the uraricuera . [I]316-dr messinger was out there last year and it was then that [I]316-dr messinger established contact with [the Pie - wie Indians]321-the indians ; [no white man]3556-no white man had ever visited [them]321-the indians and got out alive . And it was from [the Pie - wies]321-the indians that [I]316-dr messinger learned where to look . [None of [them]321-the indians]3557-none of them had ever visited [the City]3553-the city , of course , but [they]321-the indians _ knew about [it]3553-the city _ . [Every Indian between [Ciudad Bolivar]115-ciudad bolivar and [Para]322-para]3559-every indian between ciudad bolivar and para knows about it . But [I]316-dr messinger became [blood - brother]3561-blood - brother with a Pie - wie -- interesting ceremony . [They]321-the indians buried [me]316-dr messinger up to the neck in mud and [all the women of [the tribe]3563-the tribe]3562-all the women of the tribe spat on [my]316-dr messinger head . "[316-dr messinger]

" [I]1608-the genial passenger 've been looking up the historical side too , and [I]1608-the genial passenger more or less know how [the City]3553-the city got [there]394-there . It was the result of a migration from [Peru]118-peru at the beginning of the fifteenth century , when [the Incas]323-the incas were at the height of [their]323-the incas power . It is mentioned in all the early Spanish documents as a popular legend . [One of [the younger princes]3574-the younger princes]3573-one of the younger princes rebelled and led [[his]3573-one of the younger princes people]3575-his people off into [the forest]3576-the forest . "[1608-the genial passenger]

" But what do [you]1608-the genial passenger suppose [this city]3581-this city will be like ? "[316-dr messinger]

" Impossible to say . [Every tribe]3582-every tribe has a different word for it . [The ship]1618-the ship , so far as any consideration of comfort had contributed to [her]1618-the ship design , was planned for [the tropics]1710-the tropics . It was slightly colder in [the smoking - room]534-the smoking - room than on [deck]1712-deck . [Tony]219-tony went to [[his]219-tony cabin]1713-his cabin and retrieved [his]219-tony cap and greatcoat ; then [he]219-tony went aft again , to [the place where [he]219-tony had sat before dinner]1714-the place where he had sat before dinner . It was a starless night and nothing was visible beyond [the small luminous area round [the ship]1618-the ship]1715-the small luminous area round the ship , save for a single lighthouse that flashed short - long , short - long , far away on the port bow . The crests of the waves caught the reflection from [the promenade deck]1717-the promenade deck and shone for a moment before plunging away into the black depths behind . The beagles were awake , whining .

For some days now [Tony]219-tony had been thoughtless about the events of the immediate past . [His]219-tony mind was occupied with [the City]3553-the city , the Shining , [the Many Watered]1719-the many watered , the Bright Feathered , the Aromatic Jam . [He]219-tony had a clear picture of it in [his]219-tony mind . It was Gothic in character , all vanes and pinnacles , gargoyles , battlements , groining and tracery , [pavilions]1720-pavilions and terraces , a transfigured [Hetton]7-hetton , pennons and banners floating on the sweet breeze , everything luminous and translucent ; [a coral citadel]1721-a coral citadel crowning [a green hill - top sown with daisies , among groves and streams]1722-a green hill - top sown with daisies , among groves and streams ; a tapestry landscape filled with heraldic and fabulous animals and symmetrical , disproportionate blossom .

[The ship]1618-the ship tossed and tunnelled through [the dark waters]1724-the dark waters towards [this radiant sanctuary]1725-this radiant sanctuary .

Next day [they]1727-they were in [the Atlantic]120-the atlantic . Ponderous waves rising over murky , opaque depths . Dappled with foam at the crests , like [downland]1728-downland , where on the high , exposed places snow has survived the thaw . Lead - grey and slate in the sun , olive , field blue and khaki like the uniforms of [a battlefield]1729-a battlefield ; the sky overhead was neutral and steely with swollen clouds scudding across [it]1730-it , affording rare half - hours of sunlight . The masts swung slowly across this sky and the bows heaved and wallowed below the horizon . [The man who had made friends with [Tony]219-tony]1731-the man who had made friends with tony paraded [the deck]3520-the deck with [the two beagles]1733-the two beagles . [Few of [the passengers]1242-the passengers]1736-few of the passengers were on [their]1736-few of the passengers feet . [Tony]219-tony went to see [him]316-dr messinger and found [him]316-dr messinger torpid , for [he]316-dr messinger was taking large doses of chloral . Towards evening the wind freshened and by dinner - time was blowing hard ; portholes were screwed up and all destructible objects disposed on the cabin floors ; a sudden roll broke a dozen coffee cups in [the music and reading room]1740-the music and reading room . That night there was little sleep for [anyone on board]1741-anyone on board ; the plating creaked , luggage shifted from wall to wall . [Tony]219-tony wedged [himself]219-tony firm in [his]219-tony bunk with the lifebelt and thought of [the City]3553-the city .

... Days of shadow and exhaustion , salt wind and wet mist , foghorn and the constant groan and creak of straining metal . A week of blue water that grew clearer and more tranquil daily , of sun that grew warmer , radiating [the ship]1618-the ship and [[her]1618-the ship passengers]1775-her passengers , filling [them]1775-her passengers with good humour and ease ; blue water that caught the sun in a thousand brilliant points , dazzling the eyes as [they]1775-her passengers searched for porpoises and flying fish ; clear blue water in the shallows revealing [its]1618-the ship bed of silver sand and smooth pebble , fathoms down ; soft warm shade on deck under the awnings ; [the ship]1618-the ship moved amid unbroken horizons on a vast blue disc of blue , sparkling with sunlight .

" And [you]219-tony will have to choose [[your]219-tony husband]3633-your husband . "[329-th?r?se]

" Yes . There are seven of [them]1812-they . There was one called [Honor]335-honor ? [I]329-th?r?se liked , but of course [I]329-th?r?se have n't seen [him]331-doctor messinger for two years . [He]331-doctor messinger was studying to be [an engineer]3634-an engineer . There 's one called [Mendoza]336-mendoza who 's very rich but [he]336-mendoza is n't really [a Trinidadian]3635-a trinidadian . [[His]336-mendoza grandfather]3636-his grandfather came from [Dominica]126-dominica and [they]3637-they say [he]336-mendoza has coloured blood . [I]329-th?r?se expect it will be Honor ? . [Mother]253-mother always brought in [his]336-mendoza name when [she]253-mother wrote to [me]329-th?r?se and [he]336-mendoza sent [me]329-th?r?se things at Christmas and on [my]329-th?r?se f?te . Rather silly things , because [the shops]3638-the shops are n't good in [Port of Spain]3639-port of spain . "[329-th?r?se]

Later [she]1824-i said , " [You]329-th?r?se 'll be coming back by [Trinidad]122-trinidad , wo n't [you]329-th?r?se ? So [I]1824-i shall see [you]329-th?r?se then . Will [you]329-th?r?se be a long time in [the bush]3640-the bush ? "[1824-i]

" [I]329-th?r?se expect [you]329-th?r?se 'll be married by then . "[329-th?r?se]

" [Tony]219-tony , why have n't [you]329-th?r?se ever got married ? "[1824-i]

" But [I]329-th?r?se am . "[329-th?r?se]

" Married ? "[1824-i]

" Yes . "[329-th?r?se]

" [You]329-th?r?se 're teasing [me]1824-i . "[1824-i]

" No , honestly [I]329-th?r?se am . At least [I]329-th?r?se was . "[329-th?r?se]

" Oh . "[1824-i]

" Are [you]329-th?r?se surprised ? "[329-th?r?se]

" [D'you]329-th?r?se want to ? "[329-th?r?se]

" Did [I]1824-i ? [I]1824-i do n't know . "[1824-i]

[The Negro chauffeur]1825-the negro chauffeur drove [them]1826-they at great speed into [the town]1661-the town . Then [they]1826-they sat in [a rowing - boat]1828-a rowing - boat and bobbed slowly out to [the ship]1618-the ship . Earlier in the day , in good spirits , [they]1826-they had bought a stuffed fish . [Th?r?se]329-th?r?se found [she]329-th?r?se had left it behind at [the hotel]1466-the hotel . " It does n't matter , "[329-th?r?se] [she]329-th?r?se said .

* * * * *

Blue water came to an end after [Barbados]125-barbados . Round [Trinidad]122-trinidad [the sea]2560-the sea was opaque and colourless , full of the mud which [the Orinoco]112-orinoco brought down from [the mainland]1832-the mainland . [Th?r?se]329-th?r?se spent all that day in [[her]329-th?r?se cabin]3532-her cabin , doing [her]329-th?r?se packing .

Next day [she]329-th?r?se said good - bye to [Tony]219-tony in a hurry . [[Her]329-th?r?se father]3161-her father had come out to meet [her]329-th?r?se in [the tender]1835-the tender . [He]3161-her father was [a wiry bronzed man with a long grey moustache]1836-a wiry bronzed man with a long grey moustache . [He]3161-her father wore a panama hat and smart silk clothes , and smoked a cheroot ; [the complete slave - owner of the last century]1837-the complete slave - owner of the last century . [Th?r?se]329-th?r?se did not introduce [him]3161-her father to [Tony]219-tony . " [He]3161-her father was someone on [the ship]1618-the ship , "[329-th?r?se] [she]329-th?r?se explained , obviously .

[Tony]219-tony saw [her]329-th?r?se once next day in [the town]1661-the town , driving with [a lady who was obviously [[her]329-th?r?se mother]1566-her mother]1839-a lady who was obviously her mother . [She]329-th?r?se waved but did not stop . " [Reserved lot]3643-reserved lot , [these real old creoles]3644-these real old creoles , "[329-th?r?se] remarked [the passenger who had first made friends with [Tony]219-tony and had now attached [himself]1841-the passenger who had first made friends with tony and had now attached himself again again]1841-the passenger who had first made friends with tony and had now attached himself again . " Poor as [church]569-church mice most of [them]3644-these real old creoles , but stinking proud . Time and again [I]329-th?r?se 've palled up with [them]3644-these real old creoles on board and when [we]1844-they got to port it 's been good - bye . Do [they]3644-these real old creoles ever so much as ask [you]219-tony to [[their]3644-these real old creoles houses]3646-their houses ? Not [they]3644-these real old creoles . "[329-th?r?se]

[Tony]219-tony spent the two days with [[his]219-tony first friend who had business connections in [the place]2391-the place]1842-his first friend who had business connections in the place . On the second day it rained heavily and [they]1844-they could not leave [the terrace of [the hotel]1466-the hotel]1845-the terrace of the hotel . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger was engaged on some technical enquiries at [the Agricultural Institute]1847-the agricultural institute .

* * * * *

[Muddy sea between [Trinidad]122-trinidad and [Georgetown]127-georgetown]1848-muddy sea between trinidad and georgetown ; and [the ship lightened of cargo]1849-the ship lightened of cargo rolled heavily in the swell . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger took to [[his]316-dr messinger cabin]1713-his cabin once more . Rain fell continuously and a slight mist enclosed [them]1844-they so that [they]1844-they seemed to move in a small puddle of brown water ; the foghorn sounded regularly through the rain . [Scarcely a dozen passengers]1851-scarcely a dozen passengers remained on board and [Tony]219-tony prowled disconsolately about [the deserted decks]1852-the deserted decks or sat alone in [the music room]1853-the music room , [his]219-tony mind straying back along [the path [he]316-dr messinger had forbidden [it]1855-it]1854-the path he had forbidden it , to [the tall elm avenue]1856-the tall elm avenue at [Hetton]7-hetton and [the budding copses]1857-the budding copses .

Next day [they]1844-they arrived at [the mouth of [the Demerara]97-demerara]1858-the mouth of the demerara . [The customs sheds]1859-the customs sheds were heavy with the reek of sugar and loud with the buzzing of bees . There were lengthy formalities in disembarking [[their]1844-they stores]1860-their stores , [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger saw to it while [Tony]219-tony lit a cigar and strayed out on to [the quay]1861-the quay . Small shipping of all kinds lay round [them]1844-they ; on [the farther bank a low , green fringe of mangrove]1862-the farther bank a low , green fringe of mangrove ; behind , the tin roofs of [the town]1661-the town were visible among feathery palm trees ; everything steamed from the recent rain . [Black stevedores]1864-black stevedores grunted rhythmically at [their]1864-black stevedores work ; [West Indians]338-the indians trotted busily to and fro with invoices and bills of lading . [Presently Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger pronounced that everything was in order and that [they]1844-they could go into [the town]1661-the town to [[their]1844-they hotel]1866-their hotel .

[ II ]

The storm lantern stood on the ground between the two hammocks , which , in their white sheaths of mosquito net , looked like the cocoons of gigantic silkworms . It was eight o'clock , two hours after sundown ; [river and forest]1867-river and forest were already deep in night . [The howler monkeys]1868-the howler monkeys were silent but tree - frogs near at hand set up a continuous , hoarse chorus ; birds were awake , calling and whistling , and far in the depths about [them]1868-the howler monkeys came the occasional rending and reverberation of dead wood falling among the trees .

[The six black boys who manned]1869-the six black boys who manned [the boat]1870-the boat squatted at a distance round [their]1869-the six black boys who manned fire . [They]1869-the six black boys who manned had collected some cobs of maize , three days back in [a part of [the bush]3640-the bush]1871-a part of the bush , deserted now , choked and overrun with wild growth , that had once been [a farm]2426-a farm . ( [The rank second growth at [that place]1875-that place]1874-the rank second growth at that place had been full of alien plants , fruit and cereals , all gross now , and reverting to earlier type . ) [The boys]1876-the boys were roasting [their]1876-the boys cobs in the embers .

Fire and storm lantern together shed little light ; enough only to suggest the dilapidated roof over [their]1844-they heads , the heap of stores , disembarked and overrun by ants and , beyond , the undergrowth that had invaded [the clearing]1877-the clearing and the vast columns of tree - trunks that rose above [it]1877-the clearing , disappearing out of sight in the darkness .

Bats like blighted fruit hung in clusters from the thatch and great spiders rode across it astride [their]1844-they shadows . [This place]3402-this place had once been [a balata station]1879-a balata station . [It]3402-this place was [the farthest point of commercial penetration from [the coast]1763-the coast]1880-the farthest point of commercial penetration from the coast . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger marked [it]3402-this place on [his]316-dr messinger map with a triangle and named [it]3402-this place in red " [First Base Camp]3647-first base camp "[316-dr messinger] .

The first stage of the journey was over . For ten days [they]1844-they had been chugging upstream in [a broad , shallow boat]1882-a broad , shallow boat . Once or twice [they]1844-they had passed [rapids]1883-rapids ( there the outboard engine had been reinforced by paddles ; [the men]1884-the men strained in time to [the captain]1628-the captain 's count ; [the bo'sun]1886-the bo'sun stood in the bows with a long pole warding off the rocks ) . [They]1844-they had camped at sundown on [patches of sandbank]1887-patches of sandbank or in clearings cut from [the surrounding bush]1888-the surrounding bush . Once or twice [they]1844-they came to [a " house "[1844-they] left behind]1889-a " house " left behind by [balata bleeders]1890-balata bleeders or [gold washers]1891-gold washers .

All day [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger sprawled amidships among [[their]1844-they stores]1860-their stores , under an improvised canopy of palm thatch ; sometimes in the hot hours of the early afternoon [they]1844-they fell asleep . [They]1844-they ate in [the boat]1870-the boat , out of tins , and drank rum mixed with the water of [the river]1894-the river , which was mahogany brown but quite clear . The nights seemed interminable to [Tony]219-tony ; twelve hours of darkness , noisier than [a city square]1895-a city square with the squealing and croaking and trumpeting of [the bush denizens]1896-the bush denizens . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger could tell the hours by the succession of sounds . It was not possible to read by the light of the storm lantern . Sleep was irregular and brief after the days of lassitude and torpor . There was little to talk about ; everything had been said during the day , in the warm shade among [the stores]1897-the stores . [Tony]219-tony lay awake , scratching .

Since [they]1844-they had left [Georgetown]127-georgetown there had not been any part of [his]219-tony body that was ever wholly at ease . [His]219-tony face and neck were burned by the sun reflected from the water ; the skin was flaking off them so that [he]219-tony was unable to shave . The stiff growth of beard pricked [him]219-tony between chin and throat . Every exposed part of [his]219-tony skin was bitten by cabouri fly . [They]1844-they had found a way into the buttonholes of [his]219-tony shirt and the laces of [his]219-tony breeches ; mosquitoes had got [him]219-tony at the ankles when [he]219-tony changed into slacks for the evening . [He]219-tony had picked up b?tes rouges in the bush and [they]1844-they were crawling and burrowing under [his]219-tony skin ; the bitter oil which [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger had given [him]219-tony as protection had set up a rash of its own wherever [he]219-tony had applied it . Every evening after washing [he]219-tony had burned off a few ticks with a cigarette - end but [they]1844-they had left irritable little scars behind [them]1844-they ; so had the djiggas which one of [the black boys]1898-the black boys had dug out from under [his]219-tony toenails and the horny skin on [his]219-tony heels and the balls of [his]219-tony feet . A marabunta had left a painful swelling on [his]219-tony left hand .

As [Tony]219-tony scratched , [he]219-tony shook the framework from which the hammocks hung . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger turned over and said , " Oh , for [God]283-god 's sake . "[316-dr messinger] [He]219-tony tried not to scratch ; then [he]219-tony tried to scratch quietly ; then in a frenzy [he]219-tony scratched as hard as [he]219-tony could , breaking the skin in a dozen places . " Oh , for [God]283-god 's sake , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger .

" Half - past eight , "[219-tony] thought [Tony]219-tony . " In [London]23-london [they]1899-they are just beginning to collect for dinner . "[316-dr messinger] It was the time of year in [London]23-london when there were parties every night . ( Once , when [he]219-tony was trying to get engaged to [Brenda]233-brenda , [he]219-tony had gone to [them]1899-they all . If [they]1899-they had dined in [different houses]1900-different houses , [he]219-tony would search [the crowd]834-the crowd for [Brenda]233-brenda and hang about by the stairs waiting for [her]233-brenda to arrive . Later [he]219-tony would hang about to take [her]233-brenda [home]402-home . [Lady St Cloud]303-lady st cloud had done everything to make it easy for [him]219-tony . Later , after [they]1899-they were married , in the two years [they]1899-they had spent in [London]23-london before [[Tony]219-tony 's father]619-tony 's father died , [they]1899-they had been to fewer parties , one or two a week at the most , except for one very gay month , when [Brenda]233-brenda was well again after [John Andrew]174-john 's birth . ) [Tony]219-tony began to imagine a dinner party assembling at that moment in [London]23-london , with [Brenda]233-brenda there and the surprised look with which [she]233-brenda greeted [each new arrival]1904-each new arrival . If there was a fire [she]233-brenda would be as near it as [she]233-brenda could get . Would there be a fire at the end of May ? [He]219-tony could not remember . There were nearly always fires at [Hetton]7-hetton in the evening , whatever the season .

Then , after another bout of scratching , it occurred to [Tony]219-tony that it was not half - past eight in [England]13-england . There was five hours ' difference in time . [They]1899-they had altered [their]1899-they watches daily on the voyage out . Which way ? It ought to be easy to work out . The sun rose in [the east]2964-the east . [England]13-england was [east of [America]16-america]1906-east of america so [he]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger got the sun later . It came to [them]1899-they at second - hand and slightly soiled after [Polly Cockpurse]223-polly and [Mrs Beaver]170-beaver and [Princess Abdul Akbar]273-princess abdul akbar had finished with it ... Like [Polly]223-polly 's dresses which [Brenda]233-brenda used to buy for ten or fifteen pounds each ... [he]219-tony fell asleep .

[He]219-tony woke an hour later to hear [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger cursing , and to see [him]219-tony sitting astride [his]219-tony hammock working with bandages and iodine at [his]219-tony great toe .

" [A vampire bat]3648-a vampire bat got it . [I]1898-the black boys must have gone to sleep with [my]1898-the black boys foot against the netting . God knows how long [he]3648-a vampire bat had been at [it]3648-a vampire bat , before [I]1898-the black boys woke up . That lamp ought to keep [them]1898-the black boys off but it does n't seem to . "[1898-the black boys]

[The black boys]1898-the black boys were still awake , munching over the fire . " [Vampires]340-vampires plenty bad this side , [Chief]341-chief , "[1898-the black boys] [they]1898-the black boys said . " Dat for why [us]1898-the black boys no leave de fire . "[1898-the black boys]

" It 's just the way to get sick , blast it , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger . " [I]316-dr messinger may have lost pints of blood . "[316-dr messinger]

* * * * *

[Brenda]233-brenda and [Jock]187-jock were dancing together at [Anchorage House]129-anchorage house . It was late , the party was thinning , and now , for the first time that evening , it was possible to dance with pleasure . [The ballroom]832-the ballroom was hung with tapestry and lit by candles . [Lady Anchorage]342-lady anchorage had lately curtsied [her]342-lady anchorage farewell to [the last royalty]1909-the last royalty .

" How [I]233-brenda hate staying up late , "[233-brenda] [Brenda]233-brenda said , " but it seems a shame to take [[my]233-brenda Mr [Beaver]170-beaver]3649-my mr beaver away . [He]3649-my mr beaver 's so thrilled to be [here]2433-here , bless [him]3649-my mr beaver , and it was a great effort to get [him]3649-my mr beaver asked ... Come to think of it , "[233-brenda] [she]233-brenda added later , " [I]233-brenda suppose that this is the last year _ [I]233-brenda _ shall be able to go to this kind of party . "[233-brenda]

" [You]233-brenda 're going through with the divorce ? "[342-lady anchorage]

" [I]233-brenda do n't know , [Jock]187-jock . It does n't really depend on [me]233-brenda . It 's all a matter of holding down [Mr Beaver]191-beaver . [He]3649-my mr beaver 's getting very restive . [I]233-brenda have to feed [him]3649-my mr beaver a bit of high - life every week or so , and [I]233-brenda suppose that 'll all stop if there 's a divorce . Any news of [Tony]219-tony ? "[233-brenda]

" Not for some time now . [I]342-lady anchorage got a cable when [he]219-tony landed . [He]219-tony 's gone off on some expedition with [a crook doctor]3651-a crook doctor . "[342-lady anchorage]

" Is it _ absolutely _ safe ? "[233-brenda]

" Oh , [I]342-lady anchorage imagine so . [The whole world]3652-the whole world is civilized now , is n't it -- [charabancs]3653-charabancs and [Cook]3654-cook 's offices everywhere . "[342-lady anchorage]

" Yes , [I]233-brenda suppose it is ... [I]233-brenda hope [he]219-tony 's not _ brooding _ . [I]233-brenda should n't like to think of [him]219-tony being unhappy . "[233-brenda]

" [I]342-lady anchorage expect [he]219-tony 's getting used to things . "[342-lady anchorage]

" [I]233-brenda do hope so . [I]233-brenda 'm very fond of [Tony]219-tony , [you]342-lady anchorage know , in spite of the monstrous way [he]219-tony behaved . "[233-brenda]

* * * * *

There was [an Indian village]1910-an indian village a mile or two distant from [the camp]1911-the camp . It was here that [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger proposed to recruit [porters]1912-porters for the two - hundred - mile march that lay between [them]1913-they and [the Pie - wie country]1914-the pie - wie country . [The niggers]1915-the niggers were [river men]1916-river men and could not be taken into [Indian territory]1917-indian territory . [They]1915-the niggers would go back with [the boat]1870-the boat .

At dawn [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger drank a mug each of hot cocoa and ate some biscuits and what was left over from the bully beef opened the night before . Then [they]1913-they set out for [the village]579-the village . [One of [the blacks]1921-the blacks]1920-one of the blacks went in front with a cutlass to clear [the trail]1922-the trail . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger and [Tony]219-tony followed , one behind the other ; [another black]1923-another black came behind [them]1913-they carrying samples of trade goods -- a twenty - dollar Belgian gun , some rolls of printed cotton , hand - mirrors in coloured celluloid frames , some bottles of highly scented pomade .

It was a rough , unfrequented trail , encumbered by numerous fallen trunks ; [they]1913-they waded knee - deep through [two streams that ran to feed [the big river]1925-the big river]1924-two streams that ran to feed the big river ; underfoot there was sometimes a hard network of bare root , sometimes damp and slippery leaf - mould .

Presently [they]1913-they reached [the village]579-the village . [They]1913-they came into sight of [it]579-the village quite suddenly , emerging from the bush into a wide clearing . There were [eight or nine circular huts of mud and palm thatch]1927-eight or nine circular huts of mud and palm thatch . [No one]2345-no one was visible , but two or three columns of smoke , rising straight and thin into the morning air , told [them]1913-they that [the place]2391-the place was inhabited .

" [Dey people]3655-dey people all afeared , "[1930-the black boy] said [the black boy]1930-the black boy .

" Go and find [someone]419-someone to speak to [us]1913-they , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger .

[The nigger]1931-the nigger went to the low door of [the nearest house]1932-the nearest house and peered in .

" [Dere]3657-dere ai n't [no one]2345-no one but [women]2479-women [dere]3657-dere , "[1931-the nigger] [he]1931-the nigger reported . " [Dey dressing deirselves]343-dey dressing deirselves . Come on out dere , "[1931-the nigger] [he]1931-the nigger shouted into the gloom . " [De chief]3660-de chief want talk to [you]946-strangers . "[1931-the nigger]

At last , very shyly , [a little old woman]1933-a little old woman emerged , clad in the filthy calico gown that was kept for use in the presence of [strangers]946-strangers . [She]1933-a little old woman waddled towards [them]946-strangers on bandy legs . [Her]1933-a little old woman ankles were tightly bound with blue beads . [Her]1933-a little old woman hair was lank and ragged ; [her]1933-a little old woman eyes were fixed on the earthenware bowl of liquid which [she]1933-a little old woman carried . When [she]1933-a little old woman was a few feet from [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger [she]1933-a little old woman set the bowl on the ground , and , still with downcast eyes , shook hands with [them]946-strangers . Then [she]1933-a little old woman stopped , picked up the bowl once more and held it to [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger .

" [Gassiri]344-gassiri , "[316-dr messinger] [he]316-dr messinger explained , " the local drink made of fermented cassava . "[316-dr messinger]

[He]316-dr messinger drank some and handed the bowl to [Tony]219-tony . It contained a thick , purplish liquid . When [Tony]219-tony had drunk a little , [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger explained , " It is made in an interesting way . [The women]1051-the women chew the root up and spit it into a hollow tree - trunk . "[316-dr messinger]

[He]316-dr messinger then addressed [the woman in [Wapishiana]130-wapishiana]1935-the woman in wapishiana . [She]1935-the woman in wapishiana looked at [him]316-dr messinger for the first time . [Her]1935-the woman in wapishiana brown , Mongol face was perfectly blank , devoid alike of comprehension and curiosity . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger repeated and amplified [his]316-dr messinger question . [The woman]1936-the woman took the bowl from [Tony]219-tony and set it on the ground .

Meanwhile other faces were appearing at the doors of [the huts]1937-the huts . [Only one woman]1938-only one woman ventured out . [She]1938-only one woman was very stout and [she]1938-only one woman smiled confidently at [the visitors]1939-the visitors .

" Good morning , "[1938-only one woman] [she]1938-only one woman said . " How do [you]316-dr messinger do ? [I]1938-only one woman am [Rosa]345-rosa . [I]1938-only one woman speak English good . [I]1938-only one woman live bottom - side two years with [Mr Forbes]346-mr forbes . [You]316-dr messinger give [me]1938-only one woman cigarette . "[1938-only one woman]

" Why does n't [this woman]3662-this woman answer ? "[1938-only one woman]

" [She]3662-this woman no speak English . "[1938-only one woman]

" But [I]1938-only one woman was speaking [Wapishiana]130-wapishiana . "[1938-only one woman]

" [[She]3662-this woman [Macushi woman]3664-macushi woman]3663-she macushi woman . [All these people Macushi people]3665-all these people macushi people . "[1938-only one woman]

" Oh . [I]1938-only one woman did n't know . Where are [the men]1884-the men ? "[1938-only one woman]

" [Men]720-men all go hunting three days . "[1938-only one woman]

" When will [they]720-men be back ? "[1938-only one woman]

" [They]720-men go after bush - pig . "[1938-only one woman]

" When will [they]720-men be back ? "[1938-only one woman]

[Ten o'clock on [the river Waurupang]134-waurupang]1945-ten o'clock on the river waurupang was question time at [Westminster]135-westminster . _ No . 20 . _

" _ To ask [the Minister of Agriculture]3681-the minister of agriculture whether in view of the dumping in [this country]3682-this country of Japanese pork pies , [the right honourable member]3683-the right honourable member is prepared to consider a modification of the eight - and - a - half - score basic pig from two and a half inches of thickness round the belly as originally specified , to two inches . _ "[1949-the under - secretary]

Replying for [the Minister]1948-the minister , [the under - secretary]1949-the under - secretary said : " The matter is receiving the closest attention . As [the honourable member]3684-the honourable member is no doubt aware , the question of the importation of pork pies is a matter for [the Board of Trade]3685-the board of trade , not for [the Board of Agriculture]3686-the board of agriculture . With regard to the specifications of the basic pig , [I]1949-the under - secretary must remind [the honourable member]3684-the honourable member that , as [he]3684-the honourable member is doubtless aware , the eight - and - a - half - score pig is modelled on the requirements of the bacon curers and has no direct relation to pig meat for sale in pies . That is being dealt with by a separate committee who have not yet made [their]1947-a few members report . "[1949-the under - secretary]

" Would [the honourable member]3684-the honourable member consider an increase of the specified maximum of fatness on the shoulders ? "[1949-the under - secretary]

" [I]1949-the under - secretary must have notice of that question . "[1949-the under - secretary]

[Jock]187-jock left [the House]2368-the house that afternoon with the comfortable feeling that [he]187-jock had at last done something tangible in the interest of [[his]187-jock constituents]1946-his constituents .

* * * * *

Two days later [the Indians]338-the indians returned from hunting . It was tedious waiting . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger put in some hours daily in checking [the stores]1897-the stores . [Tony]219-tony went into the bush with [his]219-tony gun , but the game had all migrated from [that part of [the river bank]1954-the river bank]1953-that part of the river bank . [One of [the black boys]1898-the black boys]1955-one of the black boys was badly injured in the foot and calf by a sting - ray ; after that [they]1957-they stopped bathing and washed in a zinc pail . When the news of [the Indians]338-the indians ' return reached [camp]3679-camp , [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger went to [the village]579-the village to see [them]338-the indians , but a feast had already started and [everyone in [the place]2391-the place]1960-everyone in the place was drunk . [The men]1884-the men lay in [their]1884-the men hammocks and [the women]1051-the women trotted between [them]1884-the men carrying calabashes of cassiri . Everything reeked of roast pork .

" It will take [them]1898-the black boys a week to get sober , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger .

All that week [the black boys]1898-the black boys lounged in [camp]3679-camp ; sometimes [they]1898-the black boys washed [their]1898-the black boys clothes and hung [them]1898-the black boys out on the gunwales of [the boat]1870-the boat to dry in the sun ; sometimes [they]1898-the black boys went fishing and came back with a massive catch , speared on a stick ( the flesh was tasteless and rubbery ) ; usually in the evenings [they]1898-the black boys sang songs round the fire . [The fellow who had been stung]1967-the fellow who had been stung kept to [his]1967-the fellow who had been stung hammock , groaning loudly and constantly asking for medicine .

On the sixth day [the Indians]338-the indians began to appear . [They]338-the indians shook hands all round and then retired to the margin of the bush where [they]338-the indians stood gazing at [the camp]1911-the camp equipment . [Tony]219-tony tried to photograph [them]338-the indians but [they]338-the indians ran away giggling like [schoolgirls]1969-schoolgirls . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger spread out on the ground the goods [he]316-dr messinger had bought for barter .

[They]338-the indians retired at sundown but on the seventh day [they]338-the indians came again , greatly reinforced . [The entire population of [the village]579-the village]1970-the entire population of the village was there . [Rosa]345-rosa sat down on [Tony]219-tony 's hammock under the thatch roof .

" Give [me]345-rosa cigarettes , "[345-rosa] [she]345-rosa said .

" [You]316-dr messinger tell [them]338-the indians [I]316-dr messinger want [men]720-men to go [Pie - wie country]3690-pie - wie country , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger .

" [Pie - wie bad people]3691-pie - wie bad people . [Macushi people]3692-macushi people no go with [Pie - wie people]3693-pie - wie people . "[1972-twelve men]

" [You]316-dr messinger say [I]1972-twelve men want [ten men]3694-ten men . [I]1972-twelve men give [them]3694-ten men guns . "[1972-twelve men]

" [You]316-dr messinger give [me]1972-twelve men cigarettes ... "[1972-twelve men]

Negotiations lasted for two days . Eventually [twelve men]1972-twelve men agreed to come ; [seven of [them]1972-twelve men]1973-seven of them insisted on bringing [[their]1973-seven of them wives]2846-their wives with [them]1973-seven of them . One of these was [Rosa]345-rosa . When everything was arranged there was a party in [the village]579-the village and [all the Indians]1976-all the indians got drunk again . This time , however , it was a shorter business as [the women]1051-the women had not had time to prepare much cassiri . In three days [the caravan]1978-the caravan was able to set out .

[One of [the men]1884-the men]1979-one of the men had a long , single - barrelled , muzzle - loading gun ; [several others]1981-several others carried bows and arrows ; [they]1981-several others were naked except for red cotton cloths round [their]1981-several others loins . [The women]1051-the women wore grubby calico dresses -- [they]1983-they had been issued to [them]1051-the women years back by [an itinerant preacher]1984-an itinerant preacher and kept for occasions of this kind ; [they]1051-the women had wicker panniers on [their]1051-the women shoulders , supported by a band across the forehead . All the heaviest luggage was carried by [the women in [these panniers]1986-these panniers]1985-the women in these panniers , including the rations for [themselves]1051-the women and [[their]1051-the women men]1987-their men . [Rosa]345-rosa had , in addition , an umbrella with a dented , silver crook , a relic of [her]345-rosa association with [Mr Forbes]346-mr forbes .

[The Negroes]1988-the negroes returned downstream to [the coast]1763-the coast . A dump of provisions , in substantial tin casing , was left in the ruinous shelter by [the bank]1990-the bank .

" There 's [no one to touch it]3695-no one to touch it . [We]1992-we can send back for it in case of emergency from [the Pie - wie country]321-the indians , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger .

" From now onwards the map is valueless to [us]1992-we , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger with relish .

( Roll up the map -- [you]1994-you will not need it again for how many years , said [William Pitt]348-william pitt ... memories of [[Tony]219-tony 's private school]1995-tony 's private school came back to [him]348-william pitt at [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger 's words , of inky little desks and a coloured picture of [a Viking raid]1996-a viking raid , of [Mr Trotter]349-mr trotter who had taught [him]348-william pitt history and wore very vivid ties . )

[Jenny Abdul Akbar]271-jenny was in [the room]470-the room with [her]271-jenny . [She]271-jenny came across every morning now in [her]271-jenny dressing - gown and [they]1999-they read the newspaper together . [Her]271-jenny dressing - gown was of striped Berber silk .

At one o'clock [Jenny]271-jenny came in to say good - bye ( [she]271-jenny had a latch - key of [Brenda]233-brenda 's ) , dressed for a cosy lunch . * * * * *

[They]2001-they walked for a fortnight , averaging about fifteen miles a day . Sometimes [they]2001-they would do much more and sometimes much less ; [the Indian who went in front]2002-the indian who went in front decided [the camping places]2003-the camping places ; [they]2002-the indian who went in front depended on water and evil spirits .

[Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger made a compass traverse of [their]2001-they route . It gave [him]316-dr messinger something to think about . [He]316-dr messinger took readings every hour from [an aneroid]2004-an aneroid . In the evening , if [they]2001-they had halted early enough , [he]316-dr messinger employed the last hours of daylight in elaborating a chart . " _ [Dry watercourse]3720-dry watercourse , [three deserted huts]3721-three deserted huts , stony ground .... _ "[316-dr messinger]

" [We]2001-they are now in [the Amazon system of rivers]3722-the amazon system of rivers , "[316-dr messinger] [he]316-dr messinger announced with satisfaction one day . " [You]345-rosa see , the water is running south . "[316-dr messinger] But almost immediately [they]2001-they crossed [a stream flowing in the opposite direction]2005-a stream flowing in the opposite direction . " Very curious , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger . " A discovery of genuine scientific value . "[316-dr messinger]

Next day [they]2001-they waded through four streams at intervals of two miles , running alternately north and south . The chart began to have a mythical appearance .

" Is there a name for [any of [these streams]3724-these streams]3723-any of these streams ? "[316-dr messinger] [he]316-dr messinger asked [Rosa]345-rosa .

" [Macushi people]3692-macushi people called [him]316-dr messinger [Waurupang]134-waurupang . "[316-dr messinger]

" No , not [the river where [we]2001-they first camped]3726-the river where we first camped . _ [These rivers]3727-these rivers . _ "[316-dr messinger]

" Yes , [Waurupang]134-waurupang . "[316-dr messinger]

" _ [This river]3728-this river here . _ "[316-dr messinger]

" [Macushi people]3692-macushi people call [him]316-dr messinger all [Waurupang]134-waurupang . "[316-dr messinger]

" It 's hopeless , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger .

When [they]2001-they were near [water]2006-water [they]2001-they forced [their]2001-they way through blind bush ; the trail there was grown over and barred by timber ; only Indian eyes and Indian memory could trace its course ; sometimes [they]2001-they crossed little patches of dry savannah , dun grass growing in tufts from the baked earth ; thousands of lizards scampered and darted before [their]2001-they feet and the grass rustled like newspaper ; it was burning hot in [these enclosed spaces]2007-these enclosed spaces . Sometimes [they]2001-they climbed up into the wind , over loose red pebbles that bruised [their]2001-they feet ; after these painful ascents [they]2001-they would lie in the wind till [their]2001-they wet clothes grew cold against [their]2001-they bodies ; from these low eminences [they]2001-they could see [other hill - tops]2008-other hill - tops and the belts of bush through which [they]2001-they had travelled , and the file of [porters]1912-porters trailing behind [them]2001-they . As [each man]2010-each man and [woman]2723-woman arrived [he]2010-each man sank on to the dry grass and rested against [his]2010-each man load ; when [the last of [them]2001-they]2012-the last of them came up with [the party]2013-the party [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger would give the word and [they]2001-they would start off again , descending into [the green heart of [the forest]3576-the forest before [them]2001-they]2014-the green heart of the forest before them .

[Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger seldom spoke to [one another]1573-one another , either when [they]2001-they were marching or at the halts , for [they]2001-they were constantly strained and exhausted . In the evenings after [they]2001-they had washed and changed into dry shirts and flannel trousers , [they]2001-they talked a little , mostly about the number of miles [they]2001-they had done that day , [their]2001-they probable position and the state of [their]2001-they feet . [They]2001-they drank rum and water after [their]2001-they bath ; for supper there was usually bully beef stewed with rice and flour dumplings . [The Indians]338-the indians ate farine , smoked hog and occasional delicacies picked up by the way -- armadillo , iguana , fat white grubs from the palm trees . [The women]1051-the women had some dried fish with [them]1051-the women that lasted for eight days ; the smell grew stronger every day until the stuff was eaten ; then it still hung about [them]2001-they and [the stores]1897-the stores , but grew fainter until it merged into the general , indefinable smell of [the camp]1911-the camp .

There were [no Indians]2020-no indians living in [this country]3682-this country . In the last five days of the march [they]2001-they suffered from lack of water . [The streams]2022-the streams [they]2001-they came to were mostly dry ; [they]2001-they had to reconnoitre up and down [their]2001-they beds in search of tepid , stagnant puddles . But after two weeks [they]2001-they came to [a river]2023-a river once more , flowing deep and swift to [the south - east]2024-the south - east . This was [the border of [the Pie - wie country]1914-the pie - wie country]2025-the border of the pie - wie country and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger marked [the place where [they]2001-they stopped [Second Base Camp]141-second base camp]2027-the place where they stopped second base camp . [The cabouri fly]2028-the cabouri fly infested [this stream]2029-this stream in clouds .

* * * * *

" [John]174-john , [I]2028-the cabouri fly think it 's time [you]174-john had a holiday . "[2028-the cabouri fly]

" A holiday what from , [mumsy]2353-mumsy ? "[2028-the cabouri fly]

" A change ... [I]2028-the cabouri fly 'm going to [California]86-california in July . To the [Fischbaums]142-fischbaums -- [Mrs Arnold Fischbaum]353-mrs arnold fischbaum , not [the one who lives in [Paris]61-paris]3731-the one who lives in paris . [I]2028-the cabouri fly think it would do [you]174-john good to come with [me]2028-the cabouri fly . "[2028-the cabouri fly]

" Yes , [mumsy]2353-mumsy . "[2028-the cabouri fly]

" [You]2353-mumsy _ would _ like it , would n't [you]2353-mumsy ? "[2028-the cabouri fly]

" [Me]2028-the cabouri fly ? Yes , [I]2028-the cabouri fly 'd like it . "[2028-the cabouri fly]

" [You]2353-mumsy 've picked up that way of talking from [Brenda]233-brenda . It sounds ridiculous in [a man]414-a man . "[2028-the cabouri fly]

" Sorry , [mumsy]2353-mumsy . "[2028-the cabouri fly]

" All right then , that 's settled . "[2028-the cabouri fly]

* * * * *

At sunset [the cabouri fly]2028-the cabouri fly disappeared . Until then , through the day , it was necessary to keep covered ; [they]2028-the cabouri fly settled on any exposed flesh like house - flies upon jam ; it was only when [they]2028-the cabouri fly were gorged that [their]2028-the cabouri fly bite was perceptible ; [they]2028-the cabouri fly left behind a crimson , smarting circle with a black dot at its centre . [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger wore cotton gloves which [they]2028-the cabouri fly had brought for the purpose , and muslin veils , hanging down under [their]2028-the cabouri fly hats . Later [they]2028-the cabouri fly employed [two women]2031-two women to squat beside [their]2028-the cabouri fly hammocks and fan [them]2028-the cabouri fly with leafy boughs ; the slightest breeze was enough to disperse the flies , but as soon as [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger dozed [the women]1051-the women would lay aside [their]1051-the women work , and [they]1051-the women woke instantly , stung in a hundred places . [The Indians]338-the indians bore the insects as [cows bear horse - flies]2033-cows bear horse - flies ; passively with occasional fretful outbursts when [they]338-the indians would slap [their]338-the indians shoulders and thighs .

After dark there was some relief , for there were few mosquitoes at [this camp]2034-this camp , but [they]338-the indians could hear the vampire bats all night long nuzzling and flapping against [their]338-the indians netting .

[The Indians]338-the indians would not go hunting in [this forest]2035-this forest . [They]338-the indians said there was no game , but [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger said it was because [they]338-the indians were afraid of the evil spirits of [the Pie - wie people]2036-the pie - wie people . Provisions were not lasting as well as [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger had calculated . During the march it had been difficult to keep a proper guard over [the stores]1897-the stores . [They]1897-the stores were short of a bag of farine , half a bag of sugar and a bag of rice . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger instituted careful rationing ; [he]316-dr messinger served [them]1897-the stores [himself]316-dr messinger , measuring everything strictly in an enamel cup ; even so , [the women]1051-the women managed to get to the sugar behind [his]316-dr messinger back . [He]316-dr messinger and [Tony]219-tony had finished the rum , except for one bottle which was kept in case of emergency .

" [We]1897-the stores ca n't go on breaking into [tinned stores]3735-tinned stores , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger peevishly . " [The men]1884-the men must go out and shoot something . "[316-dr messinger]

But [they]1897-the stores received the orders with expressionless , downcast faces and remained in [camp]3679-camp .

" No birds , no animals here , "[345-rosa] explained [Rosa]345-rosa . " All gone . Maybe [they]1897-the stores get some fish . "[345-rosa]

But [the Indians]338-the indians could not be persuaded to exert [themselves]338-the indians . [They]338-the indians could see the sacks and bales of food heaped on [the bank]1990-the bank ; it would be plenty of time to start hunting and fishing when that had been exhausted .

Meanwhile there were canoes to be built .

" This is clearly [Amazon water]3737-amazon water , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger . " [It]3737-amazon water probably flows into [the Rio Branco]143-the rio branco or [the Rio Negro]144-the rio negro . [The Pie - wies]321-the indians live along [the bank]1990-the bank , and [the City]3553-the city , from all accounts , must be downstream of [us]338-the indians , up [one of [the tributaries]3741-the tributaries]3740-one of the tributaries . When [we]338-the indians reach [the first Pie - wie village]3742-the first pie - wie village [we]338-the indians will be able to get guides . "[316-dr messinger]

The canoes were made of woodskin . Three days were spent in finding trees of suitable age and straightness and in felling them . [They]338-the indians cut four trees and worked on them where [they]338-the indians lay , clearing the bush for a few feet round [them]338-the indians . [They]338-the indians stripped the bark with [their]338-the indians broad - bladed knives ; that took another week . [They]338-the indians worked patiently but clumsily ; [one woodskin]2041-one woodskin was split in getting it off the trunk . There was nothing [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger could do to help . [They]338-the indians spent that week guarding the sugar from [the women]1051-the women . As [the men]1884-the men moved about [the camp]1911-the camp and the surrounding bush , [their]1884-the men steps were soundless ; [their]1884-the men bare feet seemed never to disturb the fallen leaves , [their]1884-the men bare shoulders made no rustle in the tangled undergrowth ; [their]1884-the men speech was brief and scarcely audible , [they]1884-the men never joined in the chatter and laughter of [[their]1884-the men women]940-their women ; sometimes [they]1884-the men gave little grunts as [they]1884-the men worked ; only once [they]1884-the men were merry , when one of [them]1884-the men let [his]2046-his knife slip as [he]2046-his was working on the tree - trunk and cut deeply into the ball of [his]2046-his thumb . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger dressed the wound with iodine , lint and bandages . After that [the women]1051-the women constantly solicited [him]316-dr messinger , showing [him]316-dr messinger little scratches on [their]1051-the women arms and legs and asking for iodine .

Two of the trees were finished on one day , then another next day ( that was the one which split ) and the fourth two days after that ; it was a larger tree than the others . When the last fibre was severed , [four men]3236-four men got round the trunk and lifted the skin clear . It curled up again at once , making a hollow cylinder , which [the men]1884-the men carried down to [the waterside]2050-the waterside and set afloat , fastening it to a tree with a loop of vine - rope .

When all the woodskins were ready it was an easy matter to make canoes of [them]1884-the men . [Four men]3236-four men held [them]1884-the men open while [two others]2052-two others fixed the struts . The ends were left open , and curled up slightly so as to lift them clear ( when [the craft]2053-the craft was fully laden it drew only an inch or two of water ) . Then [the men]1884-the men set about fashioning some single - bladed paddles ; that , too , was an easy matter .

Every day [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger asked [Rosa]345-rosa , " When will [the boats]3743-the boats be ready ? Ask [the men]1884-the men . "[345-rosa] And [she]345-rosa replied , " Just now . "[345-rosa]

" How many days -- four?--five?--how many ? "[316-dr messinger]

" No , not many . [Boats]354-boats finish just now . "[345-rosa]

At last when it was clear that the work was nearly complete , [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger busied [himself]316-dr messinger with arrangements . [He]316-dr messinger sorted out [the stores]1897-the stores , dividing the necessary freight into [two groups]2056-two groups ; [he]316-dr messinger and [Tony]219-tony were to sit in [separate boats]2057-separate boats and each had with [him]316-dr messinger a rifle and ammunition , a camera , tinned rations , trade goods and [his]316-dr messinger own luggage . [The third canoe , which would be manned solely by [Indians]321-the indians]2058-the third canoe , which would be manned solely by indians , was to hold the flour and rice , sugar and farine and the rations for [the men]1884-the men . The canoes would not hold all the stores and an " emergency dump "[345-rosa] was made a little way up [the bank]1990-the bank .

" [We]1884-the men shall take [eight men]3745-eight men with [us]1884-the men . [Four]3746-four can stay behind with [the women]1051-the women to guard [the camp]1911-the camp . [I]345-rosa do n't think [they]355-these macushis will rob [the stores]1897-the stores . There is nothing here that would be much use to [them]355-these macushis . "[345-rosa]

" Yes , perhaps [we]1884-the men had . [I]345-rosa will tell [her]345-rosa . "[345-rosa]

That evening everything was finished except the paddles . In the first exhilarating hour of darkness , when [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger were able to discard the gloves and veils that had been irking [them]2061-them all day , [they]2061-them called [Rosa]345-rosa across to [the part of [the camp]1911-the camp where [they]2061-them ate and slept]2062-the part of the camp where they ate and slept .

" [Rosa]345-rosa , [we]1884-the men have decided to take [you]345-rosa down [the river]1894-the river with [us]1884-the men . [We]1884-the men need [you]345-rosa to help [us]1884-the men talk to [the men]1884-the men . Understand ? "[2061-them]

[Rosa]345-rosa said nothing ; [her]345-rosa face was perfectly blank , lit from below by the storm lantern that stood on a box between [them]2061-them ; the shadow of [her]345-rosa high cheekbones hid [her]345-rosa eyes ; lank , ragged hair , a tenuous straggle of tattooing along the forehead and lip , rotund body in its filthy cotton gown , bandy brown legs .

" Understand ? "[345-rosa]

But still [she]345-rosa said nothing ; [she]345-rosa seemed to be looking over [their]2061-them heads into [the dark forest]2064-the dark forest , but [her]345-rosa eyes were lost in shadow .

" Listen , [Rosa]345-rosa , [all women]1323-all women and [four men]3236-four men stay here in [camp]3679-camp . * * * * *

Next day [the boats]3743-the boats were ready . By noon [they]3743-the boats were launched and tied in to [the bank]1990-the bank . [The Indians]321-the indians went silently about the business of preparing [their]321-the indians dinner . [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger ate tongue , boiled rice and some tinned peaches .

" [We]3782-we 're all right for [stores]3789-stores , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger . " There 's enough for three weeks at the shortest and [we]3782-we are bound to come across [the Pie - wies]321-the indians in a day or two . [We]3782-we will start to - morrow . "[316-dr messinger]

[The Indians]2072-the indians ' wages , in rifles , fish hooks and rolls of cotton , had been left behind for [them]2072-the indians at [[their]2072-the indians village]2073-their village . There were still half a dozen boxes of " trade "[316-dr messinger] for use during the later stages of the journey . A leg of bush - pig was worth a handful of shot or twenty gun caps in that currency ; a fat game - bird cost a necklace .

When dinner was over , at about one o'clock , [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger called [Rosa]345-rosa over to [them]2072-the indians . " [We]3782-we start to - morrow , "[316-dr messinger] [he]316-dr messinger said .

" Yes , just now . "[316-dr messinger]

[Rosa]345-rosa said nothing .

" Understand ? "[316-dr messinger]

" [No peoples]3799-no peoples go in [boats]3758-boats , "[345-rosa] [she]345-rosa said . There was a long pause ; at last [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger said , " [You]1884-the men tell [the men]1884-the men to come here ....
