[They]2074-they could see [Rosa]345-rosa talking at the fireside but [none of the group]2075-none of the group moved . Presently , having delivered [her]345-rosa message , [she]345-rosa was silent and squatted down among [them]2074-they with the head of one of the women between [her]345-rosa knees . [She]345-rosa had been searching it for lice when [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger 's summons had interrupted [her]345-rosa .

" [We]2074-they 'd better go across and talk to [them]2074-they . "[922-the others]

[Some of [the Indians]321-the indians]2076-some of the indians were in hammocks . [The others]922-the others were squatting on [their]922-the others heels ; [they]922-the others had scraped earth over the fire and extinguished it . [They]2074-they gazed at [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger with slit , pig eyes . Only [Rosa]345-rosa seemed incurious ; [her]345-rosa head was averted ; all [her]345-rosa attention went to [her]345-rosa busy fingers as [she]345-rosa picked and crunched the lice from [[her]345-rosa friend]2078-her friend 's hair .

" What 's the matter ? "[316-dr messinger] asked [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger . " [I]316-dr messinger told [you]345-rosa to bring [the men]1884-the men [here]2433-here . "[316-dr messinger]

[Rosa]345-rosa said nothing .

" [So Macushi people]3808-so macushi people are [cowards]3809-cowards . [They]3808-so macushi people are afraid of [Pie - wie people]3693-pie - wie people . "[345-rosa]

" It is [the cassava field]3811-the cassava field , "[345-rosa] said [Rosa]345-rosa . " [We]3812-we must go back to dig the cassava . Otherwise it will be bad . "[345-rosa]

" Listen . [I]345-rosa want [the men]1884-the men for one , two weeks . No more . After that , all finish . [They]1884-the men can go [home]402-home . "[345-rosa]

" It is the time to dig the cassava . [Macushi people]3692-macushi people dig cassava before the big rains . [All people]3802-all people go [home]402-home just now . "[345-rosa]

" It 's pure blackmail , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger . " Let 's get out some trade goods . "[316-dr messinger]

[He]316-dr messinger and [Tony]219-tony together prised open one of the cases and began to spread out the contents on a blanket . [They]2079-they had chosen these things together at [a cheap store in [Oxford Street]148-oxford street]2080-a cheap store in oxford street . [The Indians]2072-the indians watched the display in unbroken silence . There were bottles of scent and pills , bright celluloid combs set with glass jewels , mirrors , pocket knives with embossed aluminium handles , ribbons and necklaces and barter of more solid worth in the form of axe heads , brass cartridge cases and flat , red flasks of gunpowder .

" [You]345-rosa give [me]345-rosa this , "[345-rosa] said [Rosa]345-rosa picking out a pale blue rosette , that had been made as a [boat race favour]2082-boat race favour . " Give [me]345-rosa this , "[345-rosa] [she]345-rosa repeated , rubbing some drops of scent into the palm of [her]345-rosa hands and inhaling deeply .

" [Each man]2010-each man can choose three things from this box if [he]2010-each man comes in [the boats]3743-the boats . "[345-rosa]

But [Rosa]345-rosa replied monotonously , " [Macushi peoples]3766-macushi peoples dig [cassava field]3821-cassava field just now . "[345-rosa]

" It 's no good , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger after half an hour 's fruitless negotiation . " [We]3822-we shall have to try with the mice . [I]345-rosa wanted to keep [them]2083-they till [we]3822-we reached [the Pie - wies]3583-the pie - wies . It 's a pity . But [they]2083-they 'll fall for the mice , [you]3824-you see . [I]345-rosa _ know _ the Indian mind . "[345-rosa]

These mice were comparatively expensive articles ; [they]2083-they had cost three and sixpence each , and [Tony]219-tony remembered vividly the embarrassment with which [he]219-tony had witnessed [their]2083-they demonstration on the floor of [the toy department]2084-the toy department .

[They]2083-they were of German manufacture ; the size of large rats , but conspicuously painted in spots of green and white ; [they]2083-they had large glass eyes , stiff whiskers and green - and - white - ringed tails ; they ran on hidden wheels , and inside them were little bells that jingled as [they]2083-they moved . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger took one out of [their]2083-they box , unwrapped the tissue - paper and held it up to general scrutiny . There was no doubt that [he]316-dr messinger had captured [[his]316-dr messinger audience]2085-his audience 's interest . Then [he]316-dr messinger wound it up . [The Indians]321-the indians stirred apprehensively at the sound .

The ground where [they]2083-they were camping was hard mud , inundated at flood time . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger put the toy down at [his]316-dr messinger feet and set it going ; tinkling merrily it ran towards [the group of [Indians]321-the indians]2086-the group of indians . For a moment , [Tony]219-tony was afraid that it would turn over or become stuck against a root , but the mechanism was unimpaired and by good chance there was a clear course . The effect exceeded anything that [he]219-tony had expected . There was a loud intake of breath , a series of horrified , small grunts , a high wail of terror from [the women]1051-the women , and a sudden stampede ; a faint patter of bare brown feet among the fallen leaves , bare limbs , quiet as bats , pushed through the undergrowth , ragged cotton gowns caught and tore in the thorn bushes . Before the toy had run down , before it had jingled its way to the place where [the nearest Indian]2088-the nearest indian had been squatting , [the camp]1911-the camp was empty .

" Well , [I]316-dr messinger 'm damned , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger , " that 's better than [I]316-dr messinger expected . "[316-dr messinger]

" More than [you]219-tony expected , anyway . "[316-dr messinger]

" Oh , it 's all right . [They]2086-the group of indians 'll come back . [I]316-dr messinger know [them]2086-the group of indians . "[316-dr messinger]

But by sundown there was still no sign . Throughout the hot afternoon [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger , shrouded from [cabouri]0-winchester fly , sprawled in [their]2083-they hammocks . The empty canoes lay in [the river]1894-the river ; the mechanical mouse had been put away . At sundown [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger said , " [We]2083-they 'd better make a fire . [They]2086-the group of indians 'll come back when it is dark . "[316-dr messinger]

[They]2083-they brushed the earth away from the old embers , brought new wood and made a fire ; [they]2083-they lit the storm lantern .

" [We]2083-they 'd better get some supper , "[219-tony] said [Tony]219-tony .

[They]2083-they boiled water and made some cocoa , opened a tin of salmon and finished the peaches that were left over from mid - day . [They]2083-they lit [their]2083-they pipes and drew the sheaths of mosquito netting across [their]2083-they hammocks . Most of this time [they]2083-they were silent . Presently [they]2083-they decided to go to sleep .

" [We]2083-they shall find [them]2086-the group of indians all here in the morning , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger . " [They]2086-the group of indians 're [an odd bunch]3825-an odd bunch . "[316-dr messinger]

All round [them]2083-they the voices of the bush whistled and croaked , changing with the hours as the night wore on to morning .

* * * * *

Dawn broke in [London]23-london , clear and sweet , dove grey and honey , with promise of good weather ; the lamps in [the streets]1796-the streets paled and disappeared ; [the empty streets]2092-the empty streets ran with water , and the rising sun caught it as it bubbled round the hydrants ; [the men in overalls]2093-the men in overalls swung the nozzles of [their]2093-the men in overalls hoses from side to side and the water jetted and cascaded in a sparkle of light .

" Let 's have the window open , "[233-brenda] said [Brenda]233-brenda . " It 's stuffy in [here]2433-here . "[233-brenda]

[The waiter]997-the waiter drew back the curtains , opened the windows .

" It 's quite light , "[233-brenda] [she]233-brenda added .

" After five . Ought n't [we]2083-they to go to bed ? "[997-the waiter]

" Yes . "[997-the waiter]

" Only another week and then all the parties will be over , "[170-beaver] said [Beaver]170-beaver .

" Yes . "[997-the waiter]

" Well , let 's go . "[997-the waiter]

" All right . Can [you]170-beaver pay ? [I]997-the waiter just have n't any money . "[997-the waiter]

[They]2083-they had come on after the party , for breakfast at [a club [Daisy]228-marjorie had opened]2095-a club daisy had opened . [Beaver]170-beaver paid for the kippers and tea . " Eight shillings , "[997-the waiter] [he]997-the waiter said . " How does [Daisy]228-marjorie expect to make a success of [the place]2391-the place when [she]228-marjorie charges prices like that ? "[997-the waiter]

" It does seem a lot .... So [you]170-beaver really _ are _ going to [America]16-america ? "[997-the waiter]

" [I]997-the waiter must . [Mother]253-mother has taken the tickets . "[997-the waiter]

" Nothing [I]997-the waiter 've said to - night makes any difference ? "[997-the waiter]

" [Darling]2359-darling , do n't go on . [We]2083-they 've been through all that . [You]2359-darling know it 's the only thing that _ can _ happen . Why spoil the last week ? "[997-the waiter]

" [You]170-beaver _ have _ enjoyed the summer , have n't [you]170-beaver ? "[997-the waiter]

" Of course ... well , shall [we]2083-they go ? "[997-the waiter]

" Yes . [You]2359-darling need n't bother to see [me]997-the waiter [home]402-home . "[997-the waiter]

" Sure [you]170-beaver do n't mind ? [It]402-home _ is _ miles out of the way and it 's late . "[997-the waiter]

" There 's no knowing what [I]997-the waiter mind . "[997-the waiter]

" [Brenda]233-brenda , [darling]2359-darling , for heaven 's sake ... It is n't like [you]170-beaver to go on like this . "[997-the waiter]

" [I]997-the waiter never was one for making [myself]997-the waiter expensive . "[997-the waiter]

* * * * *

[The Indians]2072-the indians returned during the night , while [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger were asleep ; without a word spoken [the little people]2097-the little people crept out of hiding ; [the women]1051-the women had removed [their]1051-the women clothes and left [them]1051-the women at a distance so that no twig should betray [their]1051-the women movements ; [their]1051-the women naked bodies moved soundlessly through the undergrowth ; the glowing embers of the fire and the storm lantern twenty yards away were [their]2072-the indians only light ; there was no moon . [They]2072-the indians collected [their]2072-the indians wicker baskets and [their]2072-the indians rations of farine , [their]2072-the indians bows and arrows , the gun and [their]2072-the indians broad - bladed knives ; [they]2072-the indians rolled up [their]2072-the indians hammocks into compact cylinders . [They]2072-the indians took nothing with [them]2072-the indians that was not [theirs]2072-the indians . Then [they]2072-the indians crept back through the shadows , into the darkness .

When [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger awoke it was clear to [them]2072-the indians what had happened .

" The situation is grave , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger . " But not desperate . "[316-dr messinger]

[ IV ]

For four days [Tony]219-tony and [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger paddled downstream . [They]2072-the indians sat , balancing [themselves]2072-the indians precariously , at the two ends of [the canoe]2099-the canoe ; between [them]2072-the indians [they]2072-the indians had piled the most essential of [their]2072-the indians stores ; the remainder , with the other canoes , had been left at [the camp]1911-the camp , to be called for when [they]2072-the indians had recruited help from [the Pie - wies]321-the indians . Even the minimum which [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger had selected over - weighted [the craft]2053-the craft so that it was dangerously low ; any movement brought the water to the lip of the gunwale and threatened disaster ; it was heavy to steer and [they]2072-the indians made slow progress , contenting [themselves]2072-the indians , for the most part , with keeping end on , and drifting with the current .

Twice [they]2072-the indians came to stretches of cataract , and here [they]2072-the indians drew in to [the bank]1990-the bank , unloaded and waded beside [the boat]1870-the boat , sometimes plunging waist - deep , sometimes clambering over the rocks , guiding it by hand until [they]2072-the indians reached [clear water]2104-clear water again . Then [they]2072-the indians tied up to [the bank]1990-the bank and carried [their]2072-the indians cargo down to [it]1990-the bank through the bush . For the rest of the way [the river]1894-the river was broad and smooth ; a dark surface which reflected in fine detail the walls of forest on either side , towering up from the undergrowth to their blossoming crown a hundred or more feet above [them]2072-the indians . Sometimes [they]2072-the indians came to a stretch of water scattered with fallen petals and floated among them , moving scarcely less slowly than [they]2072-the indians , as though resting in [a flowering meadow]2107-a flowering meadow . At night [they]2072-the indians spread [their]2072-the indians tarpaulin on stretches of [dry beach]2108-dry beach , or hung [their]2072-the indians hammocks in the bush . Only the cabouri fly and rare , immobile alligators menaced the peace of [their]2072-the indians days .

[They]2072-the indians kept a constant scrutiny of [the banks]2109-the banks but saw no sign of human life .

Then [Tony]219-tony developed fever . It came on [him]219-tony quite suddenly , during the fourth afternoon . At [their]2072-the indians mid - day halt [he]219-tony was in complete health and shot a small deer that came down to drink on [the opposite bank]2110-the opposite bank ; an hour later [he]219-tony was shivering so violently that [he]219-tony had to lay down [his]219-tony paddle ; [his]219-tony head was flaming with heat , [his]219-tony body and limbs were frigid ; by sunset [he]219-tony was slightly delirious .

[Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger took [his]219-tony temperature and found that it was a hundred and four degrees , Fahrenheit . [He]316-dr messinger gave [him]219-tony twenty - five grains of quinine and lit a fire so close to [his]219-tony hammock that by morning it was singed and blacked with smoke . [He]316-dr messinger told [Tony]219-tony to keep wrapped up in [his]219-tony blanket , but at intervals throughout that night [he]219-tony woke from sleep to find [himself]219-tony running with sweat ; [he]219-tony was consumed with thirst and drank mug after mug of river water . Neither that evening nor next morning was [he]219-tony able to eat anything .

But next morning [his]219-tony temperature was down again . [He]219-tony felt weak and exhausted but [he]219-tony was able to keep steady in [his]219-tony place and paddle a little .

" It was just a passing attack , was n't it ? "[219-tony] [he]219-tony said . " [I]219-tony shall be perfectly fit to - morrow , sha n't [I]219-tony ? "[219-tony]

" [I]316-dr messinger hope so , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger .

At mid - day [Tony]219-tony drank some cocoa and ate a cupful of rice . " [I]219-tony feel grand , "[219-tony] [he]219-tony said .

" Good . "[219-tony]

That night the fever came on again . [They]2111-we were camping on [a sand bank]2112-a sand bank . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger heated stones and put them under [Tony]219-tony 's feet and in the small of [his]219-tony back . [He]316-dr messinger was awake most of the night fuelling the fire and refilling [Tony]219-tony 's mug with water . At dawn [Tony]219-tony slept for an hour and woke feeling slightly better ; [he]219-tony was taking frequent doses of quinine and [his]219-tony ears were filled with a muffled sound as though [he]219-tony were holding those shells to them in which , [he]219-tony had been told in childhood , [one]2349-one could hear the beat of [the sea]2560-the sea .

" [We]2111-we 've got to go on , "[316-dr messinger] said [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger . " [We]2111-we ca n't be far from [a village]3831-a village now . "[316-dr messinger]

" [I]219-tony feel awful . Would n't it be better to wait a day till [I]219-tony am perfectly fit again ? "[219-tony]

" It 's no good waiting . [We]2111-we 've got to get on . D'you think [you]219-tony can manage to get into [the canoe]2099-the canoe ? "[316-dr messinger]

[Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger knew that [Tony]219-tony was in for a long bout .

For the first few hours of that day [Tony]219-tony lay limp in the bows . [They]2115-they had shifted the stores so that [he]219-tony could lie full length . Then the fever came on again and [his]219-tony teeth chattered . [He]219-tony sat up and crouched with [his]219-tony head in [his]219-tony knees , shaking all over ; only [his]219-tony forehead and cheeks were burning hot under the noon sun . There was still no sign of [a village]3831-a village .

* * * * *

It was late in the afternoon when [he]219-tony first saw [Brenda]233-brenda . For some time [he]219-tony had been staring intently at the odd shape amidships where the stores had been piled ; then [he]219-tony realized that it was [a human being]2117-a human being .

" So [the Indians]321-the indians came back ? "[219-tony] [he]219-tony said .

" Yes . "[2117-a human being]

" [I]2117-a human being knew [they]321-the indians would . Silly of [them]321-the indians to be scared by a toy . [I]2117-a human being suppose [the others]922-the others are following . "[2117-a human being]

" Yes , [I]2117-a human being expect so . Try and sit still . "[2117-a human being]

" [Damned fool]3834-damned fool , being frightened of a toy mouse , "[219-tony] [Tony]219-tony said derisively to [the woman amidships]2118-the woman amidships . Then [he]219-tony saw that it was [Brenda]233-brenda . " [I]219-tony 'm sorry , "[219-tony] [he]219-tony said . " [I]219-tony did n't see it was [you]233-brenda . [You]233-brenda would n't be frightened of a toy mouse . "[219-tony]

But [she]233-brenda did not answer [him]219-tony . [She]233-brenda sat as [she]233-brenda used often to sit when [she]233-brenda came back from [London]23-london , huddled over [her]233-brenda bowl of bread and milk .

[Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger steered [the boat]1870-the boat in to the side . [They]2120-they nearly capsized as [he]316-dr messinger helped [Tony]219-tony out . [Brenda]233-brenda got ashore without assistance . [She]233-brenda stepped out in [her]233-brenda delicate , competent way , keeping the balance of [the boat]1870-the boat .

" That 's what poise means , "[219-tony] said [Tony]219-tony . " D'you know , [I]233-brenda once saw a questionnaire that [people]2364-people had to fill in when [they]2364-people applied for a job in [an American firm]3836-an american firm , and one of the things [they]2364-people had to answer was "[233-brenda] Have [you]233-brenda poise ? " "[233-brenda]

[Brenda]233-brenda was at the top of [the bank]1990-the bank waiting for [him]219-tony . " What was so absurd about the question was that [they]2364-people only had [the applicant]3837-the applicant 's word for it , "[316-dr messinger] [he]316-dr messinger explained laboriously . " [I]316-dr messinger mean -- is it a sign of poise to think [you]233-brenda have it ? "[316-dr messinger]

" Just sit quiet here while [I]233-brenda sling [your]219-tony hammock . "[233-brenda]

" Yes , [I]316-dr messinger 'll sit here with [Brenda]233-brenda . [I]316-dr messinger am so glad [she]233-brenda could come . [She]233-brenda must have caught [the three - eighteen]3838-the three - eighteen . "[316-dr messinger]

[She]233-brenda was with [him]219-tony all that night and all the next day . [He]219-tony talked to [her]233-brenda ceaselessly but [her]233-brenda replies were rare and enigmatic . On the succeeding evening [he]219-tony had another fit of sweating . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger kept a large fire burning by the hammock and wrapped [Tony]219-tony in [his]219-tony own blanket . An hour before dawn [Tony]219-tony fell asleep and when [he]219-tony awoke [Brenda]233-brenda had gone .

" [You]219-tony 're down to normal again . "[219-tony]

" Thank [God]283-god . [I]2125-i 've been pretty ill , have n't [I]2125-i ? [I]2125-i ca n't remember much . "[2125-i]

[Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger had made something of [a camp]2123-a camp . [He]316-dr messinger had chopped a square clear of undergrowth , the size of [a small room]2124-a small room . [Their]2125-i two hammocks hung on opposite sides of [it]2126-it . [The stores]1897-the stores were all ashore , arranged in an orderly pile on the tarpaulin .

" How d'you feel ? "[2125-i]

" Grand , "[219-tony] said [Tony]219-tony , but when [he]219-tony got out of [his]219-tony hammock [he]219-tony found [he]219-tony could not stand without help . " Of course , [I]219-tony have n't eaten anything . [I]219-tony expect it will be a day or two before [I]219-tony 'm really well . "[219-tony]

[Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger said nothing , but strained the tea clear of leaves by pouring it slowly from one mug into another ; [he]316-dr messinger stirred into it a large spoonful of condensed milk .

" See if [you]219-tony can drink this . "[316-dr messinger]

[Tony]219-tony drank it with pleasure and ate some biscuits .

" Are [we]3839-we going on to - day ? "[219-tony] [he]219-tony asked .

" [We]3839-we 'll think about it . "[316-dr messinger] [He]316-dr messinger took the mugs down to [the bank]1990-the bank and washed them in [the river]1894-the river . When [he]316-dr messinger came back [he]316-dr messinger said , " [I]316-dr messinger think [I]316-dr messinger 'd better explain things . It 's no use [your]219-tony thinking [you]219-tony are cured because [you]219-tony are out of fever for one day . That 's the way it goes . One day fever and one day normal . It may take a week or it may take much longer . That 's a thing [we]3839-we 've got to face . [I]316-dr messinger ca n't risk taking [you]219-tony in [the canoe]2099-the canoe . [You]219-tony nearly upset [us]3839-we several times the day before yesterday . "[316-dr messinger]

" [I]316-dr messinger thought there was someone [there]394-there [I]316-dr messinger knew . "[316-dr messinger]

" [You]316-dr messinger thought a lot of things . It 'll go on like that . Meanwhile [we]3839-we 've provisions for about ten days . There 's no immediate anxiety there but it 's a thing to remember . Besides , what [you]219-tony need is a roof over [your]219-tony head and constant nursing . If only [we]3839-we were at [a village]3831-a village .... "[316-dr messinger]

" [I]316-dr messinger 'm afraid [I]316-dr messinger 'm being [a great nuisance]3843-a great nuisance . "[316-dr messinger]

" That 's not the point . The thing is to find what is best for [us]3839-we to do . "[316-dr messinger]

But [Tony]219-tony felt too tired to think ; [he]219-tony dozed for an hour or so . When [he]219-tony awoke , [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger was cutting back the bush farther . " [I]316-dr messinger 'm going to fix up the tarpaulin as a roof . "[316-dr messinger]

( [He]316-dr messinger had marked this place on [his]316-dr messinger map _ Temporary Emergency Base Camp _ . )

[Tony]219-tony watched [him]316-dr messinger listlessly . Presently [he]219-tony said , " Look here , why do n't [you]316-dr messinger leave [me]219-tony here and go down [the river]1894-the river for help ? "[219-tony]

" [I]219-tony thought of that . It 's too big a risk . "[219-tony]

That afternoon [Brenda]233-brenda was back at [Tony]219-tony 's side and [he]219-tony was shivering and tossing in [his]219-tony hammock .

* * * * *

When [he]219-tony was next able to observe things , [Tony]219-tony noted that there was a tarpaulin over [his]219-tony head , slung to the tree - trunks . [He]219-tony asked , " How long have [we]3845-we been [here]2433-here ? "[219-tony]

" Only three days . "[219-tony]

" What time is it now ? "[219-tony]

" Getting on for ten in the morning . "[219-tony]

" [I]219-tony feel awful . "[219-tony]

[Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger gave [him]219-tony some soup . " [I]316-dr messinger am going [downstream]3847-downstream for the day , "[316-dr messinger] [he]316-dr messinger said , " to see if there 's any sign of [a village]3831-a village . [I]316-dr messinger hate leaving [you]219-tony but it 's a chance worth taking . [I]316-dr messinger shall be able to get a long way in [the canoe]2099-the canoe now it 's empty . Lie quiet . Do n't move from [the hammock]3850-the hammock . [I]316-dr messinger shall be back before night . [I]316-dr messinger hope with [some Indians]3851-some indians to help . "[316-dr messinger]

" All right , "[219-tony] said [Tony]219-tony and fell asleep .

[Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger went down to [[the river]1894-the river 's edge]2131-the river 's edge and untied [the canoe]2099-the canoe ; [he]316-dr messinger brought with [him]316-dr messinger a rifle , a drinking cup and a day 's provisions . [He]316-dr messinger sat in the stern and pushed out from [the bank]1990-the bank ; the current carried the bows down and in a few strokes of the paddle [he]316-dr messinger was in midstream .

The sun was high and its reflection in the water dazzled and scorched [him]316-dr messinger ; [he]316-dr messinger paddled on with regular , leisurely strokes ; [he]316-dr messinger was travelling fast . For a mile 's stretch [the river]1894-the river narrowed and the water raced so that all [he]316-dr messinger had to do was to trail the blade of the paddle as a rudder ; then the walls of forest on either side of [him]316-dr messinger fell back and [he]316-dr messinger drifted into [a great open lake]2135-a great open lake , where [he]316-dr messinger had to work heavily to keep in motion ; all the time [he]316-dr messinger watched keenly to right and left for the column of smoke , the thatched dome , [the sly brown figure in the undergrowth]2136-the sly brown figure in the undergrowth , the drinking cattle , that would disclose [the village [he]316-dr messinger sought]2137-the village he sought . But there was no sign . In [the open water]2138-the open water [he]316-dr messinger took up [his]316-dr messinger field - glasses and studied [the whole wooded margin]2139-the whole wooded margin . But there was no sign .

Later [the river]1894-the river narrowed once more and [the canoe]2099-the canoe shot forward in the swift current . Ahead of [him]316-dr messinger the surface was broken by rapids ; the smooth water seethed and eddied ; a low monotone warned [him]316-dr messinger that beyond [the rapids]2142-the rapids was a fall . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger began to steer for [the bank]1990-the bank . The current was running strongly and [he]316-dr messinger exerted [his]316-dr messinger full strength ; ten yards from the beginning of [the rapids]2142-the rapids [his]316-dr messinger bows ran in under [the bank]1990-the bank . There was a dense growth of thorn here , overhanging [the river]1894-the river , [the canoe]2099-the canoe slid under them and bit into [the beach]1552-the beach ; very cautiously [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger knelt forward in [his]316-dr messinger place and stretched up to a bough over [his]316-dr messinger head . It was at that moment [he]316-dr messinger came to grief ; the stern swung out downstream and as [he]316-dr messinger snatched at the paddle [the craft]2053-the craft was swept broadside into [the troubled waters]2150-the troubled waters ; there it adopted an eccentric course , spinning and tumbling to [the falls]2151-the falls . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger was tipped into [the water]1557-the water ; it was quite shallow in places and [he]316-dr messinger caught at the rocks but they were worn smooth as ivory and afforded no hold for [his]316-dr messinger hands ; [he]316-dr messinger rolled over twice , found [himself]316-dr messinger in deep water and attempted to swim , found [himself]316-dr messinger among boulders again and attempted to grapple with them . Then [he]316-dr messinger reached [the falls]2151-the falls .

[They]2151-the falls were unspectacular as falls go in [that country]2154-that country -- a drop of ten feet or less -- but they were enough for [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger . At [their]2151-the falls foot the foam subsided into a great pool , almost still , and strewn with blossom from the forest trees that encircled [it]2155-it . [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger 's hat floated very slowly towards [the Amazon]150-the amazon and the water closed over [his]316-dr messinger bald head .

* * * * *

[Brenda]233-brenda went to see [the family solicitors]1422-the family solicitors .

" [Mr Graceful]356-mr graceful , "[233-brenda] [she]233-brenda said , " [I]233-brenda 've got to have some more money . "[233-brenda]

[Mr Graceful]356-mr graceful looked at [her]233-brenda sadly . " [I]356-mr graceful should have thought that was really a question for [[your]233-brenda bank manager]3852-your bank manager . [I]356-mr graceful understand that [your]233-brenda securities are in [your]233-brenda own name and that the dividends are paid into [your]233-brenda account . "[356-mr graceful]

" [They]1422-the family solicitors never seem to pay dividends nowadays . Besides , it 's really very difficult to live on so little . "[1422-the family solicitors]

" No doubt . No doubt . "[356-mr graceful]

" [Mr Last]254-mr last left [you]233-brenda with power of [attorney]3853-attorney , did n't [he]254-mr last ? "[1422-the family solicitors]

" With strictly limited powers , [Lady Brenda]233-brenda . [I]356-mr graceful am instructed to pay the wage bill at [Hetton]7-hetton and all expenses connected with the upkeep of [the estate]3489-the estate -- [he]254-mr last is putting in [new bathrooms]3855-new bathrooms and restoring some decorations in [the morning - room which had been demolished]3856-the morning - room which had been demolished . But [I]356-mr graceful am afraid that [I]356-mr graceful have no authority to draw on [Mr Last]254-mr last 's account for other charges . "[356-mr graceful]

" But , [Mr Graceful]356-mr graceful , [I]1422-the family solicitors am sure [he]254-mr last did n't intend to stay abroad so long . [He]254-mr last ca n't possibly have meant to leave [me]1422-the family solicitors stranded like this , can [he]254-mr last ? ... Can [he]254-mr last ? "[1422-the family solicitors]

[Mr Graceful]356-mr graceful paused and fidgeted a little . " To be quite frank , [Lady Brenda]233-brenda , [I]356-mr graceful fear that _ was _ [his]254-mr last intention . [I]356-mr graceful raised this particular point shortly before [his]254-mr last departure . [He]254-mr last was quite resolved on the subject . "[356-mr graceful]

" But is [he]254-mr last _ allowed _ to do that ? [I]1422-the family solicitors mean , have n't [I]1422-the family solicitors got any rights under the marriage settlement or anything ? "[1422-the family solicitors]

" Nothing which [you]233-brenda can claim without application to the courts . [You]233-brenda _ might _ find solicitors who would advise [you]233-brenda to take action . [I]356-mr graceful can not say that [I]356-mr graceful should be [one of [them]3858-them]1659-one of them . [Mr Last]254-mr last would oppose any such order to the utmost and [I]356-mr graceful think that , in the present circumstances , [the courts]3298-the courts would undoubtedly find for [him]254-mr last . In any case it would be a prolonged , costly and slightly undignified proceeding . "[356-mr graceful]

" Oh , [I]1422-the family solicitors see ... well , that 's that , is n't it ? "[1422-the family solicitors]

" It certainly looks as though it were . "[356-mr graceful]

[Brenda]233-brenda rose to go . It was high summer and through the open windows [she]233-brenda could see [the sun - bathed gardens of [Lincoln 's Inn]151-lincoln 's inn]2157-the sun - bathed gardens of lincoln 's inn .

" There 's one thing . Do [you]233-brenda know , [I]356-mr graceful mean , can [you]233-brenda tell [me]356-mr graceful whether [Mr Last]254-mr last made another will ? "[356-mr graceful]

" [I]356-mr graceful 'm afraid that is a thing [I]356-mr graceful can not discuss . "[356-mr graceful]

" No , [I]356-mr graceful suppose not . [I]356-mr graceful 'm sorry if it was wrong to ask . [I]356-mr graceful just wanted to know how [I]356-mr graceful am with [him]254-mr last . "[356-mr graceful]

[She]233-brenda still stood between the door and the table , looking lost , in [her]233-brenda bright summer clothes . " Perhaps [I]233-brenda can say as much as this to guide [you]233-brenda . [The heirs - presumptive to [Hetton]7-hetton]3860-the heirs - presumptive to hetton are now [[his]254-mr last cousins]3861-his cousins , [the Richard Lasts at [Princes Risborough]83-princes risborough]3862-the richard lasts at princes risborough . [I]233-brenda think that [your]233-brenda knowledge of [Mr Last]254-mr last 's character and opinions will tell [you]233-brenda that [he]254-mr last would always wish [his]254-mr last fortune to go with [the estate]3489-the estate , in order that it may be preserved in what [he]254-mr last holds to be its right condition . "[233-brenda]

" Yes , "[233-brenda] said [Brenda]233-brenda , " [I]233-brenda ought to have thought of that . Well , good - bye . "[233-brenda]

And [she]233-brenda went out alone into the sunshine .

* * * * *

All that day [Tony]219-tony lay alone , fitfully oblivious of the passage of time . [He]219-tony slept a little ; once or twice [he]219-tony left [his]219-tony hammock and found [himself]219-tony weak and dizzy . [He]219-tony tried to eat some of the food which [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger had left out for [him]219-tony , but without success . It was not until it grew dark that [he]219-tony realized the day was over . [He]219-tony lit the lantern and began to collect wood for the fire , but the sticks kept slipping from [his]219-tony fingers and each time that [he]219-tony stooped [he]219-tony felt giddy , so that after a few fretful efforts [he]219-tony left them where they had fallen and returned to [his]219-tony hammock . And lying there , wrapped in [his]219-tony blanket , [he]219-tony began to cry .

After some hours of darkness the lamp began to burn low ; [he]219-tony leant painfully over , and shook it . It needed refilling . [He]219-tony knew where the oil was kept , crept to it , supporting [himself]219-tony first on the hammock rope and then on a pile of boxes . [He]219-tony found the keg , pulled out the bung and began to refill the lamp , but [his]219-tony hand trembled and the oil spilled over the ground , then [his]219-tony head began to swim again so that [he]219-tony shut [his]219-tony eyes ; the keg rolled over on its side and emptied itself with slow gurglings . When [he]219-tony realized what had happened , [he]219-tony began to cry again . [He]219-tony lay down in [his]219-tony hammock and in a few minutes the light sank , flickered and went out . There was a reek of kerosene on [his]219-tony hands and on [the sodden earth]2158-the sodden earth . [He]219-tony lay awake in the darkness crying .

Just before dawn the fever returned and a constant company of phantoms perplexed [his]219-tony senses .

* * * * *

[Brenda]233-brenda awoke in the lowest possible spirits . The evening before [she]233-brenda had spent alone at [a cinema]2159-a cinema . Afterwards [she]233-brenda felt hungry -- [she]233-brenda had had no proper meal that day -- but [she]233-brenda had not the strength to go alone into [any of [the supper restaurants]2161-the supper restaurants]2160-any of the supper restaurants . [She]233-brenda bought a meat pie at [a coffee stall]2162-a coffee stall and took it [home]402-home . It looked delicious but when [she]233-brenda came to eat [she]233-brenda found that [she]233-brenda had lost [her]233-brenda appetite . The remains of that pie lay on the dressing table when [she]233-brenda awoke .

It was August and [she]233-brenda was entirely alone . [Beaver]170-beaver was that day landing in [New York]153-new york . ( [He]219-tony had cabled [her]233-brenda from [mid - ocean]2164-mid - ocean that the crossing was excellent . ) It was for [her]233-brenda the last of [Beaver]170-beaver . [Parliament]5-parliament was over and [Jock Grant - Menzies]187-jock was paying [his]187-jock annual visit to [[his]187-jock elder brother]2165-his elder brother in [Scotland]154-scotland ; [Marjorie]228-marjorie and [Allan]239-allan at the last moment had made [[Lord Monomark]357-lord monomark 's yacht]2166-lord monomark 's yacht and were drifting luxuriously down [the coast of [Spain]155-spain]2167-the coast of spain attending bull - fights ( [they]2168-they had even asked [her]233-brenda to look after [Djinn]240-djinn ) . [[Her]233-brenda mother]1566-her mother was at the chalet [Lady Anchorage]342-lady anchorage always lent [her]1566-her mother on [the Lake of [Geneva]156-geneva]2170-the lake of geneva . [Polly]2171-polly was everywhere . Even [Jenny Abdul Akbar]271-jenny was cruising in [the Baltic]2172-the baltic .

[Brenda]233-brenda opened [her]233-brenda newspaper and read an article by [a young man]2490-a young man who said that the [London]23-london Season was a thing of the past ; that [everyone]2366-everyone was too busy in those days to keep up the pre - war routine ; that there were no more formal dances but a constant round of more modest entertaining ; that August in [London]23-london was the gayest time of all ( [he]2490-a young man rewrote this annually in slightly different words ) . It did not console [Brenda]233-brenda to read that article .

For weeks past [she]233-brenda had attempted to keep a fair mind towards [Tony]219-tony and [his]219-tony treatment of [her]233-brenda ; now at last [she]233-brenda broke down , and turning over buried [her]233-brenda face in the pillow in an agony of resentment and self - pity .

* * * * *

In [Brazil]105-brazil [she]233-brenda wore a ragged cotton gown of the same pattern as [Rosa]345-rosa 's . It was not unbecoming . [Tony]219-tony watched [her]233-brenda for some time before [he]219-tony spoke . " Why are [you]233-brenda dressed like that ? "[219-tony]

" It looks so dirty . "[219-tony]

" [I]219-tony ca n't get as far as [Pigstanton]19-pigstanton . [I]219-tony 've got to stay [here]2433-here until [Messinger]316-dr messinger comes back . [I]219-tony 'm ill . [He]316-dr messinger told [me]219-tony to be quiet . [He]316-dr messinger 's coming this evening . "[219-tony]

" But all the County Council are [here]2433-here . [The Shameless Blonde]285-the shameless blonde brought [them]2175-i in [[her]3868-her aeroplane]1376-her aeroplane . "[2175-i]

[The committee]3896-the committee had moved off down [the avenue]2183-the avenue ; all except [Colonel Inch]287-colonel inch who had taken the other drive and was trotting towards [Compton Last]74-compton last . [Tony]219-tony and [Mrs Rattery]286-mrs rattery were all alone .

" Bow - wow , "[286-mrs rattery] [she]286-mrs rattery said , scooping in the cards . " That carries the motion . "[286-mrs rattery]

Looking up from the card table , [Tony]219-tony saw beyond the trees [the ramparts and battlement of [the City]3553-the city]2184-the ramparts and battlement of the city ; it was quite near [him]219-tony . From the turret of the gatehouse a heraldic banner floated in the tropic breeze . [He]219-tony struggled into an upright position and threw aside [his]219-tony blankets . [He]219-tony was stronger and steadier when the fever was on [him]219-tony . [He]219-tony picked [his]219-tony way through [the surrounding thorn - scrub]2186-the surrounding thorn - scrub ; the sound of music rose from the glittering walls ; [some procession or pageant]2187-some procession or pageant was passing along them . [He]219-tony lurched into three trunks and became caught up in roots and hanging tendrils of bush - vine ; but [he]219-tony pressed forward , unconscious of pain and fatigue .

At last [he]219-tony came into the open . The gates were before [him]219-tony and trumpets were sounding along the walls , saluting [his]219-tony arrival ; from bastion to bastion the message ran to the four points of the compass ; petals of almond and apple blossom were in the air ; they carpeted the way , as , after a summer storm , they lay in [the orchards]2188-the orchards at [Hetton]7-hetton . Gilded cupolas and spires of alabaster shone in the sunlight .

[Ambrose]263-ambrose announced , " [The City]3553-the city is served . "[263-ambrose]

CHAPTER VI DU C?T ? DE CHEZ [TODD]358-mr todd

Although [Mr Todd]358-mr todd had lived in [Amazonas]159-amazonas for nearly six years , [no one]2345-no one except [a few families of [Pie - wie Indians]321-the indians]2190-a few families of pie - wie indians was aware of [his]358-mr todd existence . [[His]358-mr todd house]613-his house stood in a small savannah , [one of those little patches of sand and grass that crop up occasionally in [that neighbourhood]1234-that neighbourhood , three miles or so across , bounded on all sides by [forest]2194-forest]2192-one of those little patches of sand and grass that crop up occasionally in that neighbourhood , three miles or so across , bounded on all sides by forest .

[The stream which watered [it]613-his house]2195-the stream which watered it was not marked on any map ; it ran through [rapids]1883-rapids , always dangerous and at most seasons of the year impassable , to join the upper waters of [the river where [Dr Messinger]316-dr messinger had come to grief]2197-the river where dr messinger had come to grief . [None of [the inhabitants of [the district]1297-the district]2199-the inhabitants of the district]2198-none of the inhabitants of the district , except [Mr Todd]358-mr todd , had ever heard of [the governments of [Brazil]105-brazil]2201-the governments of brazil or [Dutch Guiana]106-dutch guiana , both of which from time to time claimed [its]613-his house possession .

[[Mr Todd]358-mr todd 's house]2202-mr todd 's house was larger than those of [[his]358-mr todd neighbours]2203-his neighbours , but similar in character -- a palm thatch roof , breast - high walls of mud and wattle , and a mud floor . [He]358-mr todd owned the dozen or so head of puny cattle which grazed in [the savannah]2204-the savannah , [a plantation of cassava]2205-a plantation of cassava , some banana and mango trees , a dog and , unique in [the neighbourhood]1161-the neighbourhood , a single - barrelled , breech - loading shot - gun . The few commodities which [he]358-mr todd employed from [the outside world]2207-the outside world came to [him]358-mr todd through a long succession of [traders]2208-traders , passed from hand to hand , bartered for in a dozen languages at the extreme end of one of the longest threads in the web of commerce that spreads from [Man?os]160-man?os into [the remote fastness of [the forest]3576-the forest]2209-the remote fastness of the forest .

One day while [Mr Todd]358-mr todd was engaged in filling some cartridges , [a Pie - wie]2211-a pie - wie came to [him]358-mr todd with the news that [a white man]2212-a white man was approaching through [the forest]3576-the forest , alone and very sick . [He]358-mr todd closed the cartridge and loaded [his]358-mr todd gun with it , put those that were finished into [his]358-mr todd pocket and set out in the direction indicated .

[The man]1007-the man was already clear of the bush when [Mr Todd]358-mr todd reached [him]1007-the man , sitting on the ground , clearly in a very bad way . [He]358-mr todd was without hat or boots , and [his]358-mr todd clothes were so torn that it was only by the dampness of [his]358-mr todd body that they adhered to it ; [his]358-mr todd feet were cut and grossly swollen ; every exposed surface of skin was scarred by insect and bat bites ; [his]358-mr todd eyes were wild with fever . [He]358-mr todd was talking to [himself]358-mr todd in delirium but stopped when [Todd]358-mr todd approached and addressed [him]358-mr todd in English .

" [You]358-mr todd 're [the first person who 's spoken to [me]219-tony for days]3919-the first person who 's spoken to me for days , "[219-tony] said [Tony]219-tony . " [The others]922-the others wo n't stop . [They]922-the others keep bicycling by ... [I]219-tony 'm tired ... [Brenda]233-brenda was with [me]219-tony at first but [she]233-brenda was frightened by a mechanical mouse , so [she]233-brenda took [the canoe]2099-the canoe and went off . [She]233-brenda said [she]233-brenda would come back that evening but [she]233-brenda did n't . [I]219-tony expect [she]233-brenda 's staying with [one of [[her]233-brenda new friends]3923-her new friends in [Brazil]105-brazil]3922-one of her new friends in brazil ... [You]2215-you have n't seen [her]233-brenda , have [you]2215-you ? "[219-tony]

" [You]2215-you are [the first stranger [I]219-tony have seen]3924-the first stranger i have seen for a very long time . "[219-tony]

" [She]233-brenda was wearing a top hat when [she]233-brenda left . [You]2215-you ca n't miss [her]233-brenda . "[2215-you] Then [he]2215-you began talking to someone at [Mr Todd]358-mr todd 's side , who was not [there]394-there .

" Do [you]2215-you see [that house]3925-that house over there ? Do [you]2215-you think [you]2215-you can manage to walk to [it]3925-that house ? If not , [I]219-tony can send [some Indians]3851-some indians to carry [you]2215-you . "[219-tony]

[Tony]219-tony squinted across [the savannah]2204-the savannah at [[Mr Todd]358-mr todd 's hut]2218-mr todd 's hut .

" Architecture harmonizing with local character , "[219-tony] [he]219-tony said , " indigenous material employed throughout . Do n't let [Mrs Beaver]170-beaver see it or [she]170-beaver will cover it with chromium plating . "[219-tony]

" Try and walk . "[358-mr todd] [Mr Todd]358-mr todd hoisted [Tony]219-tony to [his]219-tony feet and supported [him]219-tony with a stout arm .

" [I]219-tony 'll ride [your]219-tony bicycle . [It]3927-it _ was _ [you]219-tony [I]219-tony passed just now on [a bicycle]3928-a bicycle , was n't it ? ... except that [your]219-tony beard is a different colour . [His]358-mr todd was green ... green as mice . "[219-tony]

[Mr Todd]358-mr todd led [Tony]219-tony across [the hummocks of grass]2219-the hummocks of grass towards [the house]2368-the house .

" It is a very short way . When [we]3929-we get [there]394-there [I]358-mr todd will give [you]219-tony something to make [you]219-tony better . "[358-mr todd]

" Very kind of [you]219-tony ... rotten thing for [a man]414-a man to have [[his]414-a man wife]648-his wife go away in [a canoe]3933-a canoe . That was a long time ago . Nothing to eat since . "[358-mr todd] Presently [he]358-mr todd said , " [I]358-mr todd say , [you]219-tony 're English . [I]358-mr todd 'm English too . [My]358-mr todd name is [Last]3934-last . "[358-mr todd]

" Well , [Mr Last]254-mr last , [you]219-tony are n't to bother about anything more . [You]219-tony 're ill and [you]219-tony 've had a rough journey . [I]358-mr todd 'll take care of [you]219-tony . "[358-mr todd]

[Tony]219-tony looked round [him]358-mr todd . " Are [you]219-tony all English ? "[219-tony]

" Yes , [all of [us]3935-all of us]3935-all of us . "[358-mr todd]

" [That dark girl]3936-that dark girl married [a Moor]3937-a moor ... It 's very lucky [I]219-tony met [you]219-tony all . [I]219-tony suppose [you]219-tony 're [some kind of cycling club]3938-some kind of cycling club ? "[219-tony]
