[They]2221-they went very slowly , but at length reached [the house]2368-the house .

" Lie there in the hammock . "[358-mr todd]

" That 's what [Messinger]316-dr messinger said . [He]316-dr messinger 's in love with [John Beaver]175-john beaver . "[358-mr todd]

" [I]358-mr todd will get something for [you]219-tony . "[358-mr todd]

" Very good of [you]219-tony . Just [my]358-mr todd usual morning tray -- coffee , toast , fruit . And the morning papers . If [[her]547-his guest Ladyship]2409-her ladyship has been called [I]358-mr todd will have it with [her]547-his guest ... "[358-mr todd]

[Mr Todd]358-mr todd went into [the back room of [the house]2368-the house]2223-the back room of the house and dragged a tin canister from under a heap of skins . It was full of a mixture of dried leaf and bark . [He]358-mr todd took a handful and went outside to the fire . When [he]358-mr todd returned [[his]358-mr todd guest]547-his guest was bolt upright astride the hammock , talking angrily .

" ... [You]219-tony would hear better and it would be more polite if [you]219-tony stood still when [I]358-mr todd addressed [you]219-tony instead of walking round in a circle . It is for [your]219-tony own good that [I]358-mr todd am telling [you]219-tony ... [I]358-mr todd know [you]219-tony are [friends of [[my]358-mr todd wife]2847-my wife]3945-friends of my wife and that is why [you]219-tony will not listen to [me]358-mr todd . But be careful . [She]2847-my wife will say nothing cruel , [she]2847-my wife will not raise [her]2847-my wife voice , there will be no hard words . [She]2847-my wife hopes [you]219-tony will be [great friends]2965-great friends afterwards as before . But [she]2847-my wife will leave [you]219-tony . [She]2847-my wife will go away quietly during the night . [She]2847-my wife will take [her]2847-my wife hammock and [her]2847-my wife rations of farine ... Listen to [me]358-mr todd . [I]358-mr todd know [I]358-mr todd am not clever but that is no reason why [we]3948-we should forget all courtesy . Let [us]3948-we kill in the gentlest manner . [I]358-mr todd will tell [you]219-tony what [I]358-mr todd have learned in [the forest]3576-the forest , where time is different . There is [no City]3950-no city . [Mrs Beaver]170-beaver has covered it with chromium plating and converted it into [flats]3951-flats . Three guineas a week , each with [a separate bathroom]3952-a separate bathroom . Very suitable for base love . And [Polly]3953-polly will be [there]394-there . [She]3953-polly and [Mrs Beaver]170-beaver under the fallen battlements ... "[358-mr todd]

[Mr Todd]358-mr todd put a hand behind [Tony]219-tony 's head and held up the concoction of herbs in the calabash . [Tony]219-tony sipped and turned away [his]219-tony head .

" Nasty medicine , "[219-tony] [he]219-tony said , and began to cry .

[Mr Todd]358-mr todd stood by [him]219-tony holding the calabash . [Presently Tony]219-tony drank some more , screwing up [his]219-tony face and shuddering slightly at the bitterness . [Mr Todd]358-mr todd stood beside [him]219-tony until the draught was finished ; then [he]358-mr todd threw out the dregs on to the mud floor . [Tony]219-tony lay back in the hammock sobbing quietly . Soon [he]219-tony fell into a deep sleep .

* * * * *

[Tony]219-tony 's recovery was slow . At first , days of lucidity alternated with delirium ; then [his]219-tony temperature dropped and [he]219-tony was conscious even when most ill . The days of fever grew less frequent , finally occurring in the normal system of [the tropics]1710-the tropics , between long periods of comparative health . [Mr Todd]358-mr todd dosed [him]219-tony regularly with herbal remedies .

" It 's very nasty , "[219-tony] said [Tony]219-tony , " but it does do good . "[219-tony]

" There is medicine for everything in [the forest]3576-the forest , "[358-mr todd] said [Mr Todd]358-mr todd ; " to make [you]219-tony well and to make [you]219-tony ill . [[My]358-mr todd mother]2756-my mother was [an Indian]3957-an indian and [she]2756-my mother taught [me]358-mr todd many of [them]3958-them . [I]358-mr todd have learned others from time to time from [[my]358-mr todd wives]3959-my wives . There are plants to cure [you]219-tony and give [you]219-tony fever , to kill [you]219-tony and send [you]219-tony mad , to keep away snakes , to intoxicate fish so that [you]219-tony can pick them out of the water with [your]219-tony hands like fruit from a tree . There are medicines even [I]358-mr todd do not know . [They]3958-them say that it is possible to bring [dead people]3960-dead people to life after [they]3960-dead people have begun to stink , but [I]358-mr todd have not seen it done . "[358-mr todd]

" But surely [you]358-mr todd are English ? "[219-tony]

" [[My]358-mr todd father]3484-my father was -- at least [a Barbadian]3962-a barbadian . [He]3484-my father came to [Guiana]161-guiana as [a missionary]3963-a missionary . [He]3484-my father was married to [a white woman]3964-a white woman but [he]3484-my father left [her]3964-a white woman in [Guiana]161-guiana to look for gold . Then [he]3484-my father took [[my]358-mr todd mother]2756-my mother . [The Pie - wie women]3966-the pie - wie women are ugly but very devoted . [I]358-mr todd have had many . [Most of [the men]1884-the men and women living in [this savannah]3969-this savannah]3967-most of the men and women living in this savannah are [[my]358-mr todd children]3970-my children . That is why [they]3967-most of the men and women living in this savannah obey -- for that reason and because [I]358-mr todd have the gun . [[My]358-mr todd father]3484-my father lived to a great age . It is not twenty years since [he]3484-my father died . [He]3484-my father was [a man of education]3972-a man of education . Can [you]219-tony read ? "[358-mr todd]

" Yes , of course . "[219-tony]

" It is not [everyone who is so fortunate]3973-everyone who is so fortunate . [I]358-mr todd can not . "[358-mr todd]

[Tony]219-tony laughed apologetically . " But [I]219-tony suppose [you]219-tony have n't much opportunity here . "[219-tony]

" Oh yes , that is just it . [I]358-mr todd have a _ great _ many books . [I]358-mr todd will show [you]219-tony when [you]219-tony are better . Until five years ago there was [an Englishman]3974-an englishman -- at least [a black man]3975-a black man , but [he]3974-an englishman was well educated in [Georgetown]127-georgetown . [He]3974-an englishman died . [He]3974-an englishman used to read to [me]358-mr todd every day until [he]3974-an englishman died . [You]219-tony shall read to [me]358-mr todd when [you]219-tony are better . "[358-mr todd]

" [I]219-tony shall be delighted to . "[219-tony]

" Yes , [you]219-tony shall read to [me]358-mr todd , "[358-mr todd] [Mr Todd]358-mr todd repeated , nodding over the calabash .

During the early days of [his]2227-his convalescence [Tony]219-tony had little conversation with [[his]2227-his host]2228-his host , [he]2227-his lay in the hammock staring up at the thatched roof and thinking about [Brenda]233-brenda . The days , exactly twelve hours each , passed without distinction . [Mr Todd]358-mr todd retired to sleep at sundown , leaving a little lamp burning -- a handwoven wick drooping from a pot of beef fat -- to keep away vampire bats .

The first time that [Tony]219-tony left [the house]2368-the house [Mr Todd]358-mr todd took [him]219-tony for a little stroll around [the farm]2514-the farm .

" [I]358-mr todd will show [you]219-tony [[the black man]3976-the black man 's grave]3977-the black man 's grave , "[358-mr todd] [he]358-mr todd said , leading [him]219-tony to a mound between the mango trees . " [He]3976-the black man was very kind . Every afternoon until [he]3976-the black man died , for two hours , [he]3976-the black man used to read to [me]358-mr todd . [I]358-mr todd think [I]358-mr todd will put up a cross -- to commemorate [his]3976-the black man death and [your]219-tony arrival -- a pretty idea . Do [you]219-tony believe in [God]283-god ? "[358-mr todd]

" [I]358-mr todd suppose so . [I]358-mr todd 've never really thought about it much . "[358-mr todd]

" [I]358-mr todd have thought about it a _ great _ deal and [I]358-mr todd still do not know ... [Dickens]359-dickens did . "[358-mr todd]

" [I]358-mr todd suppose so . "[358-mr todd]

" Oh yes , it is apparent in all [his]359-dickens books . [You]219-tony will see . "[358-mr todd]

That afternoon [Mr Todd]358-mr todd began the construction of a headpiece for [[the Negro]2231-the negro 's grave]2232-the negro 's grave . [He]358-mr todd worked with a large spoke - shave in a wood so hard that it grated and rang like metal .

At last , when [Tony]219-tony had passed six or seven consecutive nights without fever , [Mr Todd]358-mr todd said , " Now [I]358-mr todd think [you]219-tony are well enough to see the books . "[358-mr todd]

At one end of [the hut]2233-the hut there was [a kind of loft formed by a rough platform erected in the eaves of the roof]2234-a kind of loft formed by a rough platform erected in the eaves of the roof . [Mr Todd]358-mr todd propped a ladder against it and mounted . [Tony]219-tony followed , still unsteady after [his]219-tony illness . [Mr Todd]358-mr todd sat on [the platform]749-the platform and [Tony]219-tony stood at the top of the ladder looking over . There was a heap of bundles there , tied up with rag , palm leaf and raw hide .

" It has been hard to keep out the worms and ants . Two are practically destroyed . But there is an oil [the Indians]2072-the indians make that is useful . "[219-tony]

[He]358-mr todd unwrapped the nearest parcel and handed down a calf - bound book . It was an early American edition of [_ Bleak House _]162-_ bleak house _ .

" It does not matter which [we]3979-we take first . "[219-tony]

" [You]358-mr todd are fond of [Dickens]359-dickens ? "[219-tony]

" Why , yes , of course . More than fond , far more . [You]3980-you see , they are the only books [I]219-tony have ever heard . [[My]219-tony father]3484-my father used to read them and then later [the black man]3976-the black man ... and now [you]3980-you . [I]219-tony have heard them all several times by now but [I]219-tony never get tired ; there is always more to be learned and noticed , so many characters , so many changes of scene , so many words ... [I]219-tony have all [Dickens]359-dickens 's books here except those that the ants devoured . It takes a long time to read them all -- more than two years . "[219-tony]

" Well , "[219-tony] said [Tony]219-tony lightly , " they will well last out [my]219-tony visit . "[219-tony]

" Oh , [I]219-tony hope not . It is delightful to start again . Each time [I]219-tony think [I]219-tony find more to enjoy and admire . "[219-tony]

[They]2236-they took down the first volume of [_ Bleak House]162-_ bleak house _ _ and that afternoon [Tony]219-tony had [his]219-tony first reading .

[He]219-tony had always rather enjoyed reading aloud and in the first year of marriage had shared several books in this way with [Brenda]233-brenda , until one day , in a moment of frankness , [she]233-brenda remarked that it was torture to [her]233-brenda . [He]219-tony had read to [John Andrew]174-john , late in the afternoon , in winter , while [the child]2465-the child sat before [the nursery]2452-the nursery fender eating [his]2465-the child supper . But [Mr Todd]358-mr todd was [a unique audience]2239-a unique audience .

[The old man]1654-the old man sat astride [his]1654-the old man hammock opposite [Tony]219-tony , fixing [him]219-tony throughout with [his]1654-the old man eyes , and following the words , soundlessly , with [his]1654-the old man lips . Often when [a new character]2241-a new character was introduced [he]1654-the old man would say , " Repeat the name , [I]1654-the old man have forgotten [him]2241-a new character , "[1654-the old man] or " Yes , yes , [I]1654-the old man remember [her]2241-a new character well . [She]2241-a new character dies , [poor woman]3983-poor woman . "[1654-the old man] [He]1654-the old man would frequently interrupt with questions ; not as [Tony]219-tony would have imagined about the circumstances of the story -- such things as the procedure of [[the Lord Chancellor]2242-the lord chancellor 's Court]2243-the lord chancellor 's court or the social conventions of the time , though they must have been unintelligible , did not concern [him]219-tony -- but always about [the characters]2244-the characters . " Now , why does [she]2241-a new character say that ? Does [she]2241-a new character really mean it ? Did [she]2241-a new character feel faint because of the heat of the fire or of something in that paper ? "[1654-the old man] [He]1654-the old man laughed loudly at all the jokes and at some passages which did not seem humorous to [Tony]219-tony , asking [him]219-tony to repeat them two or three times , and later at the description of the sufferings of [the outcasts]2245-the outcasts in " [Tom]360-tom - all - alone 's "[219-tony] tears ran down [his]219-tony cheeks into [his]219-tony beard . [His]1654-the old man comments on the story were usually simple . " [I]1654-the old man think [the Dedlock]361-the dedlock is [a very proud man]3984-a very proud man , "[1654-the old man] or , " [Mrs Jellyby]362-mrs jellyby does not take enough care of [[her]362-mrs jellyby children]3985-her children . "[1654-the old man]

[Tony]219-tony enjoyed the readings almost as much as [he]1654-the old man did .

At the end of the first day [the old man]1654-the old man said , " [You]219-tony read beautifully , with a far better accent than [the black man]3976-the black man . And [you]219-tony explain better . It is almost as though [[my]1654-the old man father]3484-my father were [here]2433-here again . "[1654-the old man] And always at the end of a session [he]1654-the old man thanked [[his]1654-the old man guest]547-his guest courteously . " [I]1654-the old man enjoyed that _ very _ much . It was an extremely distressing chapter . But , if [I]1654-the old man remember it rightly , it will all turn out well . "[1654-the old man]

By the time that [they]2248-they were in the second volume , however , the novelty of [the old man]1654-the old man 's delight had begun to wane , and [Tony]219-tony was feeling strong enough to be restless . [He]219-tony touched more than once on the subject of [his]219-tony departure , asking about canoes and rains and the possibility of finding guides . But [Mr Todd]358-mr todd seemed obtuse and paid no attention to these hints .

One day , running [his]219-tony thumb through the pages of _ Bleak House _ that remained to be read , [Tony]219-tony said , " [We]2248-they still have a lot to get through . [I]219-tony hope [I]219-tony shall be able to finish it before [I]219-tony go . "[219-tony]

" Oh yes , "[358-mr todd] said [Mr Todd]358-mr todd . " Do not disturb [yourself]219-tony about that . [You]219-tony will have time to finish it , [[my]358-mr todd friend]2860-my friend . "[358-mr todd]

For the first time [Tony]219-tony noticed something slightly menacing in [[his]219-tony host]2228-his host 's manner . That evening at supper , a brief meal of farine and dried beef , eaten just before sundown , [Tony]219-tony renewed the subject .

" [You]358-mr todd know , [Mr Todd]358-mr todd , the time has come when [I]219-tony must be thinking about getting back to civilization . [I]219-tony have already imposed [myself]219-tony on [your]358-mr todd hospitality far too long . "[219-tony]

[Mr Todd]358-mr todd bent over the plate , crunching mouthfuls of farine , but made no reply .

" How soon do [you]358-mr todd think [I]219-tony shall be able to get [a boat]3522-a boat ? ... [I]219-tony said , how soon do [you]358-mr todd think [I]219-tony shall be able to get [a boat]3522-a boat ? [I]219-tony appreciate all [your]358-mr todd kindness to [me]219-tony more than [I]219-tony can say , but ... "[219-tony]

" [[My]219-tony friend]2860-my friend , any kindness [I]219-tony may have shown is amply repaid by [your]358-mr todd reading of [Dickens]359-dickens . Do not let [us]3993-us mention the subject again . "[219-tony]

" Well , [I]219-tony 'm very glad [you]358-mr todd have enjoyed it . [I]219-tony have , too . But [I]219-tony really must be thinking of getting back ... "[219-tony]

" Yes , "[358-mr todd] said [Mr Todd]358-mr todd . " [The black man]3976-the black man was like that . [He]3976-the black man thought of it all the time . But [he]3976-the black man died [here]2433-here ... "[358-mr todd]

Twice during the next day [Tony]219-tony opened the subject , but [[his]219-tony host]2228-his host was evasive . Finally , [he]219-tony said , " Forgive [me]219-tony , [Mr Todd]358-mr todd , but [I]219-tony really must press the point . When can [I]219-tony get [a boat]3522-a boat ? "[219-tony]

" There is [no boat]3997-no boat . "[219-tony]

" Well , [the Indians]321-the indians can build one . "[219-tony]

" [You]219-tony must wait for the rains . There is not enough water in [the river]1894-the river now . "[219-tony]

" How long will that be ? "[219-tony]

" A month ... two months ... "[219-tony]

[They]2252-they had finished _ [Bleak House]162-_ bleak house _ _ and were nearing the end of _ [Dombey]363-dombey and [Son]364-son _ when the rain came .

" Now it is time to make preparations to go . "[219-tony]

" Oh , that is impossible . [The Indians]321-the indians will not make [a boat]3522-a boat during the rainy season -- it is one of [their]321-the indians superstitions . "[219-tony]

" [You]219-tony might have told [me]219-tony . "[219-tony]

" Did [I]219-tony not mention it ? [I]219-tony forgot . "[219-tony]

Next morning [Tony]219-tony went out alone while [[his]219-tony host]2228-his host was busy , and , looking as aimless as [he]219-tony could , strolled across [the savannah]2204-the savannah to [the group of [Indian houses]2256-indian houses]2255-the group of indian houses . There were four or five [Pie - wies]321-the indians sitting in one of the doorways . [They]2255-the group of indian houses did not look up as [he]219-tony approached [them]2255-the group of indian houses . [He]219-tony addressed [them]2255-the group of indian houses in the few words of [Macushi]347-macushi [he]219-tony had acquired during the journey but [they]2255-the group of indian houses made no sign whether [they]2255-the group of indian houses understood [him]219-tony or not . Then [he]219-tony drew a sketch of [a canoe]3933-a canoe in the sand , [he]219-tony went through some vague motions of carpentry , pointed from [them]2255-the group of indian houses to [him]219-tony , then made motions of giving something to [them]2255-the group of indian houses and scratched out the outlines of a gun and a hat and a few other recognizable articles of trade . [One of [the women]1051-the women]2258-one of the women giggled but [no one]2345-no one gave any sign of comprehension , and [he]219-tony went away unsatisfied .

At [their]2255-the group of indian houses mid - day meal [Mr Todd]358-mr todd said , " [Mr Last]254-mr last , [the Indians]321-the indians tell [me]358-mr todd that [you]254-mr last have been trying to speak with [them]321-the indians . It is easier that [you]254-mr last say anything [you]254-mr last wish through [me]358-mr todd . [You]254-mr last realize , do [you]254-mr last not , that [they]321-the indians would do nothing without [my]358-mr todd authority . [They]321-the indians regard [themselves]321-the indians , quite rightly in many cases , as [[my]358-mr todd children]3970-my children . "[358-mr todd]

" Well , as a matter of fact , [I]219-tony was asking [them]321-the indians about [a canoe]3933-a canoe . "[219-tony]

" So [they]321-the indians gave [me]358-mr todd to understand ... and now if [you]254-mr last have finished [your]254-mr last meal perhaps [we]2261-we might have another chapter . [I]358-mr todd am quite absorbed in the book . "[358-mr todd]

* * * * *

[They]2261-we finished _ [Dombey]363-dombey and [Son _]2262-son _ . Nearly a year had passed since [Tony]219-tony had left [England]13-england , and [his]219-tony gloomy foreboding of permanent exile became suddenly acute when , between the pages of _ [Martin Chuzzlewit]365-martin chuzzlewit _ , [he]219-tony found a document written in pencil in irregular characters .

Year 1919 .

[I]0-winchester James Todd of [Brazil]105-brazil do swear to [Barnabas Washington]366-barnabas washington of [Georgetown]127-georgetown that if [he]366-barnabas washington finish this book in fact [Martin Chuzzlewit]365-martin chuzzlewit [I]0-winchester will let [him]366-barnabas washington go away back as soon as finished .

There followed a heavy pencil X and after it : _ [Mr Todd]358-mr todd made this mark signed [Barnabas Washington]366-barnabas washington _ .

" [Mr Todd]358-mr todd , "[219-tony] said [Tony]219-tony , " [I]219-tony must speak frankly . [You]358-mr todd saved [my]219-tony life , and when [I]219-tony get back to [civilization]0-winchester [I]219-tony will reward [you]358-mr todd to the best of [my]219-tony ability . [I]219-tony will give [you]358-mr todd anything within reason . But at present [you]358-mr todd are keeping [me]219-tony here against [my]219-tony will . [I]219-tony demand to be released . "[219-tony]

" But , [[my]366-barnabas washington friend]2860-my friend , what is keeping [you]358-mr todd ? [You]358-mr todd are under no restraint . Go when [you]358-mr todd like . "[366-barnabas washington]

" [You]358-mr todd know very well that [I]219-tony ca n't get away without [your]358-mr todd help . "[219-tony]

" In that case [you]358-mr todd must humour [an old man]4003-an old man . Read [me]366-barnabas washington another chapter . "[366-barnabas washington]

" [Mr Todd]358-mr todd , [I]219-tony swear by anything [you]358-mr todd like that when [I]219-tony get to [Man?os]160-man?os [I]219-tony will find [someone]419-someone to take [my]219-tony place . [I]219-tony will pay [a man]414-a man to read to [you]358-mr todd all day . "[219-tony]

" But [I]366-barnabas washington have no need of [another man]4006-another man . [You]358-mr todd read so well . "[366-barnabas washington]

" [I]219-tony have read for the last time . "[219-tony]

" [I]358-mr todd hope not , "[358-mr todd] said [Mr Todd]358-mr todd politely .

That evening at supper only one plate of dried meat and farine was brought in and [Mr Todd]358-mr todd ate alone . [Tony]219-tony lay without speaking , staring at the thatch .

Next day at noon a single plate was put before [Mr Todd]358-mr todd but with it lay [his]358-mr todd gun , cocked , on [his]358-mr todd knee , as [he]358-mr todd ate . [Tony]219-tony resumed the reading of _ [Martin Chuzzlewit]365-martin chuzzlewit _ where it had been interrupted .

Weeks passed hopelessly . [They]2263-their read _ [Nicholas Nickleby]368-nicholas nickleby _ and [_ Little Dorrit]369-_ little dorrit _ and _ Oliver Twist _ . Then [a stranger]532-a stranger arrived in [the savannah]2204-the savannah , [a half - caste prospector]2266-a half - caste prospector , [one of that lonely order of men who wander for a lifetime through [the forests]1765-the forests , tracing [the little streams]2269-the little streams [, sifting the gravel and , ounce by ounce , filling the little leather sack of gold dust , more often than not dying of exposure and starvation]2270-, sifting the gravel and , ounce by ounce , filling the little leather sack of gold dust , more often than not dying of exposure and starvation with five hundred dollars worth of gold hung round [their]2263-their necks]2267-one of that lonely order of men who wander for a lifetime through the forests , tracing the little streams , sifting the gravel and , ounce by ounce , filling the little leather sack of gold dust , more often than not dying of exposure and starvation with five hundred dollars worth of gold hung round their necks . [Mr Todd]358-mr todd was vexed at [his]219-tony arrival , gave [him]219-tony farine and _ tasso _ and sent [him]219-tony on [his]219-tony journey within an hour of [his]219-tony arrival , but in that hour [Tony]219-tony had time to scribble [his]219-tony name on a slip of paper and put it into [the man]1007-the man 's hand .

From now on there was hope . The days followed [their]2263-their unvarying routine ; coffee at sunrise , a morning of inaction while [Mr Todd]358-mr todd pottered about on the business of [the farm]2514-the farm , farine and [_ tasso]2273-_ tasso _ at noon , [Dickens]359-dickens in the afternoon , farine and _ tasso _ and sometimes some fruit for supper , silence from sunset to dawn with the small wick glowing in the beef fat and the palm thatch overhead dimly discernible ; but [Tony]219-tony lived in quiet confidence and expectation .

Sometime , this year or the next , [the prospector]2274-the prospector would arrive at [a Brazilian village]2275-a brazilian village with news of [his]2274-the prospector discovery . The disasters of [the Messinger expedition]2276-the messinger expedition would not have passed unnoticed . [Tony]219-tony could imagine the headlines that must have appeared in the popular press ; even now , probably , there were search parties working over [the country [he]219-tony had crossed]2277-the country he had crossed ; any day English voices must sound over [the savannah]2204-the savannah and [a dozen friendly adventurers]2279-a dozen friendly adventurers come crashing through the bush . Even as [he]219-tony was reading , while [his]219-tony lips mechanically followed the printed pages , [his]219-tony mind wandered away from [[his]219-tony eager , crazy host opposite]2280-his eager , crazy host opposite , and [he]219-tony began to narrate to [himself]219-tony incidents of [his]219-tony homecoming -- the gradual re - encounters with [civilization]2281-civilization ( [he]219-tony shaved and bought new clothes at [Man?os]160-man?os , telegraphed for money , received wires of congratulation ; [he]219-tony enjoyed the leisurely river journey to [Belem]166-belem , [the big liner]2282-the big liner to [Europe]63-europe ; savoured good claret and fresh meat and spring vegetables ; [he]219-tony was shy at meeting [Brenda]233-brenda and uncertain how to address [her]233-brenda ... " _ Darling _ , [you]233-brenda 've been much longer than [you]233-brenda said . [I]219-tony quite thought [you]233-brenda were lost ... "[219-tony] ) .

And then [Mr Todd]358-mr todd interrupted . " May [I]358-mr todd trouble [you]219-tony to read that passage again ? It is one [I]358-mr todd particularly enjoy . "[358-mr todd]

The weeks passed ; there was no sign of rescue but [Tony]219-tony endured the day for hope of what might happen on the morrow ; [he]219-tony even felt a slight stirring of cordiality towards [[his]219-tony jailer]2283-his jailer and was therefore quite willing to join [him]2283-his jailer when , one evening after a long conference with [an Indian neighbour]2284-an indian neighbour [he]219-tony proposed a celebration .

" It is one of the local feast days , "[219-tony] [he]219-tony explained , " and [they]2284-an indian neighbour have been making _ pivari _ . [You]219-tony may not like it but [you]219-tony should try some . [We]2285-they will go across to [[this man]1610-this man 's home]4008-this man 's home to - night . "[219-tony]

Accordingly after supper [they]2285-they joined [a party of [Indians]321-the indians that were assembled round the fire in [one of the huts at [the other side of the savannah]2288-the other side of the savannah]2287-one of the huts at the other side of the savannah]2286-a party of indians that were assembled round the fire in one of the huts at the other side of the savannah . [They]2285-they were singing in an apathetic , monotonous manner and passing a large calabash of liquid from mouth to mouth . Separate bowls were brought for [Tony]219-tony and [Mr Todd]358-mr todd , and [they]2285-they were given hammocks to sit in .

" [You]219-tony must drink it all without lowering the cup . That is the etiquette . "[2285-they]

[Tony]219-tony gulped the dark liquid , trying not to taste it . But it was not unpleasant , hard and muddy on the palate like most of the beverages [he]219-tony had been offered in [Brazil]105-brazil , but with a flavour of honey and brown bread . [He]219-tony leant back in the hammock feeling unusually contented . Perhaps at that very moment [the search party]2289-the search party was in [camp]3679-camp a few hours " journey from [them]2285-they . Meanwhile [he]219-tony was warm and drowsy . The cadence of song rose and fell interminably , liturgically . Another calabash of _ pivari _ was offered [him]219-tony and [he]219-tony handed it back empty . [He]219-tony lay full length watching the play of shadows on the thatch as the Pie - wies began to dance . Then [he]219-tony shut [his]219-tony eyes and thought of [England]13-england and [Hetton]7-hetton and fell asleep .[2289-the search party]

* * * * *

[He]219-tony awoke , still in [the Indian hut]2291-the indian hut , with the impression that [he]219-tony had outslept [his]219-tony usual hour . By the position of the sun [he]219-tony knew it was late afternoon . [No one else]3186-no one else was about . [He]219-tony looked for [his]219-tony watch and found to [his]219-tony surprise that it was not on [his]219-tony wrist . [He]219-tony had left it in [the house]2368-the house , [he]219-tony supposed , before coming to the party .

" [I]219-tony must have been tight last night , "[219-tony] [he]219-tony reflected . Treacherous drink that . " [He]219-tony had a headache and feared a recurrence of fever . [He]219-tony found when [he]219-tony set [his]219-tony feet to the ground that [he]219-tony stood with difficulty ; [his]219-tony walk was unsteady and [his]219-tony mind confused as it had been during the first weeks of [his]219-tony convalescence . On [his]219-tony way across [the savannah]2204-the savannah [he]219-tony was obliged to stop more than once , shutting [his]219-tony eyes and breathing deeply . When [he]219-tony reached [the house]2368-the house [he]219-tony found [Mr Todd]358-mr todd sitting there .[219-tony]

" Ah , [[my]219-tony friend]2860-my friend , [you]2860-my friend are late for the reading this afternoon . There is scarcely another half hour of light . How do [you]2860-my friend feel ? "[219-tony]

" [Rotten]4012-rotten . That drink does n't seem to agree with [me]219-tony . "[219-tony]

" [I]219-tony will give [you]2860-my friend something to make [you]2860-my friend better . [The forest]3576-the forest has remedies for everything ; to make [you]2860-my friend awake and to make [you]2860-my friend sleep . "[219-tony]

" [You]219-tony have n't seen [my]219-tony watch anywhere ? "[219-tony]

" [You]219-tony have missed it ? "[219-tony]

" Yes . [I]219-tony thought [I]219-tony was wearing it . [I]219-tony say , [I]219-tony 've never slept so long . "[219-tony]

" Not since [you]2860-my friend were [a baby]686-a baby . Do [you]219-tony know how long ? Two days . "[219-tony]

" Nonsense . [I]219-tony ca n't have . "[219-tony]

" Yes , indeed . It is a long time . It is a pity because [you]2860-my friend missed [[our]4015-our guests]2963-our guests . "[219-tony]

" [Guests]590-guests ? "[219-tony]

" Why , yes . [I]219-tony have been quite gay while [you]2860-my friend were asleep . [Three men from outside]4018-three men from outside . [Englishmen]2954-englishmen . It is a pity [you]2860-my friend missed [them]4018-three men from outside . A pity for [them]4018-three men from outside , too , as [they]4018-three men from outside particularly wished to see [you]2860-my friend . But what could [I]219-tony do ? [You]2860-my friend were so sound asleep . [They]4018-three men from outside had come all the way to find [you]2860-my friend , so -- [I]219-tony thought [you]2860-my friend would not mind -- as [you]2860-my friend could not greet [them]4018-three men from outside [yourself]2860-my friend , [I]219-tony gave [them]4018-three men from outside a little souvenir , [your]2860-my friend watch . [They]4018-three men from outside wanted something to take back to [England]13-england where a reward is being offered for news of [you]2860-my friend . [They]4018-three men from outside were very pleased with it . And [they]4018-three men from outside took some photographs of the little cross [I]219-tony put up to commemorate [your]2860-my friend coming . [They]4018-three men from outside were pleased with that , too . [They]4018-three men from outside were very easily pleased . But [I]219-tony do not suppose [they]4018-three men from outside will visit [us]4020-us again , [our]4020-us life [here]2433-here is so retired ... no pleasures except reading ... [I]219-tony do not suppose [we]4020-us shall ever have [visitors]4022-visitors again ... well , well , [I]219-tony will get [you]2860-my friend some medicine to make [you]2860-my friend feel better . [Your]2860-my friend head aches , does it not ? ... [We]4020-us will not have any Dickens to - day ... but to - morrow , and the day after that , and the day after that . Let [us]4020-us read _ [Little Dorrit]369-_ little dorrit _ again . There are passages in that book [I]219-tony can never hear without the temptation to weep . "[219-tony]

CHAPTER VII ENGLISH GOTHIC -- III

A light breeze in [the dewy orchards]2294-the dewy orchards ; brilliant , cool sunshine over meadows and copses ; the elms were all in bud in [the avenue]2183-the avenue ; everything was early that year , for it had been a mild winter .

High overhead among [its]2296-its gargoyles and crockets the clock chimed for the hour and solemnly struck fourteen . It was half - past eight . The clock has been irregular lately . It was one of the things that [Richard Last]287-colonel inch intended to see to , when death duties were paid and silver foxes began to show a profit .

[Molly Last]223-polly bowled up the drive on [her]223-polly two - stroke motor - cycle ; there was bran mash on [her]223-polly breeches and in [her]223-polly hair . [She]223-polly had been feeding the Angora rabbits .

On the gravel in front of [the house]2368-the house [the new memorial]2298-the new memorial stood , shrouded in a flag . [Molly]2299-molly propped the motor - cycle against the wall of the drawbridge and ran in to breakfast .

Life at [Hetton]7-hetton was busier but simpler since [Richard Last]287-colonel inch 's succession . [Ambrose]263-ambrose remained , but there were no longer [any footmen]2300-any footmen ; [he]263-ambrose and [a boy]2301-a boy and [four women servants]2302-four women servants did the work of [the house]2368-the house . [Richard Last]287-colonel inch called [them]2304-them [his]287-colonel inch " skeleton staff "[287-colonel inch] . When things were easier [he]287-colonel inch would extend [the household]1131-the household ; meanwhile [the dining - hall]2407-the dining - hall and [the library]587-the library were added to [the state apartments which were kept locked and shuttered]2308-the state apartments which were kept locked and shuttered ; [the family]915-the family lived in the morning - room , [the smoking - room]534-the smoking - room and what had been [[Tony]219-tony 's study]2311-tony 's study . [Most of [the kitchen quarters]2313-the kitchen quarters]2312-most of the kitchen quarters , too , were out of use ; an up - to - date and economical range had been installed in one of the pantries .

[The family]915-the family all appeared [downstairs]441-downstairs by half - past eight , except [Agnes]370-agnes , who took longer to dress and was usually some minutes late ; [Teddy]274-teddy and [Molly]223-polly had been out for an hour , [she]370-agnes among the rabbits , [he]287-colonel inch to the silver foxes . [Teddy]274-teddy was twenty - two and lived at [home]402-home . [Peter]371-peter was still at [Oxford]2-oxford .

[They]2317-they breakfasted together in [the morning - room]2912-the morning - room . [Mrs Last]372-mrs last sat at one end of the table , [[her]372-mrs last husband]916-her husband at the other ; there was a constant traffic from hand to hand to and fro between [them]2317-they of cups , plates , honey - jars and correspondence .

[Mrs Last]372-mrs last said , " [Molly]4023-molly , [you]4023-molly have rabbit - feed on [your]4023-molly head again . "[372-mrs last]

" Oh well , [I]372-mrs last shall have to tidy up anyway before the jamboree . "[372-mrs last]

[Mr Last]254-mr last said , " _ Jamboree ? _ Is nothing sacred to [[you]4023-molly children]4024-you children ? "[254-mr last]

[Teddy]274-teddy said , " [Another casualty at [the stinkeries]4026-the stinkeries]4025-another casualty at the stinkeries . [That little vixen [we]4028-we bought from [the people at [Okehampton]167-okehampton]4029-the people at okehampton]4027-that little vixen we bought from the people at okehampton got [her]4027-that little vixen we bought from the people at okehampton brush bitten off during the night . Must have got it through the wire into the next cage . Tricky birds , [foxes]4030-foxes . "[274-teddy]

[Agnes]370-agnes came next ; [she]370-agnes was [a neat , circumspect child of twelve]2320-a neat , circumspect child of twelve , with large grave eyes behind [her]370-agnes goggles . [She]370-agnes kissed [[her]370-agnes father]3161-her father and [mother]2445-mother and said , " [I]2445-mother 'm sorry if [I]2445-mother 'm late . "[2445-mother]

" _ If _ [you]370-agnes 're late ... "[2323-mr last] said [Mr Last]2323-mr last tolerantly .

" How long will the show last ? "[274-teddy] asked [Teddy]274-teddy . " [I]274-teddy 've got to run over to [Bayton]73-bayton and get some more rabbits for the foxes . [Chivers]373-chivers says [he]2323-mr last 's got about fifty waiting for [me]274-teddy . [We]4031-we ca n't shoot enough here . [Greedy little beggars]4032-greedy little beggars . "[274-teddy]

" It will be all over by half - past eleven . [Mr Tendril]252-mr tendril is n't going to preach a sermon . It 's just as well really . [He]252-mr tendril 's got it into [his]252-mr tendril head that [Cousin Tony]374-tony died in [Afghanistan]168-afghanistan . "[2445-mother]

" There 's a letter here from [Cousin Brenda]375-cousin brenda . [She]375-cousin brenda 's very sorry but [she]375-cousin brenda ca n't get down here for the dedication . "[274-teddy]

" Oh . "[2445-mother]

There was a general silence .

" [She]375-cousin brenda says that [Jock]187-jock has a three - line whip for this afternoon . "[2445-mother]

" Oh . "[2445-mother]

" [She]375-cousin brenda could have come without [him]187-jock , "[223-polly] said [Molly]223-polly .

" [She]375-cousin brenda sends [her]375-cousin brenda love to [us]4031-we all and to [Hetton]7-hetton . "[2445-mother]

There was another pause .

" Well , [I]223-polly think it 's a jolly good thing , "[223-polly] said [Molly]223-polly . " [She]375-cousin brenda could n't show much widowly grief . It did n't take [her]375-cousin brenda long to get hitched up again . "[223-polly]

" _ [Molly]223-polly ! _ "[2445-mother]

" And [you]223-polly know [you]223-polly think the same . "[223-polly]

" [I]2445-mother will not allow [you]223-polly to talk like that about [Cousin Brenda]375-cousin brenda , whatever [we]4031-we think . [She]375-cousin brenda had a perfect right to marry again and [I]2445-mother hope [she]375-cousin brenda and [Mr Grant - Menzies]256-mr grant - menzies are very happy . "[2445-mother]

" [She]375-cousin brenda was always jolly decent to [us]4031-we when [she]375-cousin brenda used to live [here]2433-here , "[370-agnes] said [Agnes]370-agnes .

" Well , [I]274-teddy should hope so , "[274-teddy] said [Teddy]274-teddy . " After all , it 's [[our]4031-we place]4034-our place . "[274-teddy]

* * * * *

The day was still fine at eleven o'clock , though the wind had got up , fluttering the papers on which the order of the service was printed and once threatening to unveil the memorial prematurely . [Several relatives]2324-several relatives were present , [Lady St Cloud]303-lady st cloud , [Aunt Frances]195-frances and [the family of impoverished Lasts who had not profited by [Tony]374-tony 's disappearance]2325-the family of impoverished lasts who had not profited by tony 's disappearance . [All the household and estate servants]2326-all the household and estate servants were [there]394-there , [several tenants]2328-several tenants and [most of [the village]579-the village]2329-most of the village ; there were also [a dozen or so neighbours]2331-a dozen or so neighbours , among them [Colonel Inch -- Richard Last]287-colonel inch and [Teddy]274-teddy had hunted regularly that season with [the Pigstanton]19-pigstanton . [Mr Tendril]252-mr tendril conducted the brief service in resonant tones that were clearly audible above the blustering wind . When [he]252-mr tendril pulled the cord the flag fell away from the memorial without mishap .

It was a plain monolith of local stone , inscribed :

[ANTHONY LAST OF HETTON]7-hetton EXPLORER Born at [Hetton]7-hetton , 1902 Died in [Brazil]105-brazil , 1934

When [the local visitors]2332-the local visitors had left and [the relatives]2333-the relatives had gone into [the house]2368-the house to be shown the new labour - saving arrangements , [Richard Last]287-colonel inch and [Lady St Cloud]303-lady st cloud remained for a short time on the gravel .

" [I]252-mr tendril 'm glad [we]4035-we put that up , "[252-mr tendril] [he]252-mr tendril said . " [You]303-lady st cloud know , [I]252-mr tendril should never have thought of it , if it had not been for [a Mrs Beaver]170-beaver . [She]170-beaver wrote to [me]252-mr tendril as soon as the news of [Tony]374-tony 's death was published . [I]252-mr tendril did n't know [her]170-beaver at the time . Of course [we]4035-we knew [very few of [[Tony]374-tony 's friends]4037-tony 's friends]4036-very few of tony 's friends . "[252-mr tendril]

" It was [her]170-beaver suggestion ? "[2333-the relatives]

" Yes , [she]170-beaver said that as [one of [[Tony]374-tony 's closest friends]4039-tony 's closest friends]4038-one of tony 's closest friends [she]170-beaver knew [he]374-tony would wish to have [some monument at [Hetton]7-hetton]4040-some monument at hetton . [She]170-beaver was most considerate -- even offering to arrange with [the contractors]4041-the contractors for it . [Her]170-beaver own plans were more ambitious . [She]170-beaver proposed that [we]4035-we should have [the chapel]658-the chapel redecorated as [a chantry]4043-a chantry . But [I]252-mr tendril think this is what [he]374-tony would have preferred . The stone comes from one of [[our]4035-we own quarries]4044-our own quarries and was cut by [the estate workmen]4045-the estate workmen . "[252-mr tendril]

" Yes , [I]303-lady st cloud think [he]374-tony would have preferred this , "[303-lady st cloud] said [Lady St Cloud]303-lady st cloud .

* * * * *

[Teddy]274-teddy had chosen [Galahad]230-galahad for [[his]274-teddy bedroom]2335-his bedroom . [He]274-teddy disengaged [himself]274-teddy from [the family]915-the family and hurried up to change out of [his]274-teddy dark clothes . Within ten minutes [he]274-teddy was in [[his]274-teddy car]3176-his car driving to [[Chivers]373-chivers ' farm]2338-chivers ' farm . Before luncheon [he]274-teddy was back with the rabbits . [They]2339-they were skinned and tied round the feet into bundles of four .

" Coming to [the stinkeries]4026-the stinkeries ? "[274-teddy] [he]274-teddy asked [Agnes]370-agnes .

" No , [I]274-teddy 'm looking after [Cousin Frances]376-cousin frances . [She]376-cousin frances got rather on [mother]2445-mother 's nerves through crabbing the new boiler . "[274-teddy]

[The silver - fox farm]2340-the silver - fox farm was behind [the stables]503-the stables ; a long double row of wire cages ; [they]2340-the silver - fox farm had wire floors covered with earth and cinders to prevent the animals digging [their]2340-the silver - fox farm way out . [They]2340-the silver - fox farm lived in pairs ; some were moderately tame but it was unwise to rely upon [them]2340-the silver - fox farm . [Teddy]274-teddy and [Ben Hacket]212-ben -- who helped with [them]2340-the silver - fox farm -- had been badly bitten more than once that winter .

[They]2340-the silver - fox farm ran up to the doors when [they]2340-the silver - fox farm saw [Teddy]274-teddy come with the rabbits . [The vixen who had lost [her]2342-the vixen who had lost her brush brush]2342-the vixen who had lost her brush seemed little the worse for [her]2342-the vixen who had lost her brush accident .

[Teddy]274-teddy surveyed [his]274-teddy charges with pride and affection . It was by means of [them]2340-the silver - fox farm that [he]274-teddy hoped one day to restore [Hetton]7-hetton to the glory that it had enjoyed in the days of [[his]274-teddy Cousin]2343-his cousin [Tony]374-tony .
